loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Hello Kiva Lenders! Meet Helen. Helen is a Finance Officer at Juhudi Kilimo’s headquarters in Nairobi.

She is a 30-year-old self-driven lady from Cheptinet which is a rural village on the base of the Great Rift Valley which runs through Kenya from Tanzania to Ethiopia. 

Helen is planning to enroll in Egerton University which is the oldest institution of higher learning in Kenya. She received the letter of acceptance from the university for a Bachelor of Commerce degree course. She is very excited about the opportunity.

Immediately after graduating from high school, Helen joined K-REP bank as a Clerk. Shortly afterwards, she was made an Accounts Assistant at K-rep Development Agency, a subsidiary of K-rep Bank which later  became Juhudi Kilimo.

“My strong conviction has always been to offer my acquired professional and technical skills to impact the society. At Juhudi Kilimo, I have found the opportunity to do so. We tackle poverty by empowering farmers to become agribusiness entrepreneurs by shifting from subsistence farming.” 

Helen seeks an educational loan to advance her knowledge and skills. She has the capacity to take on bigger challenges that come with the super-growing microfinance industry in Kenya and its ever-changing environment. 

Helen is the sole breadwinner in her family. Her five siblings are dependent on her contribution towards their educational fees. To Helen, the cost of going to a quality university like Egerton is quite prohibitive. 

With your loan, Helen is going to deliver the promise of elevating the quality of life made to smallholder rural farmers in Kenya. “Juhudi is undergoing a radical transformation. As part of the Finance team, I look forward to applying the newly acquired skills and knowledge into my role. Juhudi is at the point it requires strong leadership and strategic thinking to be able to deliver on our promises to farmers.” 

Helen is comfortable with the repayment period and the monthly repayments: She is confident the repayments will be made on time throughout the loan cycle. The classes are scheduled in the evening so that her work at Juhudi Kilimo remains uninterrupted.  

I hope you will invest in Helen’s future. Thank you for your time and consideration.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Meet Duncan, a rural farmer who lives on a small piece of land with his wife and four children in Litein, Kenya. He has been a farmer for the last 16 years. He makes ends meet selling milk, eggs, and tea produced on his farm. His hobby is milking ‘Milo’ (the name of his dairy cow). However, drought in the region usually leads farmers to take losses due to crop failure. Currently, Duncan can barely meet his family expenses. 

Duncan is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. This structure will enable his dairy animals to have access to clean drinking water. Cows need water to produce milk since water makes up 80% of milk. Without a shed, cows roam to the river and drink dirty water that brings about infections.Your loan will help Duncan improve animal health and milk production in his farm. The money from the increased income will repay the loan. In the long run, Duncan's family will enjoy more income.

loans.use: to construct a dairy shed.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 50 years old and married, with eight children.

Ma. Luz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 11,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Luz has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 27 years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Ma. Luz aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel de 61 años de edad, se a dedicado a la agrucultura desde los doce años solamente logro sacar 3° grado por cuestiones economicas vive con su esposa y sus siete hijos de los cuales dos le ayudan a realizar los labores agricolas.
 Miguel antes se dedicaba a las obras publicas pero tiempo despues se dedico solamente a los labores agricolas.
con el prestamo comprara los insumos para la siembra de maiz que ya esta cerca, aprovechando las primeras lluvias, los materiales que compraria son sulfato de amonió y herbicidas entre otros.
El sueño de  Miguel es que sus hijos tengan educación y que cada uno de ellos obtenga un trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Miguel is 61 years old and has worked in agriculture since the age of 12.  He only reached the third grade due to his financial situation.  He lives with his wife and their seven children of which two help him with his farm work.  Miguel used to work in public works, but after some time he dedicated himself solely to agricultural work.

With the loan, he will purchase supplies to plant corn, as the first rains will be coming soon and he wants to take advantage of them.  The supplies that he will purchase are ammonium sulfate and herbicides, among others.  Miguel's dream is for his children to have an education and for each of them to have a dignified job.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to plant basic grains such as ammonium sulfate and herbicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seed, manure, and pesticides to plant corn.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 69 años, esta casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y ya no viven con él, Vicente solo logro estudiar hasta sexto grado por motivos de fuerza mayor, por dicho motivo se dedico a la agricultura trabajo que lo realiza desde los 16 años. Al ser mas independiente tomo la desicion de casarse y formar un hogar, su esposa se dedica al oficio del hogar, él solo vive con su esposa ya que sus hijos al ser mayores de edad formaron su propia vida.

Vicente se ha dedicado a la agricultura y ganadería dicho trabajo lo aprendió de sus padre,  ha sido para él la fuente de empleo que ha tenido y la que le ha dado el ingreso económico con el cual le dio la educación a sus hijos y con el que tiene un hogar estable con su esposa. 

EL utilizara su crédito para cultivar ocho hectáreas de maíz, comprara semilla, abono y todos los materiales para la siembra de maíz, esperado obtener mejores ganancia para cancelar el credito que ha solicitado y poder tener un ingresos a su hogar.

Él afirma que su sueño mas grande es obtener un mejoramiento en la agricultura y poder ampliar el negocio de la agricultura.
texts.en:
Vicente is 69 years old, married and has three children who are adults and no longer live with him.  Vicente was only able to reach the sixth grade due to reasons beyond his control.  Due to this, he dedicated himself to farming, which he has been doing since the age of 16.  When he became more independent, he decided to get married and make a home.  His wife is a homemaker.  He only lives with his wife since his children are adults and have made their own lives.  Vicente works in agriculture and livestock, trades that he learned from his father.  This has been his source of work, and it has given him the income with which he was able to educate his children and have a stable home with his wife.

He will use the loan to grow eight hectares of corn.  He will purchase seed, manure and all other supplies needed to grow corn.  He hopes to generate better earnings to pay back the loan and to be able to have an income for his home.  He states that his dream is to improve his agricultural abilities and to expand his farming business.

loans.use: purchase seed, manure, and fertilizers to grow eight hectares of corn.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 31-year-old married man with a secondary education.  Because of his family's miserable living conditions, he couldn't complete his study. 

His neighbors have good things to say about him. They describe him as a kind and hardworking man.  Mostafa has sold groceries and food products for more than 25 years. He learned this business from his father. Thanks to his experience, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. He started this business with a amount of capital. 

He sincerely thanks AMB lenders who helped him in his first loan. That loan helped him to develop his business and purchase more items and goods for his grocery store. 

The profits from this business have allowed Mostafa to expand his sales volume. Mostafa asked another loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to further develop his business. He is requests 200,000 YER to buy wholesale food items to resell.

Mostafa plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business and open additional store branches.

loans.use: to buy wholesale food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and compost in order to work the land this year.

loans.name: Santa Elena

texts.es:
Santa es una mujer con muchas ganas de asalir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de 2 hijos a quienes quiere muchísimo y por quienes lucha cada día para poder salir adelante; es por ello que trabaja con mucho empeño como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola desde hace 4 años, ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Santa esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, asi como también realizar la compra de enseres y solventar algunos gastos de personales; asi ella podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Poder darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Santa is a very driven woman. She is eager to get ahead, especially because she is a single mother of two and she loves her children very much. They are her reason to keep fighting to get ahead. That is why for the past four years she has been working hard as a field laborer at a large farm. She thinks the reason why things are going well for her at work is because she is very responsible.

Santa is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to make improvements to her home, buy some items, and cover some personal expenses. This will allow her to improve her quality of life and keep working in order to make her dream come true, which is to give her children a good education.

loans.use: with home improvements and personal purchases.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn has a food market business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spices to sell in her food stall. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Ninfa works hard to support her family. She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF.

Ninfa is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy more spices to sell in her food market. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food market.

loans.name: Niña

texts.en:
Niña is 22 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Niña's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Niña is taking out a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Niña has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Niña would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Meet Moses who has been farming for five years on his small piece of land in Nyamira, an area of Kenya popular for tea and banana plantations. He sells eggs and tea from his farm into the local village markets. He also engages in small seasonal businesses to make extra money. He is very appreciative of the fact that farming is profitable. However, raising more capital to expand his operations to meet the demand is quite challenging. 

Moses is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle that will help him ferry his produce to the market. Currently, his highest monthly expense is transportation. The motorcycle will not only reduce this cost significantly, but also act as an additional source of income because he is going to offer transportation services to other farmers in the area at a much cheaper rate. Your loan will help Moses’ family get more income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a farm motorcycle.

loans.name: Arzak2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Arzak2 and it consists of four ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Arzak is a hardworking, married woman with one daughter who lives with her small family in a poor area in Aden. Her daughter is just one year old. Arzak is the leader of the group. She has started her business of selling women's clothes door-to-door for three years. She started her business with a small capital. The beginning was by taking a loan from AMB. She thanks the AMB leader for her first loan. 

Year by year, Arzak's business improves more, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. She has good experience in this business. Thanks to her experience, she deals with her business easily. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for another loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers. Arzak looks forward to expanding her business more and hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and resell them to her customers.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a widowed woman who has been blessed with seven children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kabibi has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal to sell. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a businesswoman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is married with eight children. She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient and clean cooking package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and thermally efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas Package

loans.name: Al Waed Al Sadek Group

texts.en:
Zalloukh is a 25-year-old married mother of three children. She is the featured borrower of “Al Waed Al Sadek” group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been best friends since they left their hometown in Syria after the existing war started. They are all working hard to develop their living and their acquired loan will be invested in a well-managed way to cover their needs.
 
Her husband’s income isn’t enough to cover their family’s needs and that’s why she started a year ago providing cleaning services to help cover their family’s increasing needs. Her acquired loan will be invested in buying a small piece of land, on which she will invest in a new business. She hopes to go back to Syria one day and hopes soon they can have peace.

She is the first lady on the right with a blue top. As for the other group members, Faten is the first lady at the far left side of the picture with a black top, Samira is the second from the left with a white top, and Jihan is the second from the right with a beige top. Thay are all Syrian citizens who left their hometown for a better life.

loans.use: to buy a small piece of land

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father of two young sons. For the past two years, Omar has been working raising doves. It is a good business, but risky and the costs are high. Omar wants to improve his business and expand it. 
Omar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help Omar to improve the barn and buy more cages for his business. By taking this loan, Omar will be able to increase the number of doves in his barn. 
Omar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to improve the barn and buy more cages for his business.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her buy-and-sell coconut wine vending business. 

She's been with NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Marisa will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Yena Isabel

texts.es:
Yena tiene 25 años, vive en la ciudad de ica y para poder tener ingresos y poder salir adelante trabaja como vendedora en una librería de su ciudad, Yena se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de una hija y por el es que se esfuerza y sacrifica día a día para poder darle una vida mejor.

Yena esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar los útiles para su hija y de esta manera poder enviarla a la escuela sin ningún contratiempo, de esta manera poder seguir luchando y trabajando para poder salir adelante y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Sacar adelante a su hija”.
texts.en:
Yena is 25 years old. She lives in the city of Ica and works at a local bookstore in order to generate her own income and make a living. Yena does her best to get ahead, especially because she has a daughter and wants to give her a better life. That is her reason to keep working hard and make sacrifices. 

Yena is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy supplies for her daughter so that she can go to school without any setbacks. She will keep working to provide for her daughter and fighting for a better life for her.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been in NWTF since 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

Merlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and has four children. Jocelyn is married and all of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 14 years and has borrowed twenty-four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Perfecta works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

Perfecta is borrowing PHP 8,500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Astrologo

texts.en:
Astrologo is 44 years old and married. She works very hard to provide their needs. 

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Astrologo has restarted her buy-and-sell coconut wine business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Astrologo has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of twelve children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from trisikad (cycle rickshaw) transportation. 

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 9,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 38 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 8,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Virginia has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her business of selling nipa roofing.

With your help, Virginia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Pola

texts.en:
Pola is a married woman who has been blessed with seven children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Pola has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 39 years old and single.  

Rica and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Rica is taking out a housing loan amounting PHP 10000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rica has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her buy and sell coconut wine and nipa roofing business.

With your help, Rica can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Kadzo wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk ,soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Meet Stephen, a farmer who lives in Nyamira, an area in western Kenya. Edward grows tea and vegetables on his small piece of land. He also keeps dairy cows and poultry. To provide for his family, blessed with 5 children, Stephen has been selling milk, eggs and tea produced on his farm for the last 43 years!  He also engages in other small personal businesses to make extra money.

He is very appreciative of the fact that farming has sustained him for this long because it is profitable. However, Stephen still has challenges raising more capital to expand his operations to meet the demand. 

Stephen is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. The tank will store clean water for domestic use, for crop irrigation and dairy animals. This tank will save Stephen and his family the tedious effort of fetching dirty water from the river every other day. The water tank will provide clean water for his dairy animals to drink and produce more milk without having to be led to the river. 
Your loan will help Stephen’s family work easier. Over time, they will realize and increase in income and improved livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Choern's Group

texts.en:
Choern is aged 42 and widowed with seven children. Her family lives in a village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province and she earns a living through farming rice and working as a paid worker. She is able to earn about 45,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

Choern has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. The past loans have helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now leading a group of two members to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going o use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for land plowing and labor. With this loan, she hopes to make more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Seap's Group

texts.en:
Seap, 33, is married with two children and resides in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for 11 years while her husband works as a hired worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about KHR27,000 per day and can save about KHR10,000 each day for future needs. 

Seap has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sert's Group

texts.en:
Sert, 30, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Sangke district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Sert and her husband earn a living by farming rice and fishing, earning about 19,000KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs. 

Sert has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fee

loans.name: Bunly

texts.en:
Bunly, 50, is widowed and has four children. Her family lives in a house with thatched roof, located in Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district and the main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee. She has been running her business for years, earning about KHR 60,000 per day and she is able to save about KHR 40,000 each day.

Bunly is just with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Manos Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Manos Emprendedoras está en el 3er ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. La mayoría de las integrantes realizan actividades productivas y las que no tienen proyecto de emprender una actividad para poder así ir aumentando sus ingresos. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, quien es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora, que se está esforzando por poder crecer e ir mejorando poco a poco por medio de su trabajo y con lo cual ayuda a sus seres queridos. Norma se dedica a la peluquería, y comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que se ha formado gracias al buen servicio que siempre da a sus clientes.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, cremas, tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus  clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The "Manos Emprendedoras" group is in its third loan cycle of the women entrepreneurs communal bank program, where everyone works and helps one another to succeed. The majority of the members have small businesses, and those that do not have plans to start one, so that they can gradually improve their incomes. 

One of the members is Norma, who is a very hard-working woman and above all very enterprising, who is doing her very best to be able to grow and improve little by little through her work and this way help her loved ones. 

Norma is a hairdresser and says that she has a very good clientele which she has acquired thanks to the good service she always gives her customers. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy hair dyes, creams, tints, shampoo, rinses and other items, and this way be able to continue serving her customers well. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, and which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, creams, tints, shampoo, rinses and other items.

loans.name: Maria Alodia

texts.es: María tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos. María es una mujer luchadora quien ha hecho todo lo que esta en sus manos para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva  de forma ambulante. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio y ya es muy conocida y preferida por los buenos productos y precios que ofrece. Ella solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso de la vivienda y para construir una canaleta para drenar aguas grises. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava y piedra. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 56 years old and lives in her own home along with her two children. Maria is a hard-working woman who has done everything that she can to get her children ahead in life. She works selling new clothing on foot. She has been in this business for a long time, and is very well-known and preferred for the good quality products and prices she offers. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the floor of her house and to build a waste drainage pipe. With the loan she is requesting she will buy cement, sand, gravel and rocks. She hopes to receive this funding so that she can improve her own living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and rocks to lay a cement floor and build a drainage pipe

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista's Group is comprised of two hard working women. 

Teopista is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past year, Teopista has been working hard to manage her small business in which sells fresh vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy different types of  vegetables for sale and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and add more capital to increase on her sales. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own a boutique. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy different types of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Isura Maria

texts.es: Isaura Maria mayor de edad madre soltera de un hijo independiente, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país,se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos los que compra a varias empresas cosmetiqueras, sus compras las realiza al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales da al contado y al crédito recuperando quincenal lo invertido, a parte de este negocio también vende diez litros de leche diario los que ofrece en su casa de habitación, también vende, helados, agua helada, frescos entre otros mas, negocio el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco tiene mayor demanda de clientes, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de Cosméticos como: perfumenes, maquillajes, cremas faciales, esmaltes de uñas, rubores, entre otros mas, Isaura agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Isaura Maria is an adult and the single mother of an independent son. She is originally from the municipality of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is characterized for being an entrepreneurial woman, with many hopes of personal advancement. She is a micro-entrepreneur who works selling cosmetics, which she buys upfront from a number of cosmetics companies. She has both regular and occasional clients, who she sells to in cash and on credit, collecting payments every two weeks. Apart from this business, she also sells ten liters of milk each day from her house, as well as ice cream, cold water, and fruit drinks, among other things. Her business has been growing gradually and now has higher client demand. With this loan, she will buy cosmetics, such as perfume, makeup, nail polish, blush, and other items. Isaura is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer to low-income people.

loans.use: to buy costmetics such as makeup, facial creams, shampoo, blush, eye and lip liner, and nail polish, among other things

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past year, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business selling soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks like soda and water for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and take good care of her self, such us buying new clothes. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own a salon. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like soda and water for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Celeste De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Celeste de San Mateo
Este dúo está formado por doña Mayra Alcira, ella tiene 37 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de animales, como conejos, cerdos, gallinas y venta de jabones naturales elaborados por ella misma, en su domicilio ubicado en San Mateo Milpas Altas desde ya hace 15 años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de marramos de engorde y compra de concentrado, así como material para la elaboración de sus jabones, su deseo es que Kiva la pueda ayudar para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Dúo Celeste de San Mateo

Doña Maria Alcira is one of the members of this duo. She is 37 years old and raises animals such as rabbits, pigs and chickens, and also makes and sells her own soap in her home in San Mateo Milpas Altas. She has been doing this for the last 15 years. She is requesting this loan to buy young pigs to fatten up, animal feed and material to make her soaps. Her hope is that Kiva can help her so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy animals (pigs) and materials to make soap

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en:
Nazira is 37 years old. Nazira has a special education. She is a seamstress. For some months, Nazira has run a sewing business. She manages the business successfully. Thanks to her good service, she has regular customers. Nazira sews national women's dresses as well European-style dresses. 

Nazira wants to develop her new business. Now, she is going to buy embroidery machine to make variety of embroideries in the dresses. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy an embroidery machine, increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for her new business

loans.name: Dúo Kairos De Peronia Group

texts.es: Dúo Kairos de Peronia,este dúo esta conformado por la señora Juana de 53 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de telas y venta de calzado de plastico desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta en su negocio, esperando que le puedad ayudar ya que de esa forma ella seguira creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en: One of the members of the Duo Kairos de Peronia is Sra. Juana, who is 53 years old and been selling fabric and plastic shoes for some years. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell at her business, and hopes that she will receive this help since it will allow her to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and plastic shoes to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es un hombre muy tarabajador, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa y se dedica a este oficio hace 9 años, ya que con ello ha podido salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar sus gastos. Jose siembra diversas clases de cultivo,  como culantro, maíz, yuca, sandia, y tambien pesca; lo cual le permite poder obtener productos para su alimentación y asimismo venderlos y de esta manera poder subsistir; es por ello le pone mucho empeño y dedicación ya que de este oficio depende su progreso día a día.

Jose esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar semillas, sembrar una parte de la tierra y comprar fertilizantes y abono ´para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo y así seguir esforzándose para salir adelante y hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una parcela más grande y poder mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
José is a very hard-working man who lives in the city of Pucallpa and has been in his line of work for 9 years, which has allowed him to get ahead in life and cover his expenses. José plants different kinds of crops, like cilantro, corn, yucca and watermelon, and he also fishes. This allows him to feed himself as well as sell these products for his subsistence. This is why he puts a lot of hard work and dedication into his work, since his day to day progress depends on it. 

José is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to buy seeds, plant part of his land and buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his crops and continue to work hard to get ahead in life and make his great dream a reality: to have a larger plot of land to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en:
Neonita is 58 years old and married. Neonita works very hard to provide for her family.

Neonita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Neonita has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, and sugar. 

In the future, Neonita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a divorced woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Alice has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Alice is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José de 49 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta segundo grado,  actualmente está soltero se separó con su señora y a él le quedaron los tres hijos, actualmente vive  con ellos y la hermana de José,  los hijos van a la escuela,  y su hermana de vez en cuando hace sus ventecitas para ayudar con los gastos  de la casa y de esa manera poder tener la comidita diaria. 

Por su parte José se dedica a la a la agricultura desde hace 18 años,  vale mencionar que no tiene más quien le ayude es él quien hace el trabajo de la agricultura,  siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados  de maíz y 3,500 de frijol  todo esto lo aprendió de su padre quien desde muy pequeño le enseño a trabajar siendo que ellos no contaban con los recursos económicos necesarios para estudiar. El lugar de trabajo le queda a unos 10 minutos de su casa, ya que el terreno es propio y lo hace solo l. El horario es de 6 de la mañana a 11 de la mañana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz, aprovechando que ahorita los fertilizantes están a bajo precio,  él quiere aprovechar  de comprarlos dice que si este préstamo es aprobado le beneficiara de gran manera ya que ahorita él no tiene dinero para comprar los fertilizantes y le preocupa porque ya el invierno viene cerca y ya quiere estar preparado. 

José dice que sus sueños son seguir cultivando, que Dios le preste vida para que a sus hijos no les falte lo necesario y que puedan estudiar para que en el futuro sean sus hijos personas de bien. Y con este préstamo en Dios espera que este año sea de bendiciones para él en su trabajo y  sus frutos sean buenos.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and has a second grade education. He is currently single, since he and his wife separated and he was left with their three children. He currently lives with his children and sister. His children are in school, and his sister sometimes sells things to help with household expenses and earn each day’s food. 

José has been working in agriculture for the last 18 years, and doesn’t have anyone to help him. He plants 10,500 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans, which his father taught him how to do at a young age since they did not have the economic resources needed to allow him to go to school. The land, which is his own, is just 10 minutes from his house, and he works there alone from 6am to 11am. 

José is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to buy fertilizers to plant corn; he wants to take advantage of the fact that fertilizer prices are currently low to make the purchase. He says that if this loan is approved, it will be of great benefit to him, since at the moment he doesn’t have the money to buy fertilizers and this worries him because winter is coming soon and he wants to be prepared. 

José says that his dreams are to continue to plant, that God grants him life so that his children do not lack basic necessities, and that they can study so that in the future his children will be good people. With this loan, he hopes that God will bless him in his work and that his harvest will be good.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to plant corn

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase fruits, biscuits, vegetables, maize, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase fruits, biscuits, vegetables, maize, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello lender! Meet Jane, a mother of  five, from Nyamira, a rural town in Kenya popular for banana growing. For the past 19 years, Jane has been selling milk and tea crops produced on her farm. 
Nothing gives her a warmer feeling than feeding Ethugo, her dairy cow. Her biggest challenge is generating income.
Jane is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. This will help in her efforts to introduce a zero-grazing model of farming. "The cows will save the energy that gets used up looking for pasture and drinking water," she said. Rather, she will be cutting grass and feeding the animals in their unit. Water will also be stored in the tank next to the cowshed. This will significantly reduce Jane's farm-related costs. 
Jane will generate enough income to repay the loan. Eventually, Jane's family will start enjoying the benefits that come with an increase in income.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Blanca Adilia

texts.es:
Blanca de 43 años de edad, es una persona que estudio hasta sexto grado, actualmente está acompañada su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura, ya que esa es su fuente de ingreso, ella no trabaja solo apoya a su compañero de vida en la agricultura y  es la que pasa haciendo los oficios en su casa. Blanca tiene tres hijos mayores de edad,  pero un hijo ya se acompañó y vive en una casita aparte, con Blanca viven su esposo, dos hijos y una nuera.

Blanca se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 11 años, con el apoyo de su compañero de vida, este trabajo ella lo aprendió de sus padres que desde siempre han cultivado y de eso ellos a salido adelante con esfuerzos, Blanca dice que ella viendo la necesidad decidió involucrarse también a la agricultura dice que con lo que siembran han ido sacando adelante a sus hijos, ellos no tienen ninguna otra actividad económica, el terreno donde ella cultiva le queda a un lado  de la casa significa que ella con su compañero de vida se levantan a las 5 de la mañana a iniciar la jornada hasta las 11 de la mañana.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar los fertilizantes para ir preparando el terreno donde este año van a cultivar. Con este préstamo, ella mejorara ya que están preocupados porque ahorita no cuentan con el dinero para comprar y ahorita el precio de los fertilizantes está un poco cómodo y ella quiere aprovechar para comprar y estar listos para iniciar a cultivar


Sus sueños son tener salud siempre para ayudarle a su compañero de vida a sembrar,  porque ella sabe que de eso es que ellos sobreviven.  Ella sueña que con esfuerzo un día podrá mejorar  su casita, ya que está en mal estado pero tiene fe que van a tener una casita digna.
texts.en:
Blanca is 43 years old and has a 6th grade education. She is currently accompanied by her life partner and works in agriculture, which is her main source of income. She works along with her life partner in agriculture, and is also responsible for taking care of the home. Blanca has three children who are all adults, but one of them already has a partner and lives in his own house. Blanca lives with her husband, two children and her daughter-in-law. 

Blanca has been working in agriculture for the last 11 years, with her partner's support. She learned the work from her parents, who have always been farmers and with that have been able to work hard and get ahead. Blanca says that she too saw the need to start working in agriculture, and with what she plans she has been able to help her children get ahead in life. She doesn't have any other economic activities. The land she works is beside her house, and she and her partner wake up at 5am to start their workday, then work until 11am. 

Blanca is requesting a loan from CrediCampo to buy fertilizers to treat the land that they are going to plant this year. With this loan, she will be better off, since they are currently worried about not having the money to buy fertilizers, and right now prices are good so she wants to take advantage of the opportunity to buy so that they can be ready to start cultivating. 

Her dreams are to always be in good health so that she can help her partner plant, because she knows that this is how they make a living. She dreams that with hard work, one day she will be able to fix up her house, which is currently in bad shape. She has faith that one day she will have a dignified home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to start preparing the land where she will plant this year

loans.name: Toern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Toern is 50 years old and widowed. She has three children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 31,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the first loan for Toern with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crop yields and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: José Israel

texts.es:
José de 62 años de edad,   estudio hasta 9º grado, se encuentra viudo, tiene dos hijos uno varón de 19 años que estudia 9º grado y una hembra de 14 años que estudia 8º  grado, él se dedica  al oficio de sastre, desde hace 50 años, y que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos para la elaboración de pantalones y camisas, el negocio lo tiene en su hogar, oficio que realiza todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para pagar un crédito en una institución financiera y el resto para consumo. Sus metas a un futuro son mejorar el negocio de la sastrería, y poner una tienda para que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de prepararse y salir adelante.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old and went as far as ninth grade in school. He is a widower and has two children: a 19-year-old boy who is in ninth grade and a 14-year-old girl who is in eighth grade. 

He has been a tailor for 50 years, and his children help him in the making of pants and shirts. The business is in his home, and it is an occupation he engages in every day. 

The loan he is requesting is to pay off a loan at a financial institution and the rest is for personal use. His future goals are to improve his tailoring business and to establish a store so that his children can have the chance to be educated and succeed in life.

loans.use: To pay off a loan at a financial institution and the remainder for personal use.

loans.name: Solomi's Group

texts.en:
Solomi's group is composed of three hard-working women. Solomi is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She has one child, who is currently in school. For the past six years, Solomi has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Solomi has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more body lotions and hair products for the shop to sell. That will help Solomi generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child and take care of her mother's medical bills. Solomi hopes that in the future she will be able to own a poultry farm. 

Solomi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more body lotions and hair products for the shop to sell.

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Ana tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su hijo de 17 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas pupusas. Tiene 5 años de contar con este negocio y cada día son más las personas que la prefieren. Ana desea construir un  corredor en la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, polines, pines y para pago de mano de obra para la respectiva construcción.
texts.en: Ana is 50 years old and lives in her own home, along with her husband and their 17-year-old son. She makes and sells delicious pupusas. She has had her business for five years, and each day there are more people who prefer her pupusas. She wants to build a corridor in her home, and is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, rollers and pins and to pay construction workers.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, rollers, pins and to pay construction workers to build a corridor

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Robina has been working hard to manage her small business, selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Robina has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell, and will help Robina to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Robina hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Robina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 20 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 1 1/2 years, Anna has been working hard to manage a cattle business selling domestic animals. 

To help expand her business, Anna has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other domestic animals such as goats, to sell. It will help Anna to generate greater profits and own a poultry farm. Anna hopes that in the future, she will be able to have a business of her own, since she is helping her mother with the cattle business. 

Anna is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more domestic animals such as goats to sell

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both currently in school. For the past two years, Jolly has been working hard to manage her clinic, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Jolly has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for the clinic. This will help Jolly generate greater profits and help pay school fees for her children. Jolly hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her clinic that she can start admitting her patients. 

Jolly is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more drugs for the clinic.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rose Marie is 26 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Rose Marie's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Rose Marie is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rose Marie has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rose Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her house.

loans.name: Marlie

texts.en:
Marlie is 30 years old and married with seven children. Marlie works very hard to provide for them.

Marlie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marlie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marlie has taken a PHP 8000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marlie is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Lilian. She lives in Nyamira, a rural town in Kenya. She has 4 children. Lilian has been involved in agriculture for only 2 years.  She gets by selling eggs and tea produced on her farm. She also has other personal businesses that give her an extra income.

She finds poultry farming quite profitable. Low funds are limiting her ability to grow her asset base to be more productive. Lilian is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. The demand for eggs and meat is skyrocketing in Nyamira and the Kisii region. With more poultry, Lilian will significantly increase her supplies to meet the demand and also tap into other markets.

The income Lilian projects from the additional poultry will adequately cover the loan repayments. Your loan will go a long way in helping Lilian generate more income to help her pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren lives with his big family in the village of Aygehovit in the Tavush region. For 15 years, Suren has worked in the Tavush region as a policeman. He also owns a farm and productive fruit garden and also cultivates a great variety of vegetables. On his farm, Suren has a breeding cow, a calf, two piglets and 30 chickens. Suren’s family members greatly help him run the farm. His father and mother help him with land cultivation, his wife takes care of the farm cattle and sells eggs and dairy products such as milk, cheese, and macun (Armenian national dairy-product).  Suren is a very clever and skilled farmer and every season he manages to have a good harvest of persimmon, apples of different varieties, and plums to sell. 
Suren also wants to develop his swine breeding and this loan would help him buy several piglets and fodder for his farm cattle. He sends his greetings and hopes for support from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and fodder for farm cattle.

loans.name: Dailyn

texts.en:
Dailyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and been with NWTF since 2013. She is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Dailyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Dailyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Peninah, a mother of five from Nyamira in rural Kenya. Peninah has been involved in farming for 10 years! Her primary income sources are tea, bananas and other personal businesses.

From her experience, dairy farming is not only profitable but also enjoyable: All the animals on her farm are referred to by names. The challenge, however, is that growth is constrained by limited funds/capital. 

Peninah is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She has been keeping poultry for fun for many years. Recently, however, she was taught how poultry is a big business if made commercial. She feared the high costs involved in setting up a commercial poultry farm at first, but after looking at the projections, she sees the point.
 
Invest in Peninah's future. The income she will generate from her poultry farm alone is enough to facilitate timely loan repayments and savings. The loan will help Peninah’s family improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 30 years old and single.  

Daisy and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and their family home was wiped out. 

Daisy is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Daisy can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Las Preferidas Group

texts.es:
Blanca (se encuentra en el centro de la fotografía) ella es una mujer soltera de 51 años de edad, vive junto a sus dos hijas ambas mayores de edad, actualmente residen en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Desde hace 10 años Blanca se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, decidió emprender este negocio porque es una actividad rentable, y además de ello obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables. Comenta que también se dedica a la venta de alimentos y  lo vende en su vivienda. Estas dos actividades la han ayudado a salir adelante junto a su familia.
Ahora ella ha decidido formar un grupo con el propósito de mejorar la economía de sus familias a través de la labor que realizan. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de productos de consumo diario, de esta manera podrán ampliar la venta de abarrotes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos a sus clientes.
El sueño de Blanca es incrementar sus ganancias, ya que desea asegurar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca, who can be seen in the center of the photograph, is a single, 51-year-old woman. She lives with her two adult daughters in the Department of Suchitepequez.

For the last ten years, Blanca has been selling dry goods, a business she chose to start because it is profitable, and it allows her to earn an acceptable income. She says that she also sells prepared food from her home. These two activities have allowed her to get ahead, along with her family. 

Now, Blanca has decided to form a group with the goal of improving the economic situations of all of the families involved through their work. The loan will be used to buy basic goods, so that she can expand her dry goods business and offer a variety of products to her clients. 

Blanca’s dream is to earn more, since she wants to ensure her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy dry goods to expand her business

loans.name: Roeng's Group

texts.en:
Roeng, 54, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province; she is married with six children. The main family’s source of income is from rice farming on three hectares of farmland. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day but she can earn about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Roeng has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income in order to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
Rat is aged 29 and married. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she has three children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 15 years and she is able to earn about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Rat has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Rat wants to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of the loan for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sok Boern's Group

texts.en:
Sok Boern is 34 years old and married. She is a mother of three children. To earn a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 16 years and supplement their family’s income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 46,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Sok Boern’s group consists of four members who live in the same village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. Leading her group to apply for a loan, Sok Boern, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Abrabopa Group

texts.en:
This group is called 'Abrabopa' (lead good life) and consists of four members who are all hard-working. They live in Dansoman-Accra, Ghana, and are requesting a loan of GHS 2,800 from ID Ghana, Kiva's field partner. 

Adiki, 36 years old, is married and is the featured borrower. She studied until secondary school but couldn't complete her studies. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. She wants to improve the condition of her house by purchasing soft drinks and selling to customers. She has requested a loan of GHS 1,000 in order to purchase soft drinks.

Adiki looks forward to increase her savings with ID Ghana and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Rom is a 49-year-old mother of five children. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and working for others for a fee. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 43,000 per day for daily expenses. 
This is the fifth loan for Rom with VisionFund and she fully repaid previous loans. Now, Rom is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive en una comunidad del departamento de Jinotega, al norte de Nicaragua. Tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 4 años con su esposa. Desde hace 5 años, está dedicado al cultivo de café como principal actividad económica, a través de la cual también genera empleo en su comunidad en época de mantenimiento y cosecha. Este emprendedor está integrado a los procesos de certificación de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices, promovidos por la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC).

 

La visión de Carlos es incrementar su área de café, dadas las condiciones del área donde se ubica su finca y la rentabilidad de este rubro. Para ello, está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita establecer 2.1 hectáreas de café adicionales a las 7 hectáreas con que cuenta, lo cual le permitirá incrementar su producción al término de 3 a 4 años, e ir mejorando las condiciones de su familia. El está seguro que con el manejo adecuado que garantice a sus plantaciones para obtener buenos rendimientos y el precio mínimo que tiene garantizado al estar certificado por Comercio Justo podrá hacer frente a esta inversión.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in a community in the department of Jinotega, in north Nicaragua. He and his wife have two children, who are three and four years old. For the last five years, he has been farming coffee as his main economic activity, which also generates jobs in his community during crop tending and harvest seasons. This entrepreneur has participated in the Fairtrade, UTZ and C.A.F.E. Practices certification processes, which are promoted by the Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC).

Carlos’ vision is to expand the area where he plants coffee, given the conditions of the area and the profitability of this line of work. Therefore, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to establish an additional 2.1 hectares of coffee in addition to the 7 he already has, which will increase his production over the next three to four years and allow him to improve his family’s living conditions. He is sure that with proper care and maintenance, his plantations will have good yields, and the Fair Trade minimum purchase price that he is guaranteed to receive will allow him to repay this investment.

loans.use: to plant 2.1 hectares of coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an environmentally friendly cooking energy package using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Las Campeonas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Las Campeonas es un grupo nuevo que se formó a partir de las buenas experiencias de los grupos vecinos. El grupo tiene 15 integrantes, donde todas se dedican a la actividad rural de cría de animales de corral.
 Una de las integrantes la Sra. Luz quien se dedica a la cría de animales, es una señora muy emprendedora y guapa,  se siente agradecida por formar parte de la Fundación, ya que a través del programa de comité podrá capacitarse y mejorar su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para poder seguir en la cría de sus animales. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibió de poder seguir capacitándose y creciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Campeonas". The group is new but brings together the members' experiences. There are fifteen members in the group and all work raising farm animals.

One member of the group is Luz, who raises farmyard animals. She is a very enterprising and good-looking woman. She is grateful to be a part of "Fundación Paraguaya" as, through the women's committee programme, she will be able to receive training and improve her life.

Luz is applying for this loan in order to buy animal feed to continue raising her animals. Luz is grateful for the opportunity to continue with training and to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Mujeres Emprendedoras se encuentran en el 6to ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres. El grupo tienen 15 mujeres todas con un objetivo en común, ayudar a mejorar la situación de vida de sus familias. 
Una de las integrantes de comités es la señora Silvia, una señora joven muy emprendedora y trabajadora quien lucha día a día para salir adelante. Su trabajo es criar animales y venderlas a la par que realiza las labores de la casa, comenta que puede realizar todo  tipo de trabajo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para poder seguir con la cría de sus animales. Todas ellas son mujeres muy emprendedoras que luchan por salir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Emprendedoras" group is in its sixth loan cycle in the women's communal bank program. The group has 15 women, all with one objective in common: to help improve the living situations of their families.

One of the group members is Silvia, a very enterprising and hard-working young woman who strives day by day to succeed. Her work is raising animals and selling them, along with her work in the home. She says she can do all kinds of work. 

She is requesting this loan so that she can purchase balanced feed and continue raising her animals. All of the group members are very enterprising women who are striving to succeed.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Zam has been working hard to manage her business selling paper bags. 

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more paper materials for making paper bags. It will help Zam to generate greater profits and add more capital to increase her sales. Zam hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a big wholesale shop. 

Zam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more paper materials for making paper bags

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete, in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past year, Christine has been working hard to manage her small business, in which she sells snacks. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal and cooking oil for the business and will help Christine to generate greater profits and cater to her young sisters' school fees. Christine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own another business that would be a wholesale shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Dúo Amanecer De San Mateo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Amanecer de San Mateo
Este dúo está formado por  doña Soledad, ella tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de refacción , aguas gaseosas, golosinas panes con jamón y queso, frutas congeladas y tostadas en la escuelita ubicado en San Mateo Milpas Altas por las tardes, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de abarrotes, como aguas, golosinas, panes así como carnes  para surtir mas su negocio, su deseo es tener mas productos para los niños. Asi como mejorar la economía de su familia,
texts.en:
Dúo Amanecer de San Mateo

One of the members of this group is Doña Soledad, who is 29 years old and works selling snacks, water, soda, candy, ham and cheese sandwiches, frozen fruits and tostadas in the afternoons at the San Mateo Milpas Altas school. She is requesting this loan to invest in basic foods like water, candy, bread and meat so that she can offer a wider variety of products to the children. This should improve her family’s economic situation.

loans.use: to buy basic food items like water, candy, bread and meat to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es una mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre de una pequeña a quien ama mucho y por la cual se tiene que esforzar cada día para poder tener ingresos para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar; es por ello que con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de venta de emolientes; el emoliente e suna especie de refresco caliente para el frio y tiene este negocio desde hace varios años; Felicitas cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque prepara sus emolientes de manera muy deliciosa.

Felicitas esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar insumos para preparar sus emolientes y reparar el triciclo en el cual transporta y vende su productos, asi ella podrá trabajar de mejor manera y seguira luchando para hacer relidad su gran sueño:” Construir su vivienda y darle una buena educaión a su hija”.
texts.en:
