Felicitas is a very hard-working woman, above all because she is a the mother of a little girl, who she loves very much and for whom she works hard each day to earn income and bring home the daily bread. This is why she worked hard to start her business selling emolientes, a hot drink made to drink in the cold. She has had this business for a number of years, and she believes that she does well because she’s very friendly with clients and above all because the emolientes she prepares are very delicious. 

Felicitas is grateful to Kiva lenders, since their help will allow her to buy ingredients to prepare her emolientes and repair the tricycle she uses to transport and sell her products. This will allow her to work better and continue fighting to make her great dream a reality: to build a home and provide her daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make emoliente (a hot drink)

loans.name: Cristina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cristina es una señora de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, una ciudad conocida por la zona productiva y comercial, además porque en ella habita la etnia Tsachila.
Cristina es una señora muy trabajadora, hace 3 años ella recorre ciudades vendiendo ropa, visita a clientes fijos y además va de feria en feria vendiendo toda su mercadería, con estos ingresos ella ha podido sacar adelante a su hija, le ha dado el estudio y ha podido apoyarle en lo que esté a su alcance.
Cristina es una clienta fiel a Fundación Alternativa, se siente muy agradecida porque gracias a todos estos créditos recibidos en la institución ella ha podido crecer con su negocio. Ahora solicita un crédito para la compra de más mercadería como blusas, pantalones, shores y demás ya que desea recorrer otras ciudades donde las ventas son muy buenas, ella ha estado sondeando el mercado para ir a vender allá. Agradece a Kiva y a la institución por este apoyo brindado durante este tiempo, con estos ingresos poco a poco irá ahorrando para en un futuro ponerse un local fijo.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 27-year-old woman who lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city which is known for its productive and commercial zones. She is also a member of the Tsachila ethnic group. 

Cristina is a very hard-working woman who for the last three years has worked selling clothing. She visits regular clients and also goes from market to market selling her merchandise. With this income, she has been able to get her daughter ahead in life, as she has been able to keep her in school and help her to the extent that she is able. 

Cristina is a loyal client of Fundación Alternativa, and she is very grateful since thanks to all of the loans she has received from the institution, she has been able to grow her business. She is now requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, such as blouses, pants, shorts and other items, since she wants to travel to other cities where sales are very good and she has been collecting information on the market so that she can go there to sell.  She is thankful to Kiva and Fundación Alternativa for the support they have given her, and with this extra income she will save up gradually so that in the future she can open her own store.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 33 years old, has a live-in partner, and is the mother of one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Emily's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Emily has restarted her fish-vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Emily is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Emily has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Emily would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Delmy Marina

texts.es:
Delmy de 40 años de edad, está casada, estudio hasta tercer grado, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años, con Delmy viven sus cuatro hijos y su esposo.

Delmy se dedica a la agricultura, este trabajo ella lo aprendió de su abuelo que la llevaba a ella cada vez que iba a la milpa a preparar el terreno para cultivar, ella dice que le costó acostumbrarse a andar bajo sol, aguantando hambre y haciendo cosas que ella no esperaba hacer, con el tiempo la necesidad a ella la obligo a tener que hacer ese trabajo.  Delmy aparte de hacer la milpa con su esposo también hace ventas en su casa cada domingo.  Ella prepara frescos, yuca frita y mango picado ahorita que esta la cosecha y con eso que ella vende le sirve de mucho para cubrir otro tipo de necesidades que tiene, a unos diez minutos de su casa le queda la milpa y la cancha donde va a vender a una media hora. Su esposo le colabora mucho en lo que hace, su horario ella se lo pone dependiendo cuanto trabajo tenga acumulado. 


Con el préstamo ella le ayudara a su esposo a comprar los fertilizantes que utilizara para la siembra de la agricultura, como abonos, semilla de maíz, pesticidas y herbicidas, comenta que esta esperanzada que con este préstamo lograra comprar a más bajo precio ya que ahorita los precios de los fertilizantes están a más bajo precio. Con el préstamo se ayudaría a si misma, ya que pretende invertir en el pequeño negocio que ella tiene, dice que los clientes le dicen que llegue a vender pupusas pero ella porque no tiene los recursos económicos no lo ha hecho; pero si tiene el deseo de hacerlo.

Los sueños que ella tiene son de seguir cultivando el maíz con el esposo, para llevar el sostén de la casa y que sus hijos no sufran de la comida esto lo lograran con el esfuerzo de seguir trabajando la tierra.
texts.en:
Delmy is 40 years old and married, and has a third grade education. She lives with her four children and her husband, who has been working in agriculture for five years. Delmy works in agriculture, which she learned from her grandfather, who brought her along each time he went to the farm to prepare the terrain for planting. She says it was hard to get used to walking in the sun, going hungry and doing things she hadn’t planned to do, but over time she had to start working on the farm due to necessity. Apart from the farm, which she runs with her husband, Delmy also sells from her home on Sundays. She prepares fruit drinks, fried yucca and chopped mango, which is in season. These sales help her to cover other needs that she has. Her farm is ten minutes from her house, and the soccer field where she goes to sell her products is 30 minutes away. Her husband is a great help, and she determines her own schedule based on how much work she has to do. 

With this loan she will help her husband buy fertilizer for planting, as well as corn seeds, pesticides and herbicides. She says that she hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy at a lower price, since fertilizer prices are currently low. With this loan she will also help herself, since she will invest in her own business. She says her clients tell her that they want her to sell pupusas. She hasn’t yet done so due to lack of economic resources, but she does want to.  

Her dreams are to continue to grow corn with her husband to support her household, so that her children are never hungry. They will achieve this by working hard on their land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed, pesticides and herbicides

loans.name: Elvia Esperanza

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas es una ciudad conocida en Ecuador, porque es el puente que une a la sierra y la costa y además porque en ella habita la etnia Tsachila, por ello el nombre de la ciudad. Aquí habita Elvia es una señora de 62 años, separada hace varios años, actualmente vive con un hijo, su nuera y su pequeña nieta en una pequeña vivienda, los cuatro la comparten.
Elvia es una señora muy trabajadora, recorre vendiendo cloro y también por la tarde a partir de las dos hasta las 7 de la noche se dedica a vender asados en su barrio, su negocio es muy concurrido por la sazón de Elvia. Ella es cliente de Fundación Alternativa varios años, ha trabajado con la institución por la agilidad de sus créditos, además por el buen servicio brindado.
Elvia solicita un pequeño crédito para la compra de cebolla, carne, aliños, arroz porque además de vender sus asados también va a preparar comida para vender en las noches, con ello podrán mejorar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo en el negocio. Se siente muy agradecida con la institución y el proyecto Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas is a city that is well-known in Ecuador, since it is the bridge that joins the mountains and the coast, and also because the Tsachila ethnic group for which the city is named lives there. This is where Elvia, a 62-year-old woman who has been separated for many years, currently lives with her son, daughter-in-law and her young granddaughter, in a small house that the four of them share. 

Elvia is a very hard-working woman who goes around selling bleach, and also sells grilled meat in her neighborhood from 2pm to 7pm. The business is very popular because of Elvia’s seasonings. She has been a client of Fundación Alternativa for a number of years, and works with the institution because of the speed of their loan disbursements and the good service they offer. 

Elvia is requesting a small loan to buy onions, meat, spices and rice, since in addition to selling grilled meats she also prepares other food to sell at night. This will allow her to increase her income and continue to grow with her business. She is very grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the help they provide.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and food

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa  estudio hasta 9º grado debido a la situación económica que vivía su familia, esta casada, su esposo estudio hasta 3º grado, madre de 9 hijos 4 varones y 5 hembras, 6 hijos están acompañados, dos viven en casa y los otros en el extranjero,  Felipa es ama de casa,  y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura de hortalizas la cual hace fuera de la comunidad y lo hace por temporadas.  Una parte del préstamo sera para pagar crédito vigente y lo restante lo utilizara en la compra de material para la construcción  de su vivienda lo que comprara es bloque, hierro y cemento. Con ello estará contribuyendo al desarrollo familiar.
El sueño de Felipa es tener un negocio propio para que sus hijos puedan prepararse y salir adelante, ya que eso vendría a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Felipe went to school up until 9th grade, due to her family's economic situation. She is married. Her husband went to school up until 3rd grade. She is the mother of 9 children: 4 boys and 5 girls. Six of her children have partners, two live at home, and the rest live abroad. Felipa is a housewife and her husband works farming vegetables. He does this work seasonally, outside of the city. A part of this loan will pay an existing loan and the remainder will be used to buy material for her house's construction. She will buy cinder blocks, steel, and cement. This loan will contribute to the family's development. 

Felipa's dream is to have her own business so that her children can prepare themselves and get ahead, as having her own business would improve their income.

loans.use: to pay an existing loan and the remainder will be used to buy material for her house's construction, such as cinder blocks, iron, and cement.

loans.name: La Blanca Group

texts.es:
La Blanca  es un grupo que está en su 1er ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ayudarse y salir adelante.
Sara una de ellas se dedica a hacer comidas con sus propias manos, y que luego sale a vender de forma ambulante. Ella es una mujer muy buena en lo que hace, y está luchando por ir creciendo y mejorando cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder capacitarse e ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, condimentos, carnes, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas y deleitando a sus clientes. Ellas están contentas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo y que les permitirá seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
La Blanca is a women's group in its first loan cycle.  Everyone in this group promises to work and help one another get ahead.  They are trying to do their part in eliminating poverty.

Sara is one of these women.  She makes a living making foods with her own two hands.  She then sells her food door-to-door.  Sara is good at what she does and she is fighting to continue growing and improving each day.  She is thankful for this training opportunity and to ultimately enhance her quality of life.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables, condiments, meat, and other ingredients she needs to make the foods that her customers love.  

These group members are happy to receive this financing opportunity, which allows them to continue improving and working.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a small house in the city. Bilal opened a mini market in the city where he sells basic consumption products. It is a good business and the only one in his neighborhood. Bilal would like to improve his store and expand it in the future.
 
Bilal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more items for his mini market. By taking this loan, Bilal will be able to increase his sales and his income.

Bilal appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to buy more items for his mini market.

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es: Daniel tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su abuela. Daniel trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y mantiene la economía de su familia Daniel desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo y del piso de la vivienda para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: tejas, polines, hierro, cemento, arena, ladrillo de piso, etc. Espera poder contar con este apoyo dado que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso pero si con la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Daniel is 22 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife and grandmother. He is employed at a business close to his neighborhood, and this is how he covers household expenses and supports his family. Daniel would like to improve his family’s living conditions, which is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof and floor of his home, for which he will need to buy materials like roof tiles, poles, iron, cement, sand, and floor tiles. He hopes to receive this loan, given that he doesn’t have enough upfront capital available but is able to make the monthly repayments that the loan would require.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles, wood poles, iron, cement, sand, floor tiles, etc., to repair his roof and lay a cement floor in his home

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa. Mario trabaja como ayudante de albañilería y su esposa trabaja como empelada doméstica. Juntos se ganan la vida honradamente y mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para reconstruir las paredes de la vivienda con material más seguro y duradero por lo que con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc. Espera poder  contar con este financiamiento y  así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Mario is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his wife. Mario works as a construction assistant, and his wife works as domestic help. Together, they earn an honorable living and are able to cover all their household expenses. With the goal of improving their living conditions, Mario decided to request this loan from FUSAI to rebuild the walls of their home with more solid, safe materials, and he will use this loan to buy cement, bricks, iron, etc. He hopes to receive this loan so that he can give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc., to build the walls of his home

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irenea is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Irenea's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her buy and sell of used clothing business and is committed to regain what she lost. Irenea is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Irenea has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Irenea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 33 years old and married with two children.

Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, cigarettes and other groceries.

Daisy has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Daisy aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, noodles, cigarettes and other groceries

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Norma works hard to support her family.

Norma has a frozen foods business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fufu and cow skin

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es:
Cristhian está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería en electromecánica, y comenta que está estudiando para poder ser un profesional que pueda servir a las demás personas.
Él está luchando por poder cumplir con sus metas, y de esa forma poder retribuir a su familia todo lo que han hecho por él.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cristhian is studying electro-mechanical engineering and states that he is studying so that he can become a professional who can be of service to others.
He is struggling to accomplish his goals and in this way to repay his family for all that they have done for him.

He is asking for this loan to cover his tuition so that he can continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Revendeur de sacs(friperie) depuis 2010, Mr Koffi sollicite un troisième prêt pour renforcer son activité. Il espère à l'avenir agrandir son activité et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants de 12 et 10ans qui sont scolarisés. Mr Koffi quant à lui est âgé de 42ans.
texts.en: Koffi has been reselling second-hand bags since 2010.  He is taking a third loan to boost his business.  In the future, he is hoping to expand his activity and take care of his children's education.  He is married and the father of two children, ages 10 and 12, who both go to school.  Koffi himself is 42 years old.

loans.use: to buy handbags.

loans.name: Shlifah

texts.en:
Shlifah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small retail shop where she sells phone credit or phone airtime. 

Shlifah is requesting a 600,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase more phone credits for different networks and to buy phone lines to sell to expand her business. She will use her loan to generate greater profits and pay for school fees for herself. In the future, Shlifah hopes to become an accountant. 

Shlifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase phone credits for different networks and to buy phone lines to sell

loans.name: Birama

texts.fr:
BIRAMA  est né à KEBILA, commune de KEBILA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mr  BIRAMA est âgé de 52 ans, il est père de 11 enfants et réside à FAKOLA avec sa famille dans une famille traditionnelle.
Mr BIRAMA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de produits vétérinaires. Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA chez lui à la maison.  
Forte de  ses 20 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième  prêt.
Mr BIRAMA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 cartons de produits vétérinaires. II s’approvisionne à BAMAKO.II effectue ses ventes au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes ;
Mr BIRAMA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Birama was born in the town of Kebila, in the Kebila commune, one of the districts of the third administrative region of Mali.  He is 52 years old and the father of 11 children.  He lives in a traditional family in Fakola.

Birama became interested in income-generating activities early in life.  Specifically he became involved in buying and selling veterinary products.  He sells his products from home, in Fakola.

With 20 years of experience  in his field, he has now joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase his business and meet the needs of an increasing group of customers.  This is his second loan.

Birama is planning to use his loan to buy three boxes of veterinary products.  He stocks up in Bamako.  He sells for cash and his customers are men.  He is hoping to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs which will be used to meet his family's needs, to repay his loan and re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy veterinary products.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago quiere ser un buen profesional, útil a las demás personas, por lo que se está esforzando bastante.
Está estudiando la carrera de veterinaria, que le permitirá abrirse camino y poder asistir a los animales que tanto le gusta. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto y seguir luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Santiago wants to be a good professional and helpful to others.  He is therefore working very hard to make his dreams come true.

He is studying on track to become a veterinarian.  This type of profession would open up many opportunities for him and allow him to attend to all the animals that he likes so much.  He is grateful for this opportunity and believes that it will help him a great deal.

Santiago is requesting this loan to pay his university fees.  In doing this, he will be able to cover university registration expenses and thereby continue fighting to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ronal Ajustin

texts.es: Ronal tiene 26 años de edad, es un joven responsable que labora como obrero textil en una zona franca, junto a su esposa procrearon 2 hijos quienes están en edad escolar. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar el muro perimetral del lado frontal de su vivienda, con el apoyo de financiamiento podrá realizar esta mejora tan importante sobre todo para resguardar la seguridad de sus hijos ya que habita en una zona muy populosa.
texts.en: Ronal is a 26-year-old, responsible young man that works as a textile worker in a free trade zone. Ronal and his wife have 2 school-age children. He is asking for this loan so that he can buy construction materials to build an outer wall on the front side of his house. With financial support, he will be able to do this essential improvement to keep his children safe, as they live in a heavily populated area.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, steel, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Ma. Charisma

texts.en:
Ma. Charisma is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Ma. Charisma has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to rebuild her general store.

Ma. Charisma is requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She will use her loan to rebuild her home and secure the future of her family. With your help, Ma. Charisma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en:
Norayr is 51 years old and lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. He graduated from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute in the Department of Industrial Electronics and received a specialty of electronic technical engineer. For many years, Norayr worked in his specialty and now also he works at the Kapan city combine as an electrician-locksmith. Norayr is married and his wife works at the kindergarten. The couple has two sons: Norayr’s elder son works at the Fire and Rescue Center and his younger son is a business trader. Norayr managed to save some money to repair his house, but some tasks are left half-done. He has spent his savings but still needs to update electrical wires and repair his bathroom.

Norayr is requesting a loan to update the worn electrical wires in his flat and complete needed bathroom repairs.

loans.use: to update the worn electrical wires in his flat and complete needed bathroom repairs

loans.name: Pjoasa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pojoasa está en el 9 no. ciclo, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo de apoco, así son todas las señoras muy emprendedoras y quieren avanzar y crecer por medio de su trabajo y ayudar a cada una de ellas y a sus familias.
Gloria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Comenzó con muy poco, pero se ha abierto camino y  hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos. Quiere poder crecer en su negocio, es por eso que se está esforzando bastante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, panificados, bebida y demás para poder surtirse y el día de mañana cumplir su meta de tener un negocio más grande. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de crecer y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
texts.en:
The Pojoasa Group, in its 9th loan cycle, is a very entrepreneurial group that grew little by little. This group consists of enterprising women who want to make progress and grow and help each woman of the group and their families. 

Gloria is one of the group's members. She is a hard-working woman who makes a living selling items at her small general store. She works every day starting very early in the morning. She started with very little, but now she has a very good customer base who always buys from her. She puts in a lot of effort because she wants to be able to grow her business. 

She is asking for this loan so that she can buy vegetables, meat, baked goods, beverages, etc., to stock her store and, starting as soon as possible, achieve her goal of having a bigger business. 

All of the women appreciate this opportunity they have been given to grow and to help each other.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, baked goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a small house in the city. Ahmad opened a grocery store a year ago and sells basic consumption products. It is a good business and the only one in his neighborhood. 

Ahmad is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to expand his store and buy more items to sell. He will use his loan to increase his sales and also his income. In this photo, Ahmad appears in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy items for his grocery store

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem is 35 years old and lives in Kadjaran city in the Syunik region. He is married and has two sons and a daughter. Artem has no higher education and, for many years, has worked as a worker at different factories and workshops. His wife is also employed and she tries to help her husband to sustain their not-small family. Artem feels happy since he finally he bought a flat in Kadjaran city for his family.

Artem is requesting a 500,000 AMD loan to purchase some furniture for their new flat.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his family's new flat

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. Antonina restarted her business and has been a member of NWTF since 2013.

Antonina is requesting an 8,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business. With your help, Antonina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz está casada, tiene hijos ya todos grandes,  vive en la ciudad de Pilar, y su marido también trabaja y de esa forma se están ayudando los unos a los otros.
Ella está haciendo la especialización en entornos visuales que le permitirá desarrollarse como persona y como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de título, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Luz is married and has children who are all grown. She lives in the city of Pilar. Her husband also works, so they are able to help one another.

Luz is studying for a specialization in Visual Environments, which will allow her to develop as a person and as a professional. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay for her certification since this is an existing expense that needs to be covered.

loans.use: to pay for her certification expenses.

loans.name: Lukia's Group

texts.en:
Lukia's group is comprised of two hard working women. Lukia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Lukia has been working hard to manage her beauty salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Lukia has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair relaxers and hair treatments for her salon in order to attract more clients. This will help Lukia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Lukia hopes that in the future she will be able to build a residential house of her own. 

Lukia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more hair relaxers and hair treatments for her salon, to attract more clients

loans.name: Mariziel

texts.en:
Mariziel is 24 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. Mariziel is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. 

Mariziel requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Mariziel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Josphine, a farmer in Nyamira, a rural town in Kenya. She has been working on her small piece of land, for the last four years, to fend for herself and take care of eight children. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, vegetables and other personal businesses. She has stuck with farming because she finds the activity profitable and enjoyable.

With more funds, Josphine sees no impediment to continuous growth. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry. The demand for eggs and meat is higher than the supply in Nyamira town and its environs. The prices are constantly on the rise too. The additional income Josphine is projecting will help with her high family expenses. This loan will help Josphine’s family live a more decent life in the long run. Through generation of more income, they will have better diets, a decent shelter and better education.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a married woman with six children, five of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 36 years old.

Roselyn has a business farming corn in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Roselyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Meldred is 28 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Meldred has a fishing business in the Philippines. Meldred requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Meldred has been in this business for five years. Meldred would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 47 years old and lives in the village of Tsav in Syunik region. Anush has no higher education. For several years, she worked at a local school as a gardener. Now she works at a private workshop as a cleaner, and at the same time, she is engaged in farming and agriculture. 

Anush raises apple trees and potatoes, and sells them at the city wholesale market. She has 30 chickens and she sells both eggs and poultry meat. Anush manages everything about the farm alone, since she is divorced. Her elder son lives with her husband, her daughter is already married, and she lives with her family. Only her smallest son lives with her, but he is school-aged and does not manage to help his mother over their farm. 

Anush says that all the work that she does is of great pleasure for her, and if there would be some financial support, she will have better results at the end of each season, and more income as well.
 
Anush asks for a loan of 250,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) since she wants to buy potato seedlings and some diesel fuel for land cultivation activities.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and some diesel fuel for land cultivation activities.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 31-year-old Gladys from Harare. She is married with two children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Gladys runs a retail business, selling weaves, school-wear, and clothing. The business has been in operation for five years. 
She says the main challenges faced are capital constraints and competition from other players in the industry. 

Gladys has requested a loan of $300 to purchase weaves and school-wear. She says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to grow her business, which will translates into more profits, and hopes to improve her lifestyle. 

In the future, Gladys plans to own another shop in Chitungwiza.

loans.use: to buy weaves and school-wear for resale.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
Asif is a 35-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his spouse and three children. He is a retailer in a crockery shop by profession and he has been doing his business for the past 10 years. He is a guardian of his family and responsible for managing the entire household. 

Asif needs to buy different types of crockery items for resale, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to buy this merchandise for his business. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, he will easily purchase crockery to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn maximum profitable income. For this financial support, Asif is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of crockery for resale

loans.name: Afzal

texts.en:
Afzal, a 47-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his spouse and three children. He is the guardian of his family and responsible for fulfilling their needs.

Afzal has owned a small hotel for the past 10 years. He needs to buy a variety of commodities in bulk such as sugar, rice, milk and flour for his business and so has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. 

Afzal is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To buy a variety of foodstuffs

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 52-year-old Eunice from Harare. She is single with two children, and only one is attending school. She also cares for her old father. 

Eunice runs a retail business, selling electrical goods and hardware products. The business has been in operation for 16 years. She says that the main challenges faced are low sales from the period of January up to March, and stiff competition. 

Eunice has requested a loan of $500 to purchase electrical goods for resale. She says that the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to take her children to better schools. 

In the future, Eunice plans to extend her business to other towns by opening more branches.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for resale.

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema is 45 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Gema works very hard to provide for them.

Gema runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks, such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to resell.

Gema has been in this business for 17 years, and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Gema would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of snack foods, canned goods, noodles, soft-drinks, detergent soap, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen is 43 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She graduated from Vanadzor State Medical College in the faculty of nursing and medical work. She has worked for 15 years at the clinic of Vanadzor State Medical College as a senior nurse. Ashkhen is married and has two sons. Her older son is employed and her second son is a student at the medical college. Her husband is a furniture maker. Ashkhen is very worried and sad since lately her husband has had some problems with his health and feels weak.

She needs this loan in order to pay for her husband’s medical examinations at the city hospital. She hopes that there is nothing seriously wrong with her beloved husband. All the family members are thankful for Kiva support.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s medical examinations at the city hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and affordable cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlene is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Arlene has a handicraft business in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business. Arlene has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna is 55 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Digna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Digna has been pig fattening for two years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk lives in Yerevan city. He has no higher education. Manuk used to work as a supplier; now he works as a driver-bodyguard. 

Manuk is married and has a son and a daughter. His son now studies at the paid division of Yerevan State Economical University at the faculty of Marketing and Business Management. Since Manuk once made a mistake and lost his chance to have higher education, he greatly wished that his children would never do the same. He did his best to support his son to have private courses and pass the entrance examinations. 

Unfortunately, now Manuk has some financial problems, and moreover it is time to pay for his son’s education for the second semester. Manuk is asking for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the second semester. 

He expresses his thanks beforehand and hopes that Kiva lenders will help him in such a hard and urgent situation.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.name: Hanif

texts.en: Hanif is a 45-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his family and he is a father of three children. By profession, he is an owner of a cloth shop. He sells different varieties of cloth. He has been doing his business for 10 years. Hanif needs to buy different varieties of cloth to sell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy cloth in bulk. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can easily fulfill his business needs, earn a more profitable income and increase the size of his business. For this financial support, Hanif is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cloth in bulk to resell

loans.name: Bernardette

texts.en:
Bernardette is 30 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for the family.

Bernardette runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like detergent soap, milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, milk, coffee, sugar, shampoo, etc. 

Bernardette would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like detergent soap, milk, coffee, sugar, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers and children's clothing for her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario vive en concubinato desde hace 7 años y tiene 3 hijos, Mario vive en la comunidad POMAMAYA en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa solo tiene luz y agua Mario se dedica a la agricultura y tambien es funcionario publico, trabaja en una alcaldia. Mario necesita un credito para comprar una vaca que le ha ofrecido uno de sus vecinos. Mario es ayudado por su compañera que fabrica quesos y los vende en distintas comunidades pero la inversión que quiere hacer requiere de ayuda externa
texts.en: Mario has lived with his partner for 7 years and he has 3 children. Mario lives in the community of Pomamaya in an adobe house that he owns. The house only has electricity and water. Mario works in agriculture and is also a civil servant. He works in a mayor’s office. Mario needs a loan to buy a cow that his neighbors have offered him. Mario is helped by his partner, who makes cheeses and sells them in several towns, but this investment he would like to make requires external help.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Ovidio

texts.es: Ovidio es soltero  y no tiene hijos, vive en la comunidad de Achicabaja en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a su familia y solo tiene luz Ovidio es albañil y debe trabajar en alturas considerables y sufrir riesgos de caida Ovidio necesita dinero para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer una tienda en su hogar lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos, Ovidio no tiene a quien recurrir por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Ovidio is single and doesn’t have children. He lives in the community of Achicabaja in an adobe house that belongs to his family and it only has electricity. Ovidio is a mason and has to work in high places where he runs the risk of falling. Ovidio needs money to buy construction materials in order to build a store in his house that will allow him to have more income. Ovidio doesn’t have anyone to go to, so that is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a store in his house.

loans.name: Rumilda

texts.es:
Rumilda está estudiando y trabajando al mismo tiempo, comenta que sui objetivo es poder terminar su carrera, y poder ayudar a las personas de la sociedad.
Su mayor sueño es abrir para su propio consultorio, ya que está estudiando la carrera de odontología y poder tener con ello mayores ingresos económicos y ser renombrada en la ciudad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por su meta.
texts.en:
Rumilda is studying and working at the same time. She states that her objective is to be able to finish her degree and help people.

Her greatest dream is to open her own practice as she is studying dentistry and with her own office she can higher earnings and be well known in her city. 

She is asking for this loan to pay for her university tuition fees so that she can continue studying and fighting for her goal.

loans.use: To pay university fees.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre de 61 años de edad. José trabaja como mecánico automotriz en un taller cercano a su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio para lo cual necesita materiales como: hierro, cemento, arena, ladrillo y además pagará la mano de obra para la construcción del mismo.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old and resides in his own home along with his 61-year-old mother. He works as an automobile mechanic at a repair shop near his town. This is how he earns a living and is able to sustain his household.

With the intent of improving his living conditions, José decided to request a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the construction of a bedroom, so he needs materials such as iron, cement, sand, and bricks. José will also pay for the construction labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor in order to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Ajmal

texts.en: Ajmal is a 33-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his spouse and two children. He is the only one responsible for managing the entire household. By profession, Ajmal is an owner of a cosmetics retail shop. He has been doing his business for 10 years. Ajmal needs to buy different types of cosmetics items for reselling purposes but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy this merchandise. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can easily purchase the cosmetics products for reselling purposes so that he can earn a favorable income derived from his business. Ajmal is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive en El Alto, en una casa de ladrillo y cemento, donde también vive su prima Julia es costurera y necesita un prestamo para comprar materiales de costura Julia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Julia is single and doesn’t have children. She lives in El Alto, in a house of brick and cement, where her cousin also lives. Julia is a seamstress and needs a loan to buy sewing materials. Julia is the only source of income for her household, and this is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides vive en concubinato desde hace  4 años y tiene dos hijos, Alcides tiene alojados a sus padres en una casa de adobe, la familia vive en la comunidad de Ajllata Alcides es pescador y esta sometido a peligros por las lluvias Necesita un credito para comprar redes  y arreglar su bote Alcides es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Alcides has lived with his partner for 4 years and he has two children. Alcides’s parents live with him in an adobe house. The family lives in the community of Ajllata. Alcides is a fisherman and is subject to the dangers of the rains. He needs a loan to buy nets and to fix his boat. Alcides is the only source of income for his household, which is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy nets and to fix his boat.

loans.name: José Napoleon

texts.es:
José de 78 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado de nivel académico, es viudo la esposa falleció ya hace 15 años le dejo uno de los hijos muy pequeños, él solo vive con sus dos hijos por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de él.
 
José tiene un molino desde hace 20 años a eso se dedica a moler, esto lo aprendió solo viendo la necesidad de poner un molino ya que en la zona para esa época no habían, desde entonces el molino ha sido su fuente de ingresos y eso le ha servido de mucho ya que con esos ingresos le dio el estudia a un hijo que ya salió de bachiller; este molino lo tiene en la casa muele de las 7 de la mañana a las 9 am y por la tarde de las 3pm a las 5 estas dos jornadas y en esto le ayuda sus dos hijos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar reparaciones del molino ya que el molino ya está viejo y le hace falta un repuesto. Quiere comprarlo para que este siempre le genere ingresos y así pueda tener el alimento para  sus hijos y que nunca les falte las cosas de comer. 

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando en el molino y que en su vejez les de a sus hijos los que ellos necesiten y que cuando él falte le quede el molino para que ellos sigan trabajando y asi aprendan bien el oficio y puedan defenderse de una u otra manera.
texts.en:
José is 78 years old and has a third grade education. He is a widower since his wife died fifteen years ago, leaving him to care for one child who was still very young at the time. José now lives with his two children, both of whom are dependent on him.

José has been operating a grain mill for 20 years. He found out on his own that the area where he lives did not have a mill at the time. Since then, his grain mill has been a source of income that has helped one child with getting an education and graduating from high school. His mill is in operation in the mornings from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 A.M. and in the afternoons from 3:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M. During these two shifts, José has the help of his children.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to pay for repairs to the mill, which is old and is missing a part. He wants to pay for these repairs so that he can always generate an income for feeding his children and preventing them from going hungry.

His dreams include allowing God to always provide him with life so that he can continue working at his grain mill. In his old age, José would like to see that his children’s needs are met. When he dies, he will leave behind the grain mill so that they can continue working. This will allow them to become good at this trade so that they can support themselves.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his grain mill.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BALIMAYA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  27 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme  DJENEBOU  (1ère sur la photo de la droite  à la gauche) compte acheter avec son prêt 14 bidons de lait de 20 litres chacun. Elle vend quotidiennement à FAKOLA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à FAKOLA et environnant. Elle vend au comptant à une clientèle mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are married women with an average age of 27 years and an average of 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Fakola, one of the districts of the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

The women have partnered with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to improve all aspects of their business. They are on their first loan with the organization and plan to fully repay it.

Djenebou (pictured furthest on the right in the photo) plans to use her loan to purchase 14 barrels of milk of 20L each. She makes her sales daily in Fakola and is much sought after, especially on festival days. Djenebou stocks up in Fakola and in the surrounding area. She makes her sales for cash to a customer base made up of both men and women. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase milk

loans.name: Jaime Alonso

texts.es:
A sus 59 años, Jaime es un hombre de múltiples ideas para progresar y salir adelante, y es que este individuo no es una persona fácil de derrumbar y siempre está buscando opciones.
Es de esta manera como divide su trabajo como parrillero con su actividad independiente de vender productos de la plataforma Amway.
Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para ayudar a sus padres que ya están avanzados en edad y padecen de algunas enfermedades.
El necesita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de productos de esta reconocida marca y así poder aumentar su inventario, de esta forma venderá más cantidad de productos y generara más ingresos para su familia.
Su principal desafío es la delicada situación de salud de sus padres pero su mayor sueño es tener un gran restaurante donde pueda vender comidas a muy buenos precios.
texts.en:
At 59 years old, Jaime is a man with many ideas of how to progress and get ahead in life. He's a person that isn’t easily discouraged and he’s always looking for options.

It’s because of this that he divides his time between working as a meat griller and his independent business selling Amway products.

This idea came from the need to earn more income in order to help his parents, who are now elderly and suffer from some illnesses.

He needs a loan to buy products of this recognized brand so that he can augment his inventory. That way he will sell a larger quantity of products and generate more income for his family.

His main challenge is the delicate situation of his parents’ health. His greatest dream is to have a big restaurant where he can sell food at very good prices.

loans.use: to buy Amway products to stock his inventory.

loans.name: Hilario Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Hilario Antonio habita en el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, una ciudad donde los pobladores son trabajadores y buscan la forma cómo sobrevivir en mejores condiciones.  

 Hilario Antonio es un joven de 45 años de edad Casada, con tres hijos a su cargo, de profesión y oficio recolector de vasura labora en uno de los centro del estado, su esposa es ama de casa, comenta que se sienten a gusto con este tipo de empleo.

 Son de sus sueños llegar a obtener mejores condiciones en su propia vivienda, esta es su segunda solicitud de crédito realizada a Ceprodel y Kiva espera en dioz que esto le ayuden con un nuevo financiamiento, para la compra de: Ladrillo, Cemento y Arena, esto le sería de gran beneficio para ir construyendo mejor su vivienda. 

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, donde a través de kiva y Ceprodel le van cumpliendo sus sueños de tener una mejor vivienda
texts.en:
Hilario Antonio is a youthful man who resides in the municipality of Achuapa in the Department of León. The residents of this city are hardworking and looking for ways to live under better conditions.

Hilario Antonio is 45 years old, married, and has three dependent children. He works as a garbage collector at one of the state centers. His wife is a homemaker. Hilario says that he feels comfortable with this type of work.

His dreams include improving the conditions in his home. This is the second loan that he has requested from CEPRODEL and Kiva. He hopes to receive the help of a new loan so that he can buy bricks, cement, and sand. This will be of great benefit as he makes construction improvements to his home.

Hilario appreciates the support from CEPRODEL and Kiva. He hopes that God will allow him to continue receiving this privilege. Through Kiva and CEPRODEL, he will be able to fulfill his dream of having a better home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and sand for making home improvements.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Mr BOUBACAR est âgé de 36 ans ;il est père de 2 enfants. Mr BOUBACAR réside à FAKOLA quartier KOKO chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle.
Mr BOUBACAR s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente de produits vétérinaires. Sa vente se fait à FAKOLA.  
Forte de  ses 4 années d’expérience dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  quatrième prêt.
Mr BOUBACAR compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 cartons de produits vétérinaires. Il s’approvisionne à FAKOLA. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit à une clientèle est mixte.
Mr BOUBACAR espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Boubacar is 36 years old and is the father of 2 children. He lives in Fakola, in the Koko neighborhood, with his father in a traditional family. 

Boubacar quickly became interested in small business, especially in the purchase and sale of veterinary supplies. He sells his items in Fakola. 

With 4 years of experience in this area, Boubacar has partnered with Soro Yiriwaso to increase his business capital in order to meet the ever-growing needs of his customers . He is on his fourth loan.

Boubacar plans to use his loan to purchase 3 boxes of veterinary supplies. He stocks up in Fakola, and makes his sales for cash and sometimes for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. He hopes to earn a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA which he will use to provide for his family's needs, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase veterinary supplies

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years now.

Bernardita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Bernardita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marcelina works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making fermented fish. 

Marcelina successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Marcelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire cacao plants and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Dúo Sajcavilla Group

texts.es: Dúo Sajcavilla El Dúo está formando por doña  Deura de 36 años de edad quien es la líder, ella  tiene  una hija  y es madre soltera  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de delantales  típicos tiene 11 años elaborándolos y vendiéndolos en distintas areas de su localidad (San Juan, San Pedro, y Guatemala) ella solicita su crédito para la compra de materiales (tela de corte, listones, brichos, hilos,  aplicaciones etc.) ya que ella ahorra mas comprando por mayor todo su material y este le ayuda a economizar mejor en su negocio,  su meta es lograr incrementar su capital para poder incrementar mas su negocio y poder tener empleados ya que es una gran fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
“Sajcavilla” Group

This group includes Doña Deura, age 36, who is the leader. She is a single mother with a daughter. Deura has been producing and selling traditional aprons for 11 years in different areas near where she lives (San Juan, San Pedro, and Guatemala). She is requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as cut fabric, ribbons, gold leaf, thread, appliqués, and other items. Deura saves money by purchasing all of her materials in bulk. This helps her business to become more thrifty.

Her goal is to increase her capital so that she can expand her business and acquire more employees. Her business is already a great source of income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy cut fabric, ribbons, gold leaf, thread, appliqués, and other items for making aprons.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 35-year-old married woman and the responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Asia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Asia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, and he can provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Asia  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Asia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to mantain her husband's taxi

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making sleeping mats. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice-vending business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Abid

texts.en:
Abid is a 36-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his spouse and two children. He is the only one responsible for managing the entire household. 

By profession, Abid is an owner of a cosmetics retail shop. He has been doing his business for ten years. Abid needs to buy different types of cosmetic items for reselling but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy this merchandise for his business. Therefore he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan, he can easily purchase these cosmetic products for reselling so that he can earn a favorable income derived from his business. Abid is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of cosmetics for reselling.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “El Buen Samaritano” conformado por 07 socias responsables y trabajadoras. Miriam de 37 años separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Hace más de 6 meses que se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares. Se siente orgullosa pues cada vez mejora su negocio y ayuda a sus padres. Su último crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de cuadernos, laminas, fólderes y plumones. El deseo de Miriam es de ampliar su negocio y ofrecer más productos. El grupo “El Buen Samaritano” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Miriam se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado derecho,  viste bivirí color plomo.
texts.en:
This is the group “El Buen Samaritano”[The Good Samaritan] consisting of seven responsible and hardworking members. 

Miriam is 37 years old, she is separated with one dependent child. She has been selling school supplies for over 6 months. She feels proud that she is continually improving her business and helping parents. The last loan she requested will be used for the purchase of exercise books, prints, folders and felt tip pens. Miriam wishes to expand her business and offer more products. 

The group “El Buen Samaritano” would like to thank those who made this loan possible. Miriam is standing, she is the first on the right hand side, wearing a grey tank top.

loans.use: to buy exercise books, prints, folders and felt tip pens.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 54 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She  runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store. Carmencita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bath soap, shampoo, cooking oil, cereals, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 51 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, cigarettes, noodles, and other groceries.

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish. Rosalia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, soap, shampoo, cigarettes, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Droste

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Droste works hard to support her family. She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Droste is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle transport business. Droste has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food and fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Elena earns additional income from a general store.

Elena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and ingredients for her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, rice, liquor, charcoal, juice, sugar, powdered milk, curls, etc. for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. Jocelyn earns more income from fishing, boarding house rental and a billiard hall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, rice, liquor, charcoal, juice, sugar, powdered milk, curls, etc.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 51-years-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Sialkot, Pakistan with his spouse and five children. He is the guardian of his family and responsible for managing the entire household. 

By profession Amir is an owner of a shoe retail shop. He has been doing his business for seven years. Amir needs to buy different varieties of shoes and slippers in bulk for reselling, but due to some financial constraints, he is unable to buy these shoes and slippers. Therefore he has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can fulfill his business needs and purchase sufficient varieties of shoes and slippers for reselling.

Amir is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of shoes in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eve is 36-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Eve has a business selling natural and herbal products in the Philippines. Eve requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell.

Eve has been in this business for one year. In the future, Eve would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nunik

texts.en:
Nunik lives in the village of Vazashen in Tavush region. She lives here with her single daughter, who has already graduated from school and greatly wants to have higher education. Nunik has vocational education and a specialty of nursing. For many years, she worked in her specialty in Yerevan, then in the Russian Federation, but since 2003 she has been engaged in farming and agriculture. 

Now on her farm, she has 4 piglets, 30 chickens and a large plot of land on which she cultivates wheat. Her fruit garden is colored by the harvest of apples, peaches and pear trees. Some part of her farm goods she manages to sell, and the other part she uses for her small family. 

Nunik has a great wish: to be able to pay for her daughter’s private courses that will help her to pass entrance examinations and have a higher education. This will be possible only through good income from her farming and agriculture. So, she will use this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy some more chickens and fodder, both for her piglets and chickens as well. 

She hopes that by making her farm richer, the income from it will also be bigger so that she can help her daughter to have higher education.

loans.use: to buy some more chickens and fodder for her piglets and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, red oil, dry fish, and charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is 46 years old and an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his spouse and two children. He is the only one responsible for managing the entire household. By profession, Imran is an owner of a cosmetics retail shop. He has been doing his business for ten years.

Imran needs to buy different types of cosmetics items for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to buy this merchandise for his business. Therefore, he has applied to Kiva for a loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can easily purchase the cosmetics products for reselling so that he can earn a favorable income from his business. Imran is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Gerasim

texts.en:
Gerasim is 55 years old and he lives in the village Khashtarak in Tavush region. Gerasim graduated from Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute. For many years, he worked as a teacher of mathematics at the village school. Now he is a director of the same school. Gerasim is married and he has two sons. As Gerasim says, his family is a family of pedagogues. His wife and elder son also work at the same school.

Gerasim is also a perfect and skilled farmer. He has five beehives and he has a large fruit garden, where he raises the sweetest and the tastiest persimmons and dewberries. He says that the sale of his fruit harvest and the honey that his bees give brings a decent income for his family. Thanks to it, he managed to buy a flat and furniture for his younger son. The vegetables that he cultivates on his plot of land, including cucumbers, tomatoes, beans, and potatoes are mainly for the family’s everyday use.

Gerasim runs his farming with great pleasure and wants to make it bigger. He has asked for this loan because he wants to buy two bee hives and three piglets, and he will use the leftover money to organize spring sowing activities.

loans.use: to buy two bee hives and three piglets, and to organize spring sowing activities

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell like chips, soft drinks, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Marivic has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for three years and also earns income from selling vegetables and raising pigs. Marivic aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell like chips, soft drinks, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman who has been blessed with four children who are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Umazi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and the villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. Umazi is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothing to resell.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MECEDES DE KATAÑIRAY, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 32 años de edad, casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de continua dedicándose  a su negocio de  confección de ropa deportiva, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de telas entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Liz is a member of the communal bank Las Mercedes de Katañiray, and the bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

She is 32 years old, she is married, and she has 3 children. She alternates between her daily chores and her business making sports clothing.
