She has had her business for a while and it is going well, thanks to the hard work that she puts into her work every day. She wants to be able to keep working to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan to purchase fabrics, among other items.

She is grateful for the loan, and she promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, among other items.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his family and he is a father of two children. By profession, he is an owner of a cloth shop. He sells different varieties of cloth and he has been doing his business for seven years.

Ali needs to buy different varieties of cloth for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy cloth in bulk. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can easily fulfill his business needs, earn more profit and increase the size of his business.

For this financial support, Ali is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of cloth in bulk to resell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

She has been in this business for five years now.

Fe would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik lives in the village of Sarigyugh in Tavush region. Edik has no higher education but over the years, he managed to become a skilled and famous tailor not only in his village but also in Ijevan city. For many years, he worked at the Ijevan sewing factory as a leading specialist. Now it has been 15 years since he has had his own small sewing business in Ijevan. He works by order and never lacks customers or orders since he works very accurately and quickly.
 
As he says, thanks to his business income, he managed to repair the family's house, pay for his children education and organize their wedding parties. Now they live separately from their parents, but Edik still financially supports them. Edik now lives with his wife who is already retired.  His agricultural activities provide a good harvest for their small family's everyday use.
 
Edik is asking for a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams in order to buy fabrics and materials for his sewing business to fulfill his orders on time.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials for his tailoring business

loans.name: Ana Dolly

texts.es:
Ana es una simpática y aguerrida mujer de 46 años que ha presenciado como su negocio ha ido creciendo y fortaleciéndose.
Inicio con un pequeño kiosco donde vendía algunos alimentos en pocas cantidades y con ventas reducidas, pero ahora cuenta con una cafetería ubicada en una concurrida zona industrial donde tiene contratos con los trabajadores del sector para la venta de refrigerios y almuerzos.
En su establecimiento vende desayunos, almuerzos, fritos, golosinas y bebidas, es una mujer muy emprendedora que con su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos. Su esposo le ayuda en algunas ocasiones cuando tiene mucho trabajo (ver foto).
Hasta ahora ha cosechado muy buenos frutos de su trabajo, pero necesita de una ayuda para comprar surtido de productos como frituras y bebidas, adicional a esto requiere de insumos para preparar los alimentos que vende. Esto le permitirá mantenerse al día en las ventas y pedidos que tiene, ofreciendo un excelente servicio a sus clientes de manera oportuna.
texts.en:
Ana is a pleasant and hard-working woman of 46 who has witnessed how her business has been growing and strengthening.

She began with a little kiosk where she sold some foods in small quantities and with reduced sales, but now she has a snack bar located in a busy industrial zone where she has contracts with the workers in the area for the sale of refreshments and lunches.

In her establishment, she sells breakfasts, lunches, fried snacks, candies, and beverages. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who has succeeded in raising her three children with her work. Her husband sometimes helps her when she has a lot of work (as in the photo).

Up to now she has harvested very good fruits from her work, but she needs help to buy a stock of products such as fried foods and beverages. In addition to this, she needs ingredients to prepare the foods that she sells. This will allow her to keep up with the sales and orders that she has, offering excellent service to her customers in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food preparations and to buy a stock of products such as fried snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif is a 40-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his family and is a father of two children. By profession, he is an owner of a clothing shop. He sells different varieties of clothes and has been doing his business for 10 years. Latif needs to buy different varieties of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to buy clothes in bulk. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he can easily fulfill his business needs, earn more profit and increase the size of his business. For this financial support, Latif is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of clothes to  resell

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 43-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Sialkot, Pakistan with his spouse and two children. He is a retailer of blankets by profession. He has a shop and he has been in this business for the past ten years. He is the guardian of his family and responsible for managing the entire household. 

Ashraf needs to buy different varieties of blankets for the purpose of reselling but due to insufficient financial resources, he is unable to buy the merchandise for his business. Therefore, he has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, he will easily purchase blankets to fulfill his business’ needs so that he can maximize his profits. For this financial support, Ashraf is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of blankets for the purpose of reselling.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: El señor Remberto tiene 28 años, casado con un hijito de tres años de edad, él trabaja como chofer de transporte interprovincial,  este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Remberto vive en la localidad de Sacaba y  va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que está por terminar su casita  y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua  ya sea para la construcción como para el uso de agua potable y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la localidad donde él  vive no cuenta con servicios básicos, el señor Remberto se siente muy feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar la construcción de su casa y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida de el y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Remberto is 28 years old, married, and has a three-year-old son. He works as a driver who provides interprovincial transportation services. This loan is his first transaction with Emprender.

Sr. Remberto lives in the town of Sacaba and will use this loan to finish the installation of a water connection in his house, which will help to complete his home. It takes a great deal of effort to bring in water, so building a potable water connection will provide greater convenience to his family. There are many reasons why the town where he lives does not have basic services.

Sr. Remberto is very pleased and appreciates the opportunity that has been given to him so that he can make construction improvements to his home. In the end, his quality of life and that of his family will improve.

loans.use: to finish the installation of a water connection in his home.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 43 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que cuenta con los servicio de agua y luz, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon , que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa brindan el servicio de enseñanza a niños en edad escolar, por las tardes dan reforzamiento en matemática y razonamiento verbal, su academia esta ubicada en su domicilio, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mesas y sillas de plástico que les permita trabajar de una manera más cómoda.
texts.en:
Cesar is 43 years old and lives in the District of Buenos Aires, a community that receives water and electricity services. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Morropon Province, which is part of the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru.

Cesar and his wife provide tutoring services to school-age children in the afternoons. They help to reinforce mathematical and verbal reasoning skills. Their academy is located in their home. Cesar is requesting a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy plastic tables and chairs so that they can work in a comfortable manner.

loans.use: to buy plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 46 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gigi runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 48,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like vinegar, cooking oil, chocolate drink, sugar, salt, shampoo, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, cooking oil, chocolate drink, sugar, salt, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Gigi would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like vinegar, cooking oil, chocolate drinks, sugar, salt, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maritza Elena reside en la ciudad de condega que está ubicada a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, ella se dedica al comercio minorista desde hace aproximadamente unos 19 años y su esposo se dedica a la construcción siendo unas personas muy conocidas por sus labores.
la señora Maritza Elena tiene su negocio que consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal por catálogos   para damas y caballeros así como ropa variada para niños, damas y caballeros, ella ya tiene su clientela establecida en la ciudad y comunidades aledañas, ya anteriormente se le ha financiado en ceprodel dos ciertos para mejorar su negocio.
actualmente0 ella se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel nuevamente con el fin de solicitar una nuevo crédito para poder aumentar el inventario de su negocio y así aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias.
Ella se muestra positiva de que dicho financiamiento le será aprobado y así podrá mejorar su negocio y de esta manera mejorar directamente su nivel de vida como la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maritza Elena resides in the city of Condega, which is located 35km to the north of the city of Estelí. She has made a living by working in retail for approximately 19 years and her husband works in construction. They are both well known for their work. 

Maritza Elena has a business, which consists of selling cosmetics and personal hygiene products via catalogue for ladies and gentlemen, as well as a variety of clothing for children, ladies, and gentlemen. She already has an established client base in the city and the neighbouring communities, since she has previously received financing from CEPRODEL twice to improve her business.

She has once again approached the offices of CEPRODEL with the goal of requesting a new loan in order to increase her business’ inventory, thereby increasing her sales and profits.

She is positive that this loan will be approved and that she will be able to improve her business, thereby directly improving her quality of life and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a variety of clothing

loans.name: Jecil

texts.en:
Jecil is 28 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Jecil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent and soap etc. to sell.

Jecil has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent and soap etc. 

In the future, Jecil would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent and soap etc. to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Alfred graduated from Abovyan State College in the department of Semiconductors and Electrical Equipment. 

Since 2003 until the present, he has worked in his area of specialty as a fitter-inspector at a private company. The income from his work is little but he is pleased to work in his specialty. 

Alfred is married and he has a daughter, who is married and lives with her family in the Russian Federation. 

Alfred asks for this loan since his wife has problems with her health, particularly with her feet. The examinations that she has undertaken directed for her to be urgently operated upon, so this loan is very urgent and important for Alfred’s family.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's urgent medical expenses

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lea requested a 21,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Lea has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing net, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business

loans.name: Kache

texts.en: Kache appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards. She is requesting a new loan to purchase sugar, salt, maize flour and wheat flour for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, maize flour and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Feliece

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Feliece, a smallholder rural farmer based in Nyamira, a rural town in Kisii. She is a mother of five who sells eggs and tea produced on her farm to earn a decent living. She has been in the sector for 14 good years. Besides farming, she also engages in other seasonal businesses to earn extra money. 

Over the years, she has developed a passion for farming and she appreciates the fact that when it is made commercial, it is a big profitable business. The biggest challenge facing farmers is lack of access to financial services.

Feliece  is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will help her generate enough income to take care of the farm related expenses which take up most of her hard-earned cash. 

With your help, Feliece’s family will enjoy more income in the long run to lead decent lives.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is 32 years old and lives with her brother in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. Astghik graduated from Sevan State College in the department of Pedagogy, but she never worked at her specialty. Now she is engaged in farming and agriculture. Her brother helps her in her occupation in addition to being employed as a builder. On her farm, Astghik has 2 cows, a heifer, 10 sheep, 8 lambs and 20 chickens. Her farm products such as milk, meat and eggs she sells at the city wholesale market. She also has a plot of land on which she cultivates potatoes, greens, cucumbers and tomatoes. She likes her peasant life and wants to make her farm richer with animals.

She is asking for a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams in order to buy several cows and fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy several cows and fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria vive en Sacaba, es madre soltera tiene tres hijos menores que estudian en nivel primaria, realiza la actividad agrícola y percibe ingresos económicos por la venta de productos agrícolas, siembra en terreno propio en 3 Has produce papa, papaliza y oca con rotación de cultivos, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de más de ocho años. Como el ahorro que tenía lo invirtió en la construcción de su vivienda, actualmente  necesita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono orgánico y semilla de papa para la próxima siembra ya que en esta época los precios de los insumos son baratos, con esto ampliara su producción agrícola y así podrá obtener más ingresos para salir adelante con sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Sacaba and she is a single mother with three minor children in elementary school.  She works in agriculture and earns an income selling her crops.  She has three acres of land where she grows potatoes, papalisa (root vegetable) and oca (tuber) on a rotation crop basis.  She has eight years' experience in the sector.

Maria used her savings to build her house.  The loan she is requesting now is to buy farm supplies such as organic compost and potato seeds for the next planting season, since the cost of the supplies is lower now.  This will increase her crop production and income so her children can get ahead.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies such as organic compost and potato seeds.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Meet Jared, a father of two, from Nyamira, a rural town in Kenya popular for banana (Matoke), the staple food. Jared has been a farmer for the last four years!  His primary income sources are eggs, tea, vegetables and bananas from his farm. He also engages in other personal businesses to get by.

He believes farmers from his region have a lot of room for growth. They need training and finances to overcome their challenges and make much more income. 

Jared is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. This will help Jared deal with the challenge of water shortages during dry seasons. The nearest river Jared relies on is seasonal. Having a water tank will help Jared store rainwater for irrigating his crops during dry seasons. 

With your loan, Jared will produce vegetables all year round. This will prevent Jared from suffering crop failures that lead to losses during the dry season. The loan will go a long way in helping Jared improve the livelihood of his family.

loans.use: to pay for a water tank

loans.name: Nzije

texts.en:
Nzije is a married woman who has been blessed with six children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Nzije has been operating a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Amazing Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Amazing and they are on their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include kenkey (cooked maize paste) and charcoal.

The loan that they will receive will benefit micro businesses like Salifu's. This is Salifu's third year with ID-Ghana. She joined after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business selling charcoal. She began this business through a cousin, who showed her how to acquire and sell this product.

The loan that she has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase three small bags of charcoal to sell to customers. She will purchase the product from the distributors and later sell it from her residence.

This job allows her to generate income to support her family - she is single but has one child. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are kind.

loans.use: To purchase three small bags of charcoal to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking  oil

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her snack business, which sells crisps and other things. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal and cooking oil for the business, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and help pay school fees for herself and her young siblings. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to own an agricultural farm. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and cooking oil for the business

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Madame Akouvi vit avec son enfant scolarisé de 15ans à Lomé. Elle revend de façon ambulante depuis 2007 des pagnes batik et s'approvisionne généralement au Ghana. N'arrivant plus à mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait son troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Madame Akouvi souhaite à l'avenir agrandir son activité en ouvrant une boutique et bien préparer l'avenir de la famille. Elle est âgée de 41ans.
texts.en:
Akouvi is 41 years old and lives with her 15-year-old child in Lomé.  Her child currently attends school.   She has been selling batik pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) on foot, since 2007.  She generally buys her stock in Ghana.

Finding herself unable to fully respond to the needs of her customers, she works with the field partner, Wages.  This will be her third loan, and she will use it to buy more merchandise.

In the future, Akouvi would like to expand her business and open a shop.  In this way, she hopes that she could create a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy batik pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 29 years old and has four children. She has a live-in partner and three of her children are currently in school.

Jenalyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Jenalyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Jenalyn has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jean Rosaly

texts.en:
Jean Rosaly works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a shell craft business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Jean Rosaly would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with eight children. She owns a house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over four years, she has been operating a water selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season.

With the loan, she wants to purchase water pipes to repair leaking pipes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes to repair leaking pipes

loans.name: Juletta

texts.en:
Juletta is 41 years old and lives in Kadjaran city in Syunik region. Her specialty is tailoring. From her first marriage, she has a son and a daughter. Her son now lives with his father. Juletta got married for the second time and now her daughter lives with her. Juletta works at the Kajaran combine. Her husband is also employed and he is a locksmith. Juletta’s daughter is going get married and she wants to organize a nice and pretty wedding party for her. 

Juletta is asking for this loan in order to buy gifts for her daughter and organize a wedding party that is as nice as she always dreamed it would be for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy gifts for her daughter and organize a nice wedding party

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Ana Brigida

texts.es:
Ana de 69 años de edad,  no logro estudiar porque sus padres no tenían la facilidad  para mandarla a la escuela,  ahora ella esta casada y tiene dos hijos que no están con ella están casados y viven en la capital la visitan una vez por mes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda la cual tiene desde hace cinco años, la idea del negocio surgió cuando se dio cuenta que en su comunidad no había una tienda.


Ana ya tiene cinco años de tener el negocio en su casa y le ha servido de mucha ayuda, ya que le genera ingresos, ella solo tiene esta actividad como fuente de ingreso su pareja le ayuda mucho cuando ella tiene que salir a la ciudad a comparar la mercadería,  así que todos colaboran para que el negocio funcione bien.

 Ana desde hace un año tiene la intención de querer surtir un poco más la tienda con algunos productos que no tiene aun, así que invertirá su  crédito en comprar  más productos esto ayudara mucho a su comunidad ya que los habitantes de esta no tendrán que viajar hasta la ciudad para comprarlos y  a ella le beneficiara mucho porque tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida. Entre esos productos estas artículos para el cuidado personal, lácteos, ropa, etc.

 Ana tiene un gran sueño en la vida es poder llegar a tener la tienda surtida y que esta le genere ingresos suficientes para  pagar los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo también le ayuda con la agricultura y por allí tiene otro pequeño ingresos, ella sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Ana, 69, was unable to get an education because her parents could not afford to send her to school.  She is married and has two married children who live in the capital city and visit her once a month.  She has been running a small storefor five years.  The idea for the business came when she realized there was no store in the community.

Ana has been running the store from her home for five years and it has been very helpful since it is a source of income and the only business she has.  Her partner helps when she has to go to the city to buy merchandise, so everyone works together to insure the business goes well.

For a year Ana has been wanting to stock more goods in her store.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise so the locals will not have to travel to the city to buy them.  This will give her more income and a better quality of life.  She will buy personal care items, dairy products, clothing, etc.

Ana's main goal in life is to have a well-stocked store that will generate enough income to pay the household expenses.  Her husband works in agriculture and also helps contribute to their income.  She knows that she will be able to meet her goal with the help of the loan.

loans.use: To buy personal care items, dairy products, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Elena Patricia

texts.es:
Elena es una joven mujer con visión al futuro y ganas de progresar personal y profesionalmente.
Desde hace algún tiempo se dedica a la venta de productos de Amway con los cuales ha recibido buenos beneficios, esta actividad la inicio gracias a que una amiga le conto acerca de este tipo de negocio aprovechando el hecho de que le gustan mucho las ventas.
Esta actividad la alterna con otros trabajos alternativos como limpiezas orales.
En este momento está intentando abrirse camino en este negocio pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por esta razón necesita un impulso económico que le permita comprar surtido de productos de esta marca para continuar con sus ventas generar algunos ingresos para sus padres y su propio sostenimiento.
Su principal desafío es la falta de capital para realizar algunos proyectos productivos.
texts.en:
Elena is a young woman with a vision of future and determination to develop both personally and professionally.  For some time she has been selling Amway products and has earned a good profit.  She started the business thanks to a friend who told her about it, and took advantage of the fact that she enjoys sales activity.  She also works as a dental hygienist.

Right now she is trying to promote her sales activity but does not have sufficient capital and needs help buying a stock of Amway products to continue with her sales.  This is to earn an income to support herself and her parents.

Her main challenge is the lack of capital to carry out productive projects.

loans.use: To buy Amway products to sell.

loans.name: Assita

texts.fr:
ASSITA est âgée de 54 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle réside à KEBILA avec son mari dans une famille polygame.
Mme ASSITA s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente d’habits .Sa vente se fait à KEBILA, au marché et chez elle à la maison.  
Forte de  ses 16 années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt.
Mme ASSITA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 douzaines d’habits pour enfants.Elle s’approvisionne à BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mme ASSITA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Assita is 54 years old and has six children.  She lives in Kebila with her husband, they have a polygamous family.  At a young age, Assita started working, buying and selling clothing.  She has sixteen years experience of selling her clothing at the market in Kebila and from her home.

Assita has now decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to increase her working capital and be able to satisfy the growing demands of her customers.  This will be her first loan and she plans to use it to buy five dozen outfits for children.  She buys her stock in Bougouni and sells it for cash or on credit to both men and women.

Assita hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA, and will use this to provide for the needs of her family, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
ASSITAN est née à  KEBILA, commune de KEBILA, une des sous-préfectures de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali .Mme ASSITAN est âgée de 45ans ;elle est mère de 4 enfants. Mme ASSITAN réside à KOLONDIEBA avec son mari polygame dans une famille traditionnelle.
Mme ASSITAN s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat et vente d’habits .Sa vente se fait à KEBILA au marché et chez elle à la maison.  
Forte de  ses 6 années d’expérience dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  premier  prêt.
Mme ASSITAN compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 douzaines d’habits pour enfants et 10 pagnes. EIle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO. EIle effectue ses ventes au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Sa clientèle est mixte.
Mme ASSITAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Assitan was born in Kebila, in the Kebila commune, one of the sub-prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.  She is 45 years old and has four children.   She lives in Kolondieba with her polygamous husband, in a traditional family.  

Assitan started working, buying and selling clothing, at a young age, and sells her products at the market in Kebila and from her home.  She has six years' experience in her business, and has now decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, to increase her working capital and respond to the growing demands of her customers.  This will be her first loan and she plans to use it to buy four dozen outfits for children and ten pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).  She buys her supplies in Bamako and sells them for cash or on credit to both men and women.

Assitan hopes to make a monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for the needs of her family, repay her loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El señor José es del departamento de Cochabamba, hace 20 años que llego al trópico acompañado de sus padres, vive en concubinato y tiene 3 hijos dependientes de sus ingresos a los que ayuda en su educación junto a su pareja, el señor estudio hasta nivel primario, no pudo continuar sus estudios porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, hace 4 años se dedica al cultivo de banano, tiene 2 has, su parcela se encuentra a 6 kilómetros de su casa, todos los días recorre a pie porque no tiene motocicleta, a veces sus amigos lo encuentran en el camino y lo acercan, con estas fuertes lluvias que hubieron su banano ha tenido problemas que repercutirán en el futuro afectándole a la producción de su cultivo y a sus ingresos económicos, para esto el cliente quiere preveer y necesita un crédito para la compra de fertilizante orgánico para mantener el rendimiento, de esta forma continuara trabajando y lograra obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is from the department of Cochabamba.  He arrived in the tropics 20 years ago with his parents.  He and his partner have three dependent children who they are educating.  Jose has a primary education but was unable to continue because his parents could not afford it.  He has been growing bananas for four years on two acres of land located six kilometers from his house.  Every day he walks there since he has no motorcycle.  Sometimes friends meet him along the road and pick him up.

The recent torrential rains have caused problems with his banana trees which will affect future crop production and income.  Jose wants to prevent this and needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer to maintain production so he can continue working and earn more income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, posee mucha clientela ya establecida por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra a fotografía y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 54, lives in her own home with her family and she has worked in agriculture for several years growing corn and beans.  She sells her produce in neighboring communities and has many customers because of the quality and good prices she offers.  She uses her income from sales to cover household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, insecticides, etc. and to iimprove the land shown in the photograph.  She wants to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, insecticide, etc. and improve her land.

loans.name: Jigisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGISSEME  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FAKOLA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution et compte bien le rembourser.
Mme MAH  (1ère sur la photo de la gauche  à la droite) compte acheter avec son prêt 1sac de riz et 1 carton de condiments. Elle vend quotidiennement ses plats alimentaires au marché et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.Elle s’approvisionne à FAKOLA. Elle vend au comptant et parfois à credit à une clientele mixte.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Jigisseme Group are all married women who are, on average, 32 years old and have three children.  They live in polygamous families in Fakola, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.  They have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to improve the performance of their businesses.  This will be their first loan and they intend to repay it fully and on time.

Mah (sitting on the far left of the photo) plans to use her loan to buy one sack of rice and one box of condiments for use in her restaurant business.  She sells her meals daily, at the market, and is much sought after, particularly on fair days.  She buys her supplies in Fakola and sells her meals for cash or on credit to both men and women.

Mah expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and help her husband to provide to the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Abra Kafui Mawusse

texts.fr: Madame Abra est une femme de 46 ans, elle a des enfants en charge et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006 dans son propre atelier. Ce commerce marche bien pour elle et a déjà obtenu des crédits qu'elle a remboursé sans grandes difficultés, elle sollicite de WAGES un  sixième crédit pour gonfler son stock. A l'avenir, elle espère assurer l’éducation de sa famille et ouvrir d'autres boutiques.
texts.en:
Abra is 46 years old and is financially responsible for some children.  She has run her own workshop, selling haberdashery items since 2006.  This is a profitable business and she has already succeeded in obtaining and easily repaying several loans.  She works with the field partner, Wages and this will be her sixth loan.  She plans to use her loan to increase her stock holding levels.

In the future, Abra hopes to be able to pay for the education of her family and open further shops.

loans.use: to buy haberdashery products for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame AMINATA est née en 1991  à SIKASSO, mariée et mère d’un enfant , elle réside avec son époux et leur enfant dans une famille nucléaire à KADIOLO KOKO un quartier périphérique de la ville de KADIOLO dans la région de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès elle s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente des herbicides il y’a environ 6 ans. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a 2 ans. Elle est à son troisième prêt  individuel,                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           qui lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons d’herbicides de qualités différentes à KORHOGO et qui seront vendus à KADIOLO au détail à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme cultivateurs  au comptant et à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Aminata was born in 1991 in Sikasso.  She is married and has one child.  She and her husband live with their child in a nuclear family in Kadiolo Koko, a district on the outskirts of the town of Kadiolo, in the Sikasso region of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Having unsuccessfully tried many ways to generate revenue, Aminata started buying and selling herbicides around six years ago.  She decided to start working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago, in order to help her to respond to the growing demands of her customers.  This will be her third individual loan, and she plans to use it to buy five boxes of herbicides of differing qualities.  She will buy the products in Korhogo and retail them in Kadiolo to men and women farmers, for cash and on credit.

Aminata expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to increase her working capital, contribute to the family expenses, and repay her loan and interest.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for resale.

loans.name: Lamissa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1978 à BIA cercle de KADIOLO, Monsieur LAMISSA est marié, il réside  avec son épouse et leurs 4 enfants à KADIOLO-NOUMOUSSO un quartier dans la ville de KADIOLO dans la région de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur LAMISSA n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études, s’est initié il y’a cinq ans aux activités d’achat et de vente des  marchandises de boutique .Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation. Ainsi, il a rejoint  l'institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a trois ans et avec laquelle il sollicite ce quatrième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ainsi ce  quatrième prêt individuel  lui permettra d’acheter au grand marché 4 sacs de 50 kg du sucre, 6 sacs de 50 kg de riz, 3 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, un carton du thé et des cartons de pâtes alimentaires  pour la revendre au détail  à une clientèle composée d ‘hommes et de femmes  au comptant et à crédit devant son domicile à KADIOLO-NOUMOUSSO.  
Avec ce quatrième prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyenne mensuel de 72 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre  ses dépenses et payer les prêt et son intérêts.
texts.en:
Lamissa was born around 1978 in Bia in the Kadiolo District.  He is married and lives with his wife and their four children in Kadiolo-Noumousso, a district of the town of Kadiolo, in the Sikasso region, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Lamissa did not have the opportunity to attend school so began selling products in his shop five years ago.  He has a good reputation which he has earned as a result of his experience.  Three years ago, he began working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be his fourth individual loan, and he will use it to increase his working capital and respond to the demands of his customers.  Lamissa plans to buy four 50 kilo sacks of sugar, six 50 kilo sacks of rice, three 20 litre drums of oil, a box of tea and boxes of pasta, from the main market.  He will then retail these products in his shop which is in front of his house in Kadiolo-Noumousso.  His customers are both men and women, and he sells on a cash or credit basis.

Lamissa expects the average monthly profit from this fourth loan to be 72,000 francs CFA, and he will use this to provide for the expenses of his family, and repay his loan and interest.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale in his shop.

loans.name: Amara

texts.fr:
Monsieur AMARA est né 1979 à DAOULASSO cercle de KADIOLO, marié, il réside avec son épouse et leurs 5 enfants à LOULOUNI  un arrondissement dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur AMARA n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les  études,  s’est initié il y’a six ans aux activités d’achat et de vente de l’essence. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation. Ainsi, il rejoint à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a trois ans avec laquelle il sollicite ce quatrième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ainsi ce  quatrième prêt individuel servira à acheter  5 bidons de 20 litres d’essence dans la ville de SIKASSO pour la revendre au détail dans son point de vente à LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d'hommes et de femmes  au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec ce quatrième prêt individuel il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyenne mensuel de 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre  ses dépenses et payer les prêt et son intérêts.
texts.en:
Amara was born in 1979 in Daoulasso in the Kadiolo circle; he is married and lives with his wife and their five children in Loulouni, a district of the Kadiolo circle in the Sikasso region (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Amara did not have the opportunity to go very far with his studies and began to buy and sell petrol six years ago. With such an experience in this field he now enjoys a good reputation. He joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, three years ago and is requesting his fourth individual loan from it, which will enable him to increase his business so that he can meet his customers' requirements. This fourth loan will thus be used to buy five 20 liter containers of petrol in Sikasso town which will be resold on a retail basis at his point of sale in Loulouni to a customer base made up of men and women for cash and on credit.

With this fourth individual loan, he is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 55,000FCFA which will be used to cover his expenses and repay his loan and the interest on it.

loans.use: to buy petrol.

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Né en  1981 à LOULOUNI cercle de KADIOLO, Monsieur DIAKALIA est marié, père de 2 enfants et résidant avec son épouse et leurs enfants à LOULOUNI un arrondissement dans le cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur DIAKALIA n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer aux études, il s’est initié il y a quatre ans aux activités d’achat et de vente des  vêtements de friperie  (pantalons et chemises). Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation. Ainsi, il a rejoint l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a deux ans et avec laquelle il sollicite ce troisième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour en fin répondre aux attentes de ses clients. Ainsi ce  troisième prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter au grand marché de 2 balles des friperies (pantalons et chemises) pour la revendre au détail sur place et à LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d ‘homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec ce troisième prêt individuel il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyenne mensuel de 42 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre  ses dépenses et payer les prêt et son intérêts.
texts.en:
Diakalia, who was born in 1981 in Loulouni in the Kadiolo circle, is married and father to two children. He lives with his wife and their children in Loulouni, which is a district of the Kadiolo circle in the Sikasso region (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). 

Diakalia did not have the opportunity to study and set up a business selling second hand clothing (trousers and shirts) four years ago. With such an experience in this field he enjoys a good reputation. He joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago and is now requesting his third individual loan from it, which will enable him to increase his business so that he can meet his customers' requirements. This third individual loan will thus allow him to buy two bales of second-hand clothing (trousers and shirts) at the Grand Market, which he will resell on a retail basis locally and in Loulouni to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit.

With this third individual loan he is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 42,000FCFA which will be used to cover his expenses and repay his loan and the interest on it.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Lamissa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1962 à ZIANGOLODOUGOU cercle de KADIOLO, Monsieur LAMISSA est un  polygame résidant avec ses épouses et leurs 4 enfants à ZIANGOLODOUGOU un village de cercle de KADIOLO dans la région de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur LAMISSA n’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  s’est initié il y a six ans aux activités d’achat et de vente des anarcadiums. Il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes au niveau de SIKASSO ville et du BURKINA FASO. Ainsi, il a rejoint  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a deux ans et avec laquelle il sollicite ce troisième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter dans les localités environnantes de ZIEGOUA et de KADIOLO 4 sacs de 50 kg d’anarcadium. Ses ventes sont faites en en gros à une clientèle composée des hommes  au comptant et à crédit.  
Avec ce troisième prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyenne mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre  ses dépenses et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Lamissa, who was born in 1962 in Ziangoloudougou in the Kadiolo circle, is a polygamist who lives with his wives and their four children in Ziangolodougou, a village in the Kadiolo circle, which lies in the Sikasso region (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Lamissa did not have the opportunity to pursue any studies and began buying and selling anarcadium (a homeopathic medecine) six years ago. He enjoys a good reputation and has a lot of orders from Sikasso town and from Burkina Faso. He joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, two years ago and is requesting his third loan from it, which will allow him to buy four 50 kilo sacks of anarcadium in the surrounding towns of Ziegoua and Kadiolo. He sells his products wholesale to a male customer base for cash and on credit.

With this third loan he expects to make and average monthly profit of 65,000FCFA, which will be used to cover his expenses and repay the interest on his loan.

loans.use: to buy anarcadium.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  DANAYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à MEDINE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Mme FATOUMATA debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  DANAYA, fait la vente des pagnes wax. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  10 pièces de pagnes wax réal au grand marché dont elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité se ses articles et son accueil chaleureux .Elle revend au détail sur place et de façon ambulante dans la ville de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43.000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Danaya Group are all married women who are, on average, 33 years old and have four children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Medine, a busy area of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.  

This will be the group's fifteenth loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  The women work with the field partner in order to enable them to respond to the demands of their customers.  All their previous loans were fully and correctly repaid.

Fatoumata (standing on the far left of the photo) sells wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).  She plans to use her loan to buy ten wax pagnes at the main market.  She is very popular with her customers due to the warmth of her welcome and the quality of her pagnes.  She retails the clothing on foot in Sikasso to both men and women, on a cash or credit basis.

Fatoumata expects to make an average monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and to increase her savings level.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Badenya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de zambougou. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments,  de grains et  de la restauration,. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  4éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djelika  (3ére  femme de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande restauratrice dans le village de zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de mil et de riz  pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente de ses plats alimentaires se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djelika  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer le partenariat  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
NB: La sixième femme n’apparait pas dans la photo car elle était lors d’un décès.
texts.en:
The six women of the Badenya group all live in traditional families. They average 37 years of age with four children each. They all live in the village of Zambougou in Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other as neighbors, relatives, through marriage and through their income-generating activities in the village of Zambougou. They have small businesses selling condiments and grains and carrying out restauration activities. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to boost their businesses and are on their fourth group loan.

Djelika (who is standing third from the right in the photo) has a significant restauration activity in Zambougou and the surrounding areas. She is planning to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of millet and rice to satisfy customer demand. She sells her dishes for cash and often on credit to a mixed customer base.

Djelika hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA with this loan and she will use this profit to provide for her children's small needs and to expand her business. She would like to continue to the partnership with Soro Yiriwas. N.B. The sixth woman in the group is not in the photo because she was at a funeral.

loans.use: to buy millet and rice for her restauration activity.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Bendiya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de zambougou. Elles font le petit commerce, de condiment, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Maimouna  (1ére  femme assise de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le village de zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité suffisante de condiments  pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Maimouna  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Bendiya Group all live in traditional families.  The women are, on average, 37 years old and have three children.  They all live in the village of Zambougou, in Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through neighbourhood, family and business ties.

The group members are all retailers of food ingredients, prepared meals or cereals.  In order to improve their working capital, the women decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their second group loan.

Maimouna (sitting on the far right of the photo) sells all sorts of food ingredients in Zambougou village and the surrounding area.  She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of food ingredients for resale to her customers.  She sells mainly to women, on a cash or credit basis.  

Maimouna hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which she will use to help her husband, and improve her working capital.  In the future, she hopes to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Badenya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Darsalam. Elles font le petit commerce, d’habillement, de restauration et de produit cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ér cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Adiaratou  (3eme  de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax dans le quartier Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 pièces de pagnes wax   pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Adiaratou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  23 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women members of the Badenya Group all live in nuclear families.  They are, on average, 31 years old and have two children.  The women all live in the Darsalam area of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and know one another through family, neighbourhood and business ties.

The members of the group are all retailers of clothing, food or cosmetic products.  They want to improve their working capital so they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso and this will be their first group loan.

Adiaratou (third from the right in the photo) sells wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) in Darsalam and the surrounding area.  She intends to use her loan to buy eight wax pagnes to satisfy the needs of her customers.  She sells to both men and women, for cash or on credit.  Adiaratou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for some of the needs of her family, and increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Tito De Jesús

texts.es:
Tito de 24 años de edad, es un joven que estudio hasta sexto grado,  está acompañado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Tito aun o ha procreado hijos ya que tiene poco de haberse  acompañado, Tito solo vive con la esposa por lo tanto solo ella depende de él.

Tito se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años de edad, el papá lo inculco a este oficio sabiendo que esto le iba a servir de mucho en la vida, pero también Tito se dedica a la alfarería que trabaja con el abuelo,  él trabaja como ayudante esto le genera ingresos semanales;  pero este oficio en el invierno se detiene entonces se dedicara de lleno a la agricultura,  el trabajo de  la alfarería lo hace en un horario de 6 am a las 2 pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultivara y para comprar los insumos agrícolas,  ya que por el momento suele estar más cómodos y ahorita quieren preparase con tiempo de todo lo que va a necesitar en los 10,500 metros cuadrados  que va a cultivar.  El préstamo le ayudara mucho ya que la milpa que el año pasado cultivo no la preparo bien por falta de dinero, pero hoy con la ayuda de los préstamos le ayudara mucho.
texts.en:
Tito is 24 years old. He is a young man who studied up to the sixth grade. He is married and his wife works as a housewife. Tito has not had children yet, because he just got married, so only his wife depends on him.

Tito has been working in agriculture since he was ten years old. His father taught him this activity knowing that it would be useful for him. Tito also works making clay pots together with his grandfather. He works as his assistant, so he has a weekly income. However, they do not work during the winter time [i.e. rainy season], so he works full time in agriculture. He works at the pottery workshop from 6 am until 2 pm.

He is requesting a loan to pay the rent of the land where he grows his crops and to buy agricultural supplies. He has some time now to prepare everything he needs to cultivate 10,500 square meters. This loan will help him a lot. Last year, he was not able to prepare the land properly because he lacked the money. However, with this loan he will be able to do so this time.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of the land where he grows his crops and to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rio Ostiones Group

texts.es:
PABLO. Hombre pobre que con su trabajo ha conseguido una vieja camioneta. Que es la herramienta de sus labores diarias. Pablo lleva 20 años sirviendo a personas en transporte. Tiene 54 años y vive con su esposa e hijos en un recinto muy pobre e inaccesible en épocas de invierno (lluvias) es así que su camioneta es el medio de transporte de toda la comunidad. Estudiantes. 
Este crédito será empleado en reparar la camioneta. Ya que en varias ocasionesha presentado daños y por falta de dinero no ha podido conseguir los repuestos nuevos.
Pablo inicia su jornada de trabajo a las 5 de la mañana. Para llegar a los pueblos lejanos a tiempo para las personas que laboran allí. 
Su esposa se dedica a las tareas del hogar. Sus hijos estudian y uno de ellos le ayuda en el carro.
Desea en un futuro pertenecer a una compañía. Para poder trabajar legalmente y servir mejor a las personas que desde hace mucho lo conocen.
Este es su segundo crédito y agradece la oportunidad que a través de organizaciones brindan a la gente que no tiene posibilidades de créditos en bancos.
texts.en:
PABLO. A poor man who with his work has obtained an old pick-up truck. It is the tool of his daily work. Pablo has been offering a transportation service for 20 years. He is 54 years old and lives with his wife and children in a very poor community that is inaccessible during the rainy season. That is why his pick-up truck is the means of transportation for the whole community, including students.

This loan will be used to repair the truck. On several occasions is has been damaged and due to a lack of money, he hasn't been able to obtain the new parts. Pablo starts his work day at 5 in the morning so that he can get to the distant towns on time for the people who work there. His wife is a homemaker. His children go to school and one of them helps in the pickup truck. In the future, he wants to belong to a company so he can work legally and serve people better who have known him for so long.  

This is his second loan and he is grateful for the opportunity that the organizations offer people who have no possibility of getting loans from banks.

loans.use: to repair a pick-up truck and buy new parts.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 57 años de edad desde hace varios años decidió poner en su casa un negocio que consiste en una pequeña tienda donde vende todo tipo de artículos, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, la calidad y la amabilidad que ella tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hijo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella vive solamente con su hijo quien trabaja y ayuda en los gastos de la casa, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor como: granos básicos, aceite, sopas, golosinas, detergentes, jabón, refrescos, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana, 57, decided some years ago to open a small store at home. She sells all kinds of products and has many customers thanks to her good prices, the quality of her products and the good service she offers. With the profits and her son’s help, this family gets ahead and pays for the home expenses. She lives with her son, who works and helps her to cover the home expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy more products in bulk, such as grains, oil, soups, candies, detergent, soap and beverages. This will leave her better profits and will help her and her son to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, such as grains, oil, soups and beverages.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo es ahora casado y tiene dos hijos, vive con sus suegros en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus suegros Hugo esta ganando dinero como empleado gastronomico Hugo necesita un credito para refaccion de la vivienda que ocupa, lo que a Hugo le interesa es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, asi sea en una casa que no le pertenece
texts.en: Hugo is married now and has two children. He lives with his parents in law in El Alto in a brick and cement house. It belongs to his parents in law. Hugo is earning money as a employee in gastronomy. He needs a loan to repair the home he lives in. Hugo is interested in improving his family's quality of life, even if the house doesn't belong to him.

loans.use: to do home repairs.

loans.name: Florentín

texts.es:
Florentín de 65 años de edad, cuando era un jovencito estudio hasta quinto grado en la escuela, ahora está acompañado con su esposa que es ama de casa, han procreado una hija que ahora tiene 32 años de edad, la cual esta soltera y vive con ellos.
Como toda persona que vive en una zona rural se dedica a la agricultura pero él también tiene otra fuente de ingresos dado que trabaja en una pozo de agua potable que es la que abastece a toda la comunidad y él es el encargado de administrar las raciones de agua que hay, pero también siembra maíz,  él alquila dos tareas de terreno para cultivar el maíz estas tierras le quedan un poco lejos ya que están en las faldas de un cerro.
Florentín tiene enferma a su hija quien está padeciendo de una terrible enfermedad en los riñones y solo se puede curar con un tratamiento que cuesta alrededor de $1200.°° él ya tiene una pequeña parte de dinero y necesita el crédito para poder pagar el tratamiento para su hija.
El sueño de él, es que su hija pueda seguir viviendo como toda persona normal,  ya que ella está bastante joven y siente que es bastante injusto que su hija muera tan joven,  él sabe que su hija puede vivir mucho más tiempo pero sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Florentín is 65 years old. When he was little he went to school up to the fifth grade. Now he is married and his wife is a housewife. They have a daughter who is now 32. She is single and lives with them.

Like everyone that lives in a rural area, he works in agriculture. He also has another source of income because he works at a potable water well that serves the whole community. He is in charge of administering the water rations. He also grows corn. He rents two plots of land to grow corn. The land is a little far away, as they are on the foot of a mountain. 

Florentín's daughter is sick. She has a terrible kidney disease and she can only be cured with a treatment that costs about $1200.00. He already has a small part of the money and he needs the loan to pay for the treatment for his daughter. His dream is for his daughter to stay alive, like any normal person.  She is very young and he feels that is is very unfair for his daughter to die so young. He knows that his daughter can live for a lot longer, and he knows what he can accomplish this with the loan.

loans.use: to pay for a medical treatment for his daughter.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a widowed woman who has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, Nyamvula has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women as well as curtains. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge. 

With this loan, Nyamvula will purchase fabrics and sewing threads for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and sewing threads for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Alice, a hardworking mother of five children who is from Nyamira, a rural village in Kenya. Her self-drive and passion have enabled her to practice farming for 20 years now. Her primary income sources are tea, vegetables and other personal business.

She really likes it when she realizes profit after selling her eggs. However, having limited funds seems to be her biggest challenge. 

Alice is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With more hens, she will be able to lay more eggs for sale. The increase in income as a result will help her comfortably meet the farming-related costs that are eating up her profits today.  

Your loan will help Alice’s family to earn more income and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase poultry so she will have more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Roberto Julio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto es un agricultor de tradición familiar ya que su familia toda la vida se ha dedicado a este importante trabajo, Padre de un hijo de 19 años a quien quiere inculcarle los buenos valores aprendidos en el campo como la humildad el esfuerzo y el trabajo pues sin importar sus 51 años de edad se levanta todos los días en las horas de la madruga a trabajar en sus cultivos de frijol, arveja entro otros y que ha laborado durante 42 años, así es desde los 9 años está trabajando con estos cultivos. 
Según Roberto el trabajo de agricultor es un negocio muy desvalorado por el gobierno ya que tiene que vender a un muy bajo precio y el costo de los insumos agrícolas como pesticidas, fungicidas, riegos, abonos e insumos agrícolas en general tiene un muy alto costo y en la mayoría de casos los agricultores no tienen la forma de acceder a ellos generando pérdidas perjudiciales no solo para ellos si no para nosotros que consumimos diariamente los productos cosechados por estos cultivadores. 
Por esto solicita un crédito para la compra de riesgos, abonos, pesticidas, fungicidas para terminar sus cultivos y poder venderlos al mercado. Su principal sueño es mantener el negocio familiar en el tiempo, brindarle a su hijo los medios económicos necesarios para que estudie y sea un profesional en el futuro.
texts.en:
Roberto is a traditional, family farmer. He has spent his whole life working in this area. A father to one son - 19 years old -, Roberto wants to teach him the values that he himself learned in the field, including humility, effort and work. Regardless of his age - 51 years old - Roberto wakes up very early every morning in order to work at his bean and chick pea plants, and his other crops. Roberto has spent 42 years working in the field, and nine years working with these particular crops.

According to Roberto, farm work is grossly undervalued by the government as farmers have to sell at very low prices and the costs of farming supplies - such as pesticides, anti-fungal chemicals, manure and more - are very high. In most cases, farmers are unable to buy these goods or make substantial losses. These losses are not just for farmers but for all of us who consume these goods every day.

Roberto is applying for a loan in order to buy manure, weed-killers, anti-fungal chemicals and more in order to finish growing his crops and sell them at the market. Roberto's biggest dream is to keep his family business going, and to offer his son the financial means to study and have a profession in the future.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed-killers, anti-fungal chemicals and more in order to finish growing his crops and sell them at the market.

loans.name: Sergio Natividad

texts.es:
Sergio de 65 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta tercer grado en la escuela de su comunidad cuando era un niño; tiene un hijo que ya salió del bachillerato y ahora está trabajando en una tienda de carácter comercial tales como venta de granos básicos,  su esposa con quien procreó dicho hijo falleció.
Sergio tiene alrededor de seis años de dedicarse a la actividad de compra- venta de ganado, dicha actividad es la fuente principal de ingresos que tiene este es uno de los trabajos más pesados y bastantes riesgosos; pero deja una utilidad bastante considerable él compra ganado toda la semana en cualquier comunidad y lo tiene en el corral de su casa y lo saca a vender todos los martes de cada semana.
Se sabe que para este tipo de actividades se necesita tener disponible dinero,  es por ese motivo que Sergio necesita invertir su  crédito en un corral con polines de hierro,  ya que el que tiene es una cerca con postes de madera los cuales están muy deteriorados y el ganado se le escapa y en ocasiones se le han extraviado ahora invertirá el crédito en una cerca metálica.
Hace unos dos años atrás había planeado hacer esta cerca, pero no ha podido ya que si la hace de su dinero se quedara sin nada para trabajar pero con la ayuda del crédito podrá hacer lo que tanto ha querido desde hace mucho tiempo y seguir trabajando,  así podrá pagar despacio las cuotas pequeñas de su crédito y sin preocuparse en las noches que sus reses se escaparan.
texts.en:
Sergio is 65 years old and completed up to third grade at his local school. Sergio has one son who has completed high school and is now working in a shop selling basic grains; Sergio's wife, the mother of his son, has passed away.

Sergio has been working buying and selling cattle for around six years and it is his main source of income. This work is very difficult and risky, but he makes a good profit. Sergio buys cattle all week, in whatever community, and then keeps it at the farmyard by his house, before taking them out to sell every Tuesday.

In order to do this work, a cattle raiser needs to have cash available and so Sergio needs to invest a loan in a pen for the animals, built with iron purlins. Sergio already has a fence made with wooden posts but these are not in very good condition and the cattle can escape and, on occasions, are never found again. This loan will be invested in a metal fence.

A couple of years ago Sergio had planned to build this fence but he did not have the money to do it. Now, with the help of a loan, he can do what he has wanted to for so long. He can then also continue with his work, and slowly make the small repayments on his loan, without worrying that his cattle will escape in the night.

loans.use: to buy iron purlins to build a metal fence for his farmyard.

loans.name: Carmem

texts.pt:
Residente da Ponta de Ouro, solteira e mãe de três meninas, com idades compreendidas de 05 a 18 anos de idade, encontra se a viver na ponta de ouro por motivos profissionais.
Com o valor de empréstimo pretendi comprar um congelador, microondas, um televisor para uso doméstico, um ferro de engomar e um fogão a gás.
O seu maior sonho é abrir seu próprio negócio e a nível profissional gostaria de ter uma promoção monetária mensal porque ai terá como pagar mais rápido o crédito. O seu principal desafio é legalizar o seu terreno e abrir a sua casa dos petiscos que será sua fonte alternativa de rendimento.
texts.en:
Carmem lives in Ponta de Ouro and is a single mother of 3 girls aged between 5 and 18. She lives in Ponta de Ouro for professional reasons.

With this loan she plans to buy a freezer, microwave, aTV for domestic use, an iron and a gas stove. 

Her biggest dream is to open her own business and on a professional level she would like to receive a raise in her salary as this way she'll be able to pay off her loan more quickly.
