Her biggest challenge is to legalize her property and open a snack food restaurant which will be her alternative source of income.

loans.use: buy a freezer, microwave, aTV for domestic use, an iron and a gas stove

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
Residente da Ponta de Ouro, casado maritalmente pai de um menino ainda menor. É cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema pela primeira vez e com o presente financiamento pretendi comprar 20 sacos de cimento, uma carrada de pedra e pagar mão-de-obra do pedreiro.
O seu maior desafio é concluir sua casa uma vez que a casa onde esta a viver encontra se em um estado de degradação elevado, e tem como sonho abrir um negocio para sua esposa.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in Ponta de Ouro, is married and the father of a son who is still underage. This is his first loan from Hluvuku-Adsema and with it he plans to buy 20 sacks of cement as well as a carload of stone and pay for a stonemason.

His biggest challenge is to finish building his house as the one where he is currently living is extensively degraded and his dream is to open a business for his wife.

loans.use: buy 20 sacks of cement as well as a carload of stone and pay for a stonemason.

loans.name: Issa

texts.pt:
Residente da Ponta de Ouro há mais de cinco anos, casado maritalmente pai de um menino com um ano de idade. É cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema pela segunda vez e com o presente financiamento pretendi comprar 8 sacos de cimento, 15 ferro8 e duas portas principais e pagar mão-de-obra do pedreiro.
O seu maior sonho e desafio é ter sua própria casa uma vez que encontra se a viver numa de material precário e abrir um negócio para sua esposa.
texts.en:
Issa has lived in Ponta de Ouro for more than five years; he is married and is the father of a one year old boy. He is a second time client of Hluvuku-Adsema and with this loan he plans to buy 8 sacks of cement, 15 iron rods and 2 main doors as well as pay for a stonemason. 

His biggest dream and challenge is to have his own house (as he currently lives in one made out of precarious materials) and to open a business for his wife.

loans.use: buy 8 sacks of cement, 15 iron rods and 2 main doors as well as pay for a stonemason.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa de 26 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, al no contar con apoyo para seguir estudiando, tuvo que buscar la manera de que no le faltara el sustento a su familia, ella es madre soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres. Tiene una hija, la cual está estudiando.

Actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, son tres años de experiencia en la actividad vende de lunes a domingo en los cantones aledaños. Antes trabajaba como promotora de salud.


El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en su negocio, en la compra de más ropa para hombre mujer y niños, ya que tiene varios pedidos y en este momento no cuenta con los recursos para aprovechar la oportunidad de negocio.

Su sueño es poder ver a su hija convertida un toda una profesional, culminando sus estudios, además, de poder  tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 26 years old and an enterprising young woman. With no support to continue studying, Rosa had to find a way to support her family. Rosa is a single mother and lives at her parents' home. Rosa has a daughter, who is in school.

Rosa has a business selling clothes. She has three years experience selling seven days a week in the neighbouring cantons. Rosa previously worked promoting good health.

Rosa needs this loan to invest in her business. She will buy clothes for men, women, and children .She has a number of orders to fulfill but does not currently have the money to do so.

Rosa's dream is to see her daughter become a professional. She also wants to finish her studies and own her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men, women and children, as she has many orders to fulfill.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.pt:
Residente da Ponta de Malongane, casada maritalmente mãe de quatro filhos dos quais duas são meninas, com idades compreendidas de 6 meses a 18 anos de idade tem um dependente na sua casa que e seu cunhado. Com o valor pretende comprar 20 sacos de cimento e pagar o pedreiro.
O seu maior desafio é concluir sua casa que encontra se no bairro das mahotas na cidade de Maputo, e tem como seu maior sonho abrir seu próprio negocio numa barraca que esta em construção na sua residência onde reside actualmente
texts.en:
Hilaria lives in Ponta de Malongane, is married and the mother of four children (2 of whom are girls) aged between 6 months and 18 years. She also has a brother-in-law living with her who is her dependent. 

With this loan she plans to buy 20 sacks of cement and pay for a stonemason.

Her biggest challenge is to finish building her house which is located in the Mahotas neighbourhood in the city of Maputo and her biggest dream is to open her own business from a stall she is currently building at her home.

loans.use: buy 20 sacks of cement and pay for a stonemason.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt: Residente da Ponta de Ouro, casado maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 8 a 15anos, tem um dependente que é sua enteada. O valor financiado e para compra de varias solas de sapatos e sandálias, e um fardo de sapatilhas para venda. O seu maior desafio é ver seu negocio a crescer e cuidar da sua machamba que tem como principal plantio as socas de ananás que esta a sortir efeito positivo. O seu maior sonho é de ver a sua criação de cabritos a crescer bastante para poder comercializa-los futuramente.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in Ponta de Ouro, is married and the father of 3 children aged between 8 and 15. He also has a stepdaughter who depends on him.

This loan is to buy various shoe and sandal soles as well as a bundle of sneakers to be resold. 

His biggest challenge is to grow  and to look after his farm where he mainly plants pineapples, which are having a positive effect. His main dream is to greatly expand his goat rearing so that he can turn this into a business in future.

loans.use: buy various shoe and sandal soles as well as a bundle of sneakers to be resold.

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt:
Residente da Ponta de Mamol, solteira mãe de três filhos com idades compreendidas ente 2 a 10 anos de idade. Com o valor financiado pretendi comprar 15 sacos de Arroz, 15 caixas de cerveja, cinco caixas de cerveja 2M pequena, uma caixa de savana, nove caixa de castle lite e uma hunters dry e comprar energia para o estabelecimento. 
O seu maior desafio é construir sua casa e ampliar seu negocio cada vez mais, tem como sonho ter uma residência de material convencional.
texts.en:
Lina lives in Ponta de Mamol and is a single mother of three children between the ages of 2 and 10. 

With this loan she plans to buy 15 sacks of rice, 15 boxes of beer, five boxes of small 2M beers, nine boxes of Castle Lite, one of Hunters Dry and to pay for electricity for her establishment.

Her biggest challenge is to build her house and expand her business continuously, her dream is to have a house built out of conventional materials.

loans.use: buy 15 sacks of rice, 15 boxes of beer, five boxes of small 2M beers, nine boxes of Castle Lite, one of Hunters Dry and to pay for electricity for her establishment.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.pt:
Residente da Ponta de Ouro, casado maritalmente com 2 filhos  dos quais um e menino e outro uma menina com idades compreendidas entre 11 a 13 anos de idade e tem seus pais na sua responsabilidade.
Com o valor financiado pela Hluvuku-Adsema pretendi efectuar pagamento das mensalidades na sua faculdade que terá ingressado recentemente.
O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua formacao superior na área de docência e aprendizagem
texts.en:
Jonas lives in Ponta de Ouro, is married and has 2 children (a boy and a girl) who are 11 and 13 years old. His parents also depend on him.

With this loan from Hluvuku-Adsema he plans to pay the monthly fees at the university where he recently enrolled.

His biggest challenge is to complete his higher education in the field teaching and learning.

loans.use: pay the monthly fees at the university where he recently enrolled.

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Residente da Ponta de Ouro, solteira mãe de duas meninas com idades compreendidas entre 6 a 13 anos de idade. É  cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema mais de 4 vezes e com o presente empréstimo pretendi comprar 25 sacos de cimento para reboque da sua residência e pagar mão-de-obra do pedreiro.
O seu maior desafio é concluir sua casa, no futuro sonha abrir um salão de beleza e quanto a nível profissional sente estável.
texts.en:
Rita lives in Ponta de Ouro and is a single mother of two girls aged between 6 and 13 years old. She has been a client of Hluvuku-Adsema's more than 4 times and with the current loan she intends to buy 25 sacks of cement for her home and to pay for a stonemason.

Her biggest challenge is to finish building her house. In future she dreams of opening a beauty salon and she currently feels stable professionally.

loans.use: buy 25 sacks of cement for her home and to pay for a stonemason.

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni is married and has four children who attend school.  She operates a beauty salon, which she has been doing for three years. Her potential customers are women. 

Mueni requested a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business. She lives in her own house that has no piped water but has electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food. Mueni dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. .

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos. and hair conditioners

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es: El señor Luciano vive en una zona rural de la provincia de Tiraque, en el lugar cuenta con escasos recursos económicos y además tiene tres hijos que dependen de sus ingresos, el señor es muy trabajador y tiene muchas ganas de superarse y mejorar las condiciones en las que se encuentra , vive con su conyugue y trabaja en su actividad económica agrícola como actividad primaria, tiene que contratar personal eventual para la siembra y cosecha de sus productos agrícolas, su casa es rustica, no tiene obra fina,  desde sus niñez ayudaba a sus padres en la producción agrícola, ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para capital de operaciones para la compra de vacas para engorde, de esa manera mejorara su ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luciano lives in a rural area in the Tiraque province, a very poor area. He has three children who depend on his income but Luciano is very hard-working and has a great desire to get ahead, and improve his living conditions. Luciano lives with his partner and works in farming. He also has to hire labourers for help with sowing and harvesting the crops. Luciano has an old house. Since his childhood, Luciano has helped his parents with their farming work.

Luciano now needs to apply for a loan in order for have working capital to buy cows to fatten up. With these cows, Luciano can increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Meet Benson, a father of 2 from Nyamira, a village in Kenya known for its staple food: the banana (locally known as Matoke).  Benson has been working as a farmer for 6 years now. He makes money selling the eggs, bananas, and vegetables produced on his farm. To make extra money, he runs a motorcycle transportation service among other small seasonal businesses. 

He finds farming to be a profitable business with a lot of room for growth and opportunities. The biggest challenge though is limited funds. 

Benson is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. With your financing, he will be able to meet the high initial cost of acquiring the poultry and feed. From more hens, Benson will sell almost twice the number of eggs in the future. The extra income will go to his children's school fees after successfully servicing the loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is a 26-year-old single man who lives with his family in their own house in Hodeidah, Yemen. He studied until secondary school. Due to the poverty of his family, he could not continue his studies. Now, he depends on himself to cover all his personal expenses.. He sees this business as a good income source. After he completed secondary school, he worked in different businesses. By working, Mansour saved enough money to purchase a motorcycle for transportation business. He has had this business for many years. He works as a motorcycle driver. Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business goes to repairing and maintaining his vehicle. So, his motorcycle needs to a repairing, but Mansour does not have enough money to do it. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 60, 000 YER from AMB in order to buy spare parts. These new spare parts will help him save a lot of money.

Mansour's vision is to purchase a  bus for his transportation business and then rent his motorcycle. He hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, onions, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 23 años de edad se dedica desde hace 8 años a la pesca artesanal es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo. El cliente cuenta con una pequeña lancha y algunas redes para obtener mariscos, la cual le permite salir adelante. El cliente solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de más redes para pescar, también anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente. El desea darle una mejor vida a su familia en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This borrower is 23 years old and, for eight years, has been a fisherman. He is very hard-working and responsible and lives with his life partner and son. This borrower has a small fishing boat and some nets for catching seafood. This work allows the borrower to get ahead. The borrower is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral". With the loan, he will have the necessary money to invest in more nets for fishing. He can also buy hooks and other necessary instruments for his daily work. The borrower wants to give his family a better life in which they have everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets, hooks and other instruments.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una señora casada de 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus cuatro  hijos en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como; güipiles y cortes, esta actividad la eligió porque su madre le enseño cuando era pequeña y ahora que su madre murió, ella continuo con este negocio que es bastante rentable, en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias.
Ella  ahora se ha dado cuenta que este producto cada vez tiene una fuerte demanda y es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,500.00 para la compra de ropa típica, de esta manera podrá ofrecerles una gran variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes. 
Uno de los sueños de doña María es incrementar sus ganancias para ampliar su negocio y así  distribuirlo a otros puntos del país.
texts.en:
María is a married 36-year-old woman. She lives with her four children in the Department of Solola. 
She says that she sells traditional clothing including traditional woven blouses and skirts. She chose this business activity because her mother taught her as a child. Now that her mother has died, she continued with this business. It is quite profitable in terms of the revenue it generates.
She now has realized that this product has an increasingly high demand which is why she is requesting a loan of 3,500.00 Guatemala quetzals for the purchase of traditional clothing. She will be able to offer a variety of styles and colors to her customers.
One of the dreams that María has is to increase profits and expand her business and distribute it to other parts of the country.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa de 39 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, que a pesar de no haberse preparado academicamente, ha buscado siempre los medios que le permitan a su familia tener el sustento diario. Esta acompañada y su pareja de vida se dedica a la albañilería. Tiene tres hijos, de los cuales 2 siguen estudiando y el mayor trabaja en la agricultura.

Ella trabaja como vendedora en una tienda del centro escolar de donde vive, tiene tres años de trabajar ahí. Además de eso, los domingos vende pupusas y pasteles en su casa, aprovechando que cerca de su casa está la cancha de fútbol y hay gran afluencia de personas ese día.


El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de materia prima, como verduras, carne, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, maíz, frijoles, etc para la elaboración de pupusas y pasteles, ya que su negocio está creciendo, pero no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para invertir, por ello decidió hacer el préstamo.

Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan terminar sus estudios, que puedan tener todo lo necesario para lograr convertirse en verdaderos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, is a hardworking woman who, despite not having attending school, has always sought ways to allow her family to have a livelihood. She has a life partner who earns his living as a mason. She has three children of which two are in school and the oldest is working in agriculture. 
She has worked as a saleswoman in the school store where she lives. She has worked there for 3 years. In addition, on Sundays she sells pupusas and cakes in her home because her home is near the soccer field that draws a large influx of people there that day. 
The loan will be used for the purchase of raw ingredients such as vegetables, meat, oil, pork, cheese, corn, beans, and more for making pupusas and pastries. Her business is growing but she does not have sufficient resources to invest so she decided to request this loan.
Her dream is that her children can complete their studies and have everything they need to achieve their goal of becoming true professionals.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for pupusas and pastries

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en:
Nunufar is married and has three children. She is from Vardaqar village. Her husband and two sons are migrant workers in a neighboring country. They left their motherland last year with the hope of finding well-paid jobs to sustain thr family financially. 

Nunufar and her daughter are running a farm. They keep cows, calves, and some chickens. Nunufar also cultivates wheat and potatoes. Agribusiness helps them to earn an income for daily expenses.

Nunufar requested her first loan from SEF for $1,500, which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation. This loan has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: El señor José es una hombre honesto y responsable, se encuentra soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes a su cargo, vive con sus padres en la misma casa y con sus hermanos; es de familia humilde, sencilla y trabajadora. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa de industria y comercio de material eléctrico, con una antigüedad de seis años, donde presta sus servicios como contramaestre. Como no tiene muchos recursos solicita un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta  nueva, que le servirá para movilizarse de su casa a su trabajo, como la empresa se encuentra a 8 km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en ese sentido, será de mayor beneficio ya que actualmente él vive en la zona norte de la ciudad.
texts.en:
José is an honest and responsible man.  He's single and has no children in his care.  He lives with his parents in the same house as his siblings.  He's from a humble, modest, and hardworking family.

Currently José works in a electrical supply business and shop.  He has worked there as a foreman for six years.

He doesn't have a lot of resources so he's requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle to get from home to work.  The business is eight kilometers from the city of Cochabamba and he currently lives in the northern part of the city, so it will be very useful to him.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза местная жительница района А.Джоми. Ей 53 года. Она и ее семья занимаются животноводством. Фируза замужем и имеет четверых детей. В течение 15 лет как ее семья выращивает коров и бычков и прибыль с этой деятельности является единственным источником дохода семьи. В горных районах основной деятельностью местных жителей является животноводство, так как для ведения этой деятельности имеются все условия. Фируза сейчас хочет увеличить поголовье скота, так как сейчас благоприятное время для расширения деятельности. На местных пастбищах выросли свежие травы - лучший корм для скотов. Поэтому Фируза просит кредит, чтобы купить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота. Этот кредит ей в данный момент очень важен.
texts.en: Firuza lives in the A. Jomi region. She is 53 years old. She and her family raise livestock.  Firuza is married and has four children. For 15 years her family has been raising cows and bulls, and this revenue is the sole source of income for the family. In mountain areas, raising livestock is the main business activity for the locals as there are favorable conditions for this. At present Firuza would like to increase her livestock headcount as this is a good season to expand her business. Local pastures are now covered with grass—the best type of fodder for the animals. This is why Firuza is applying for a loan in order to buy several heads of cattle. This loan is very important to her right now.

loans.use: to buy cattle and expand her business.

loans.name: Benso Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf femmes du groupe Benso vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier Darsalam. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments, d’habillements et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ér cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mamou  assise  au milieu est une grande vendeuse de condiments de tout genre dans le quartier Darsalam et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiments de tout genre  pour la satisfaction de la demande  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Mamou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  20.000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour subvenir aux petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The nine women of the Benso group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 35 years old with 4 children each. They all live in the Darsalam neighborhood of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and came to know each other through neighbors, family, marriage, and also through their small businesses in the Darsalam neighborhood.

The women are in the business of selling spices, clothing, and food. In order to increase their business capital, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their first group loan. 

Mamou, pictured sitting in the center of the photo, is a large vendor of all kinds of spices in the Darsalam neighborhood and surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of all kinds of spices in order to meet the needs of her customers. She makes her sales for cash and also often for credit, to a customer base made up primarily of women. Mamou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to provide for the basic needs of her children and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase spices

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA VIDA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma la socia continua con su negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  su negocio, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como chupetes, galletas, entre otros, la socia desea poder continuar trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chocolates, dulces entre otros. 

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, brindando el servicio de taxi.

Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a al reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La persona que sale con la cara tapara no pertenece al banco comunal.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the "NUEVA VIDA" (New life) communal bank which is situated in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name. One member is Norma who continues to sell sweets.  She has been running her business for some time and is doing well thanks to the determination which she puts into it every day.  She sells different kinds of goods such as lollies and biscuits among other things.  She wants to continue working so that she can continue to support her family.  She is applying for the loan to buy chocolate and sweets among other things. The other members run businesses selling clothing, shoes or groceries or providing a taxi service. The members shown in the photo attached sought permission to arrive late for the meeting due to work reasons. The person whose face is covered is not a member of the communal bank. Norma is grateful to all those who are helping her to achieve her ambition in this way and promises to make her repayments within the set time limit.

loans.use: to buy chocolate and sweets among other things

loans.name: Amanda De Jesús

texts.es: 51 años de edad 6 hijos, 15 años de experiencia en el campo una vida entera viviendo como campesina y un esposo que no puede trabajar, es la historia de Amanda que hace ya varios años le ha tocado lidiar con los ingresos de su hogar debido a los quebrantos de salud de su esposo pero ella sin quejarse ha lidiado con esta difícil labor gracias a sus dos vacas con las que trabaja como lechera y que vende un carro recolector, su principal dificultad es el bajo costo que tiene la leche en este momento lo que en muchas ocasiones solo le da para la comida diaria de su familia, por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de dos vacas con las que duplicaría su producción de leche y que le facilite el mantenimiento de sus familiares ya que su único sueño es darles una mejor calidad de vida, que puedan vivir mejor, que puedan crecer laboralmente y económicamente con esfuerzo, trabajo y humildad
texts.en: 51 years of age, 6 children, 15 years of experience in the countryside, an entire life living as a farmer and a husband who cannot work. That's the story of Amanda, who for several years now has had to struggle with her household expenses due to her husband's health problems. She has nevertheless taken on that difficult job without complaining. Thanks to her two cows, she works as a milkwoman. She sells her milk to a milk truck. Her main challenge is the current low cost of milk, as on many occasions she only makes enough for family's daily food consumption. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy two cows with which she would double her milk production and facilitate the support she provides to her family. Her only dream is to give them a better quality of life, so they can live better and grow financially and professionally with their effort, hard work and humility.

loans.use: to buy two cows to double her production and make it easier to support her numerous family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for her store (rice, brown sugar, butter, sweets, general groceries) and to buy a portfolio from the women's foundation.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past three years, Monica has been working hard to manage her catering business, which sells pancakes. 

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wheat flour, sugar, bananas and cooking oil for the business, and will help Monica to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Monica hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Monica is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more wheat flour, sugar, bananas and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Irene is 19 years old, and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married, and has two children who are both currently in school. 

For the past two years, Irene has been working hard to manage her boutique business, selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more types of clothes to attract more clients in her shop. It will help Irene to generate greater profits and to pay for school fees and other basic needs. 

Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to own a residential house. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more types of clothes to attract more clients to her shop

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the town of Kisekende, which is in the Mubende region of Uganda.   She is married and has 3 children, 2 of them attend school. 

For the past 3 years, Robinah has worked hard to manage her small business to sell soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Robinah requests 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda, water, and juice to sell, and will help Robinah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Robinah hopes that in the future she will be able to to start a clothing business in the same area. 

Robinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy soda, water, and juice.

loans.name: Winnie's Group

texts.en:
Winnie's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Winnie is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende, which is in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Winnie has worked hard to manage her retail shop which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Winnie requests 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and salt for the business and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and add more capital to increase her sales. 

Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for the business.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: El señor Ever es soltero y no tiene hijos a su cargo, vive con sus padres, es de la provincia Chapare del departamento de Cochabamba, se fue de otra comunidad como la mayoría de las personas buscando mejores oportunidades, ya que en su comunidad la producción bajo debido a los cambios climatológicos, y como la producción escaseo decidió migrar al trópico. Hoy en día tiene su propio terreno en el cual trabaja en el sector agrícola y se dedica a la producción de piña,tiene en producción una hectárea de 16000 unidades y otra hectárea está en proceso de crecimiento, su productos los comercializa a los intermediarios que van a comprar al lugar, actualmente está solicitando un crédito para mantenimiento de su produccion de piña para mejorar el rendimiento y también sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ever, who is single and has no dependent children, lives with his parents. He comes from Chapare province in Cochabamba department.  Like most people who are looking for better opportunities, he moved to another area;  production in his home area fell due to climate changes and, as farming opportunities became scarcer, he decided to move to the tropical zone. He now has his own agricultural land where he grows pineapples.  He has one hectare of 16,000 units on which he is already producing fruit and another hectare which is currently growing. He sells his produce to traders who come to buy from him.  He is currently seeking a loan to help him care for his pineapple crops and to boost his productivity along with his income.

loans.use: to care for his pineapple crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Peter. This farmer hails from Nyamira, an area in Kenya popular for growing bananas. 

For the past 15 years, he has been taking care care of his wife and three children by selling milk, eggs and tea produced on his farm. He also ventures into small seasonal businesses to keep afloat during low seasons.

One activity with no low seasons Peter enjoys is the selling of eggs! He is determined to expand this sector, though his biggest challenge remains the lack of adequate funds. 

Peter is seeking a loan from Kiva through Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. 

People like Peter cannot get formal financing from banks because they are smallholder farmers with irregular income from deep rural areas. But Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva are organizations with a different approach. They see potential in such farmers that every other organization just can’t see. 

Income from the additional poultry will help Peter settle the high farm related costs after successfully completing the loan. The loan will help Peter’s family have a better living as a result of more profits from poultry.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in the Haykashen village with his wife and three children (ages 18, 16 and 8 years old).

Armen's elder son, Henrik, studies at university. His wife is a seller at local village store and Armen himself is occupied in agriculture. Together with his wife, Armen does his best to sustain his family's living and at the same time cover Henrik's university tuition. 

The requested loan will be a big support for Armen to pay for his son's university tuition. Please support this family with their loan.

loans.use: to pay for his son Henrik's university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his grandson's medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase slippers for her business.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Juliet is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past three years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a fridge, soda and maize flour to sell, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and improve her family standards of living. Juliet hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, soda and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Meet Esther, a mother of three from Nyamira, Kenya. For the last two years, she has been solely practicing dairy and poultry farming. Predictably, her primary income comes from the selling of milk and eggs.

What Esther finds as the most enjoyable part of farming is the selling of eggs. She also so much enjoys the company of her cow that she later came to name her Ethugo. However, animal diseases pose the biggest challenge for her.

Esther is happy with her financial service provider Juhudi Kilimo. This is what she had to say: 'It's my interest to be a farmer and Juhudi is a financial partner to farmers."

Esther is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. The more birds she has, the more the eggs she will have for sale. The increase in income is definitely going to be significant. 

With the help of your loan, Esther is going to take better care of her children. Eggs will also provide a good source of food

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's group is composed of 2 hardworking women. Lydia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her tailoring shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making clothes, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a car. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Mary Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Mary Prossy's group has 4 hard working women. Mary Prossy is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende, which is in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children (1 attends school). For the past 3 years, Mary Prossy has worked hard to manage her business to sell fresh  meat. 

To help expand her business, Mary Prossy has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cattle for meat, and will help Mary Prossy to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. 

Mary Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Mary Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase  cattle.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group has 3 hard working women. Grace is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, which is in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children (1 attends school). For the past 3 years, Grace has worked hard to manage her retail shop which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Grace requests 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to purchase a refrigerator, a sack of sugar, and weighing scales for the shop.  This items will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to own a house. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, a sack of sugar, and weighing scales for the shop.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is from Marmashen village. He lives there with his father, mother and 17-years-old sister. Andranik’s father is a teacher at a local sport school. 

Andranik studies at university's economics department.

In order to address financial hardships, Andranik's family also runs a farm. 

He is applying for this loan to help pay university tuition. The requested loan will greatly help Andranik to continue his studies there. 

Please help Andranik to cover education costs.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Biakoye, and they are on their sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include kerosene, cooking pots, charcoal, wigs, cream and lotion. 

The loan that they will receive will benefit their micro businesses. This is Kosier's fourth year with ID-Ghana. She joined by invitation from her sister, who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling charcoal, kerosene and cooking pots. She began this business on her own effort about 21 years ago. 

The loan that Kosier has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase charcoal, kerosene and cooking pots, which she will sell to customers. She will purchase the products from the market and later sell them at her residence. 

This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is married with two dependent children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are responsible, which has helped them very much.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal, kerosene and cooking pots, which she will sell to customers.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a 62-year-old farmer who lives with his wife in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Raul and his wife with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, as well as in listening to the radio to mitigate their isolation. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in his house.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru:
Алишер молодой человек в возрасте 25 лет. Он очень добродушный, общительный и трудолюбивый. Алишер проживает с родителями в селе, которое находиться не далеко от района. У него  очень дружная семья. Алишер со старашим братом работают вместе, они имеют не большой бутик у входа центрального рынка района. Алишер там занимается продажей авиабилетов и дополнительно предоставляет свои услуги в сфере интернета. Так как Алишер живет в сельской местности он еще занимается земледелием, выращивает рис вместе с семьей. 
Алишер в теплое время года решил отремонтировать дом и установить пластиковые  окна так как эти окна поддерживают шумоизоляцию и теплоизоляцию .  Все дела с ремонтом он хотел бы закончить по скорее, до женитьбы. Ведь каждый человек мечтает  начать свою жизнь красиво, в красивых домах с всякими удобствами. Чтоб в дальнейшем его жене и детям было уютно. Но чтобы осуществить свои мечты в реальность Алишеру не хватает немного денег. Он узнал от своих знакомых что в Арванде есть продукт по зеленому кредиту и он решил  воспользоваться этим продуктом.  Алишер очень надеется на поддержку организации, и в будущем обещает погасить долг вовремя и без не каких проблем.
texts.en:
Alisher is a good-natured, sociable, and hard-working young man, age 25. He lives with his parents in a village not far from the district. He has a very close-knit family. Alisher and his older brother have a small shop at the entrance of the central market and work there together. They sell airline tickets and provide internet services. Because he lives in an agricultural area, he also grows rice with his family.

Alisher has decided to renovate his house while the weather is warm. He wants to install plastic windows for soundproofing and heating insulation before he gets married. After all, everybody would want to start married life in a beautiful home with all the amenities to make it cozy for his future wife and children. Alisher does not have the money to make his dreams a reality. He learned about Arvand's financial services from his acquaintances and decided to take out a loan. He hopes very much for financial support and promises to pay the loan on time without any problems.

loans.use: to purchase and install plastic windows

loans.name: Heriqnaz

texts.en:
Heriqnaz lives in Byurakn village with her mother, father and two brothers. Heriqnaz's father is a seasonal migrant worker. Heriqnaz helps her mother run a farm. 

Their farm is not very big but it is beautiful. They raise sheep, calves and chickens as well as grow a variety of fruits and vegetables. 

The requested loan of 2,500 USG will enable Heriqnaz and her mother to purchase seeds, fertilizer and fuel needed for their farm. 

This is Heriqnaz's first loan, and it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and fuel.

loans.name: Suglo Mali Nyori-Tampion Group

texts.en:
Samata is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Samata is a member of a Shea nut processing group called ‘Suglo Mali Nyori-Tampoin’ from a village called Tampion in the Northern Region of Ghana.

Samata has done this business with 17  colleagues in the Suglo Mali Nyori-Tampion group for the past three years. The 4,400.00 GHS will let her buy 50 bags of Shea nuts and enough fuel to process Shea nuts. 

There are off-site organizations and individuals who buy the Shea butter Samata processes because of its premium quality. She hopes to continuously expand this business to a point where she can have a market network in Europe and the USA for her Shea butter product.

She also hopes to increase her income, repay this loan, and take good care of the children's education and health.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of Shea nuts and some fuel.

loans.name: Eutimio

texts.en:
Eutimio is a 56-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and 23-year-old son in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Eutimio’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, as well as in listening to the radio to mitigate their isolation. Funding is asked for financing the 31% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in his house.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is a 59-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and 21-year-old daughter in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He has decided to improve his family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Florencio’s family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks, as well as in having dinner easily or in reading. Funding is asked for financing the 31% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in his house.

loans.name: Fidelfa

texts.en:
Fidelfa is a 76-year-old housewife who lives with her niece, a 57-year-old teacher, in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. She has decided to improve her family’s living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their house.

This SSHS will provide Fildelfa and her niece with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in extending their daily tasks. Funding is asked for financing the 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this housewife pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in her house.

loans.name: Jenniffer's Group

texts.en:
Jennifer's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. 

Jennifer is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, which is in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who attends school. For the past 2 years, Jennifer has worked hard to manage her retail shop which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy soda, water, and juice to sell, and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and improve on her family's standard of living. 

Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy soda, water and juice.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Jane, a smallholder lady farmer who lives in Litein, Kenya. She is a mother of four who has been practicing agriculture for 10 years now. She makes money selling milk, eggs, and tea produced from her farm. 

She likes milking the cow with her children in the morning and in the afternoon every day.  Her passion extends to the point of naming her cow Lelkina.  

Jane is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Poultry farming is swiftly gaining traction in Kenya as the demand of poultry products is skyrocketing. Jane used to keep poultry for subsistence until she attended Juhudi Kilimo agribusiness training. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, Jane opted to take a Kiva loan because of the favorable repayment period and interest rate terms that favor small scale farmers.
With your loan, Jane will generate enough income to comfortably repay the loan. The extra income will go to Jane's family expenses. 

In the long run, Jane’s family will see an increase in their income courtesy of the lenders of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín, tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Huarango, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población, se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, lo cría en una inverna cercana a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cabezas de ganado para engordarlo y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Agustín is 37 years old and lives in his own home made of rustic materials.  He lives with his wife and children in the "Caserío de Huarango," a rural zone in the district of Pomahuaca. The community is known for its warm climate and for agriculture, business and livestock industries.  It is located in the province of Jaén which belongs to the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú.  

Agustín works raising and selling cattle.  He raises them in a field close to his home.  He is asking for a loan of 3000 Nuevos Soles (Peruvian currency) in order to purchase more heads of cattle in order to fatten them and sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to purchase heads of cattle in order to fatten them and sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy agricultural products to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es una persona de 29 años de edad, él y su familia viven en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijos de las siguientes edades; el primero tiene 11 años de edad estudia cuarto grado primaria y el segundo tiene 4 años de edad todavía no asiste a la escuela, él es albañil, se dedica a construir casas desde hace 5 años, de allí obtiene sus ingresos, Francisco solicita y un préstamo por un monto de Q. 3,000.00 para comprar un lote de terreno, Francisco en el futuro desea que sus hijos estudien y que se gradúen como profesionales.
texts.en: Francisco is a 29 year old man who lives with his family in the city of Nahaulá, in the department of Sololá.  He has two children of the following ages: the first is 11 years old and studied in the fourth grade of elementary school, and the second is four years old and does not attend school yet.  Francisco is a brick layer.  He has been working building houses for the past five years.  That is how he obtains his income.  Francisco is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 Quetzales (Guatemalan currency) in order to buy a plot of land.   Francisco hopes in the future that his children will study and graduate with professional careers.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 25 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, ella es soltera, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de güipiles típicos, de esta actividad obtiene sus ingresos, la experiencia en el tejido lo aprendió de su mamá desde hace 12 años, vende en la comunidad donde vive, Juana es una persona muy proactiva y le gusta realizar muchas actividades, además de la elaboración y venta de güipiles tiene cultivo de berro, ella solicita un préstamo por un monto de Q. 6,000.00 para comprar materiales de construcción, está construyendo una habitación y le falta algunos materiales y con ello mejorar las condiciones donde habita, el sueño de Juana en el futuro es instalar una tienda de abarrotes (frijol, arroz, maíz, azúcar entre otros) en su casa.
texts.en: Juana is 25 years old and lives in the municipality of Nahualá in the region of Sololá. She is single and works making and selling "güipiles" (traditional shirts). From this activity, she obtains her income. She started acquiring experience knitting from her mom 12 years ago. She sells her shirts in the community where she lives. Juana is a proactive person who likes to carry out many activities. In addition to making and selling "güipiles", she has a watercress cultivation. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 6,000.00 Guatemalan Quetzal to buy building materials. She is building a room and needs some materials. With this loan, she wants to improve the conditions of her home. Juana's dream for the future is to have a grocery store (selling beans, rice, corn, sugar, among others) in her home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his master's degree tuition, resources, and books.

loans.name: Xicalpestle Group

texts.en:
The members of Xicalpestle Group are the heads of the families living in that Mexican village, who have decided to improve their living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their houses. Funding is asked for financing the 47% of the cost of those SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that these farmers pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

Saul is the man standing first from the right in the picture. He is a coffee worker of 56 years old. The SSHS installed in his home will provide Saul and his wife with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in increasing their productivity to prepare coffee beans, and so their income.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Gisane

texts.en:
Gisane is from Aygestan village. She lives there with her parents and 11-year-old brother.

Gisane learned how to run a farm when she was a little girl. Now she perfectly manages to run their family farm. The requested loan of USD 1,500 will be a big support for Gisane and her family to purchase seeds and fertilizer needed for land cultivation. 

As this is Gisane's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Gub'danda - Tampion’ Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is an active woman of 50 years old from Tampion in the northern part of Ghana. She is married and has six children. 

Memunatu is a member of a shea nuts farmers and shea butter processing group, who have been doing this business over the last fifteen years. Their group is called “Gub'danda – Tampion” Women’s Association. She makes good profits from the business, since she and every member of her group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to process high-quality premium shea butter for both international and local markets.

Memunatu and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 3,200 to enable them to pay the cost of labour to pick 40 bags of shea nuts for processing. By so doing, Memunatu would increase production and hence increase income, repay the loan and support her children’s educational and food needs.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labour to pick 40 bags of shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.en:
Maristela is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past eight years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Siya, who is in her early 50s, is a widow with three kids; all of them are grown-ups.  She has been running a grocery store for two and a half years now.  She works from 5:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Siya's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase stock, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan. She used the profit to buy a radio and cover household expenses.  

She will use this loan to restock the missing drinks in the grocery store. 

She dreams of finishing building her house and to buy a car. 

Siya will share this loan with her loan group "Sheraton", which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing drinks in her grocery store.

loans.name: Munojotkhon

texts.ru:
48-летняя Муночотхон профессиональный  повар и пекарь. Уже 2,5 года как она арендует столовую, где предлагает посетителям меню разнообразных национальных блюд. Муночотхон работает в столовой вместе с сестрой и невесткой. У них всегда много посетителей. 
Муночотхон замужем, однако ее муж работает вдали от семьи, в Российской Федерации. Она сейчас живет в городе Исфара вместе с сыном, невесткой и двумя внуками, которых она обожает.
Муночотхон планирует расширить свою деятельность. Она берет кредит для приобретения печи трехуровневой, чтобы ускорить процесс работы. Она с верой и надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en: 48-year-old Munojotkhon is a professional cook and baker.  She has been leasing a cafe for 2.5 years, where she offers patrons a menu of various national dishes.  Munojotkhon works at the cafe with her sister and daughter-in-law.  They always have many customers.  Munojotkhon is married, but her husband works far from the family, in the Russian Federation.  She currently lives in the city of Isfara with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandsons, whom she adores.  Munojotkhon plans to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a three-tiered oven to speed up the work process.  She is awaiting support with belief and hope.

loans.use: to purchase a three-tiered oven in order to expand her bakery business

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge de 48 años de edad, es padre de familia de 3 hijos de 19 a 24 años, con los que sueña ver convertidos en personas exitosas, por eso su mayor desafío es lograr educarlos con calidad. Jorge es propietario de un negocio mediante el cual genera sus ingresos para sostener su familia, vendiendo carnes rojas, pollo, pescado, huevos, queso, etc., actividad que aprendió de sus padres quienes practicaron este mismo negocio en su pueblo natal y cuando llegó a Barranquilla continuó Jorge ejerciendo lo que había aprendido de ellos.  Hoy sus ventas las realiza de contado todos los días desde las 4 de la tarde a  las 8 de la noche, compra en el mercado de la ciudad donde encuentra precios competitivos y calidad en sus productos cárnicos y demás artículos que vende a visitantes del centro comercial donde se encuentra ubicado y a sus vecinos del barrio donde habita.  Su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para invertir y satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cua comprará carnes, rojas pescado, huevos, pollo y queso en mayor volumen, para mas adelante ubicar un nuevo puesto fijo y reglamentado por el Distrito de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jorge is 48 years old and the father of a family of 3 children, ages 19 to 24. He dreams of seeing them converted into successful people. For this reason, his major challenge is to provide them with a quality education. 

Jorge is the proprietor of a business that generates the income to sustain his family. He sell red meat, chicken, fish, eggs, cheese, etc., an activity he learned from his parents. They practiced the same business in their native town. When he arrived in Barranquilla, Jorge continued to practice what he had learned from them.

Today, Jorge's sales are done in cash every day from 4:00 pm until 8:00 at night. He makes his purchases in the city market where he finds quality and competitive prices in meat products and other articles he sells to visitors to the commercial center where he is located and to the neighbors in the barrio where he lives.

Jorge's greatest challenge is to have sufficient working capital to invest and satisfy his customer's needs. This is his basic reason for seeking a Kiva loan, his 1st financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. By means of this loan, he will purchase red meat, fish, eggs, chicken and cheese in larger volume. Jorge hopes, later, to relocate to a new fixed post regulated by the district of the city.

loans.use: buy red meat, fish, eggs, chicken and cheese to sell.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona de clima variado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en mototaxi, desde hace 5 años, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 25 years old. He lives with his parent in the Cayaltí district, located in the
Province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region, on the North Coast of Peru. The people here in this area of varied climate work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Juan offers public transportation service in his motorcycle taxi. For the past 5 years he has been transporting passengers in the surrounding areas. He has requested a loan of 1000 PEN to buy replacement parts for his vehicle and be able to continue to provide taxi service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Elsa Ingrid

texts.es: La Señora  Elsa  tiene 41 años, ella tiene dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 13 años,  ella se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo y parrilla  en su puesto de venta en la zona de Chacarilla, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución. La Señora  Elsa  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  la Señora Elsa necesita esto para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes que en ocasiones comen parados, la Señora  Elsa  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para preparar su comida,  es propensa a agarrar reumatismo el cual es muy frecuente en personas con esa actividad,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar insumos y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida variada más grande donde pueda vender más y mejor y poder superarse en la vida.
texts.en: Elsa  is 41 years old and has two children aged 10 and 13. She sells meals, lunch and barbeque in her sales place in the Chacarilla neighborhood. This is her second loan from this institution. Elsa will use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business. Her reason to ask for the loan is to be able to provide her customers more comfort as at times they eat standing up. Elsa has challenges in her business like having to get up very early in the cold to prepare her meals. She is prone to catching rheumatism  which is very common with people in this industry. She will use the loan to buy supplies and offer her customers good service. Her desire for her business is to have a cafe with more variety, where she can sell more and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ranojon

texts.ru: Раночон пожилая женщина в возрасте 63 лет. Она родом из города Конибодом. Раночон вдова, она живет вместе с сыном и невесткой. Ее сыну 41 год и он работает в России. Невестка ведет домашнее хозяйство и помогает свекрови в ее деятельности. Вот уже 15 лет как Раночон управляет животноводческим бизнесом. Она в основном выращивает молодых бычков для дальнейшей продажи. Сейчас в ее хозяйстве осталось всего одна корова с маленьким теленком, поэтому она решила увеличить их поголовье. Для этой цели Раночон запрашивает кредит. Она всецело надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Ranojon is an elderly, 63 year-old woman.  She is from the city of Konibodom.  Ranojon is a widow, who lives with her son and daughter-in-law.  Her son is 41 years old and works in Russia.  The daughter-in-law runs the domestic household and helps her mother-in-law with the business.  Ranojon has been leading an animal husbandry business for 15 years.  She primarily raises young bulls for subsequent resale.  Currently, her business contains only one cow with a young calf, and this is why she decided to increase livestock headcount. Ranojon is requesting a loan to achieve this goal.  She wholly hopes for the support.

loans.use: to buy several bulls in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Dirisa

texts.en:
Dirisa is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mubende, in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Dirisa has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand his business, Dirisa has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar, cassava flour and cooking oil for the shop, and will help Dirisa to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for his children. Dirisa hopes that, in the future, he will be able to build rental houses for himself. 

Dirisa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Dirisa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar, cassava flour and cooking oil for the shop,

loans.name: Dúo Manos De Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO MANOS DE DIOS
La señora Maria Alicia de 25 años, soltera, desde hace 2 años posee una pequeña Granja donde cría y destaza pollos chimaltenango que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña María Alicia es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más pollos, para seguir creciendo con venta.
texts.en:
Manos de Dios [Hands of God] Duo.

Maria Alicia is 25 years old and single. As of 2 years ago, she owns a small farm where she raises and butchers chickens.

With hard work, she managed to set up and improve her home. Thanks to her business she has been able to provide for her family.

Maria Alicia’s dream is to improve her quality of life and her family’s through the microloan she is applying for at FAPE. With this loan, she wants to buy more chickens and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Rut Liliana

texts.es: La señora  Rut, tiene 28 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de edredones a crédito,  ella vende visitando instituciones públicas y privada mercados de la ciudad ofreciendo su productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Rut va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de edredones  al por mayor ya que tiene muchos pedidos que entregar,  la señora Rut a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su negocio, su deseo para su negocio es  poder abastecerse  de variedad de  producto ya que tiene mucha venta y es donde tiene que aprovechar para así tener más ingresos económicos, se siente agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Rut is 28 years old and sells bedspreads on credit. She sells by visiting public institutions and private markets in the city and offering her products.

This loan is her second transaction with Emprender. Sra. Rut will use the loan to buy bedspreads in bulk since she has many orders to fulfill. She wants her business to be stocked with a variety of products so that she can generate more sales. Rut wants to take advantage of this opportunity so that she can have more income. She appreciates being given the chance to receive this loan.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads in bulk that she can sell.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.es:
Joselito tiene 36 años de edad, vive en su casa propia de material rustico, en el Caserío Cabra Chica, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, su producción lo comercializa en clientes minoristas del mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de piña y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Joselito is 36 years old and lives in his own house made of rustic materials. He resides in the village of Cabra Chica, a rural area in the District of Pucará. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Joseinto is a farmer who specializes in growing pineapple. He has been in this line of work for five years. Whatever he produces is sold to small vendors at a market in his district. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN so that he can buy compost for maintaining his pineapple crop. This will allow him to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost for his pineapple crop.

loans.name: Sabzaly

texts.ru:
Сабзалй известный музыкант в районе Хамадони. Ему 39 лет. У него высшее образование. Сабзалй окончил университет искусств и уже 10 лет как он ведет свою музыкальную деятельность. У Сабзалй очень красивый голос и он одновременно поет и играет на музыкальных инструментах. Жители его района всегда обращаются к нему для проведения свадеб и других торжественных мероприятий. 
Сабзалй женат и имеет двух маленьких детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сабзалй сам обеспечивает семью. Ему нравится то как он зарабатывает. Он не только получает доход, но и своими песнями приносит людям радость и хорошие чувства.
В данный момент Сабзалй хочет обновить музыкальные инструменты. Для этой цели ему не хватает 3000 долларов США. Благодаря кредиту он сможет улучшить и расширить свою деятельность. Он надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Sabzaly is a famous musician in the Hamadoni district.  He is 39 years old.  He has a higher education.  Sabzaly graduated from an arts university and has been running his music business for 10 years now.  Sabzaly has a beautiful voice, and he simultaneously sings and plays musical instruments.  The resident of his district always come to him for weddings and other celebratory events. Sabzaly is married and has two small children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Sabzaly supports the family by himself.  He likes how he earns his living.  He not only receives an income, but brings people happiness and good feelings with his songs.  At the present time, Sabzaly wants to update his musical instruments.  He is short 3000 US dollars from achieving his goal.  Thanks to this loan, he would be able to improve and expand his business.  He hopes for the support.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments in order to expand his business

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en: Biasha appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase cashew nuts for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Philician

texts.en:
Philician is a married woman with one child who goes to school. For the past three years, she has operated a shop where she sells clothing for both men and women. Philician’s major business challenge is stiff competition. She lives in a rented house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Philician is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She dreams of expanding to a boutique shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For over eight years, Fatuma has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.  Fatuma wants to use this loan to purchase cloth and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for her business

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standard. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase fruit and sugar for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and sugar for her business

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en: Zhana is 36 years old. She has two school-aged children and a pensioner mother. The family lives in poverty, as they have no source of income. Zhana wants to start her own business and generate income. She requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $400 to start up a trading business. With the received credit she will purchase clothes and then  resell them at higher price. Zhana will have her stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions of her family. Zhana awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit lives with her husband and two little daughters. She has been involved in agriculture for six years. She cultivates tomatoes and grows different fruit trees. Lilit's husband sells the gathered harvest in the local open market and gathers income for family's living expenses.
