Realizing the importance of farming business, Lilit would like to enlarge theirs. She has requested this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase tomato seeds, fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation. 

Lilit has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Lilit has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, fertilizer and hiring workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is a farmer in Bovadzor village where she lives with her retired parents. She has been running her family's farm for many years. The farm includes livestock, such as cows, sheep, and chicken, and crops such as potatoes and livestock forage. Anush is a very enthusiastic and hardworking woman who loves her farm. 

Anush is requesting a 1,500 USD loan to purchase two more calves and livestock forage. She hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is a Peruvian artist who handcrafts wood jewelry boxes and home decor accessories. He would like to stock up on pine and mohena woods and special kinds of lacquer he uses in his work Antonio has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story: "I'd describe my work as life itself, and my existence together with it. When I was only 17, I created my first piece and it was an immense satisfaction. Art guides my hands in that moment of pleasure as I begin a design. My pieces are inspired by the olden times and reflect the style of vintage pieces. They transmit my love for life and for nature — its flowers, birds and all the rich flora and fauna of our country." "I'm very grateful for the support you offer craftspeople who dedicate our lives to this art. With this microcredit, I'll be able to buy supplies — mainly wood — in good shape for finishing. Summer is almost over here and the wood is dry and ready to use." Use the link below to view Antonio's wood mirrors, jewelry boxes and home decor on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5387

loans.use: to stock up on pine and mohena woods and special kinds of lacquer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in African masks and carvings. He would like to engage other artisans to assist him, as well as purchase such materials as wood, paints, metal plates and nails.

Emmanuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"After completing a course in auto mechanics, getting a job was difficult and neither my parents nor I could afford the high cost of the machinery I would need to set up on my own. I struggled along doing menial jobs, but I managed to save what I could until I had enough money to buy a small piece of land and put up a wooden store. I started buying finished carvings, and in the evenings I learned to carve these beautiful items. My inspiration comes through dreams, so when I wake up I immediately put the design on paper in order not to lose the idea."

"I thank all of you for making this microcredit possible, and especially for being there for me anytime I fall. I feel like I can count on your assistance. God bless you all."

Use the link below to view Emmanuel's African masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/1536

loans.use: to engage other artisans to assist him, as well as purchase such materials as wood, paints, metal plates and nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's school expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his grandson's school expenses

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.ru: Miguel tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 17 y 15 años de edad. Miguel trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Miguel solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y pagará la mano de obra por la reparación del techo.
texts.en: Miguel is 43 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and two children, aged 17 and 15. Miguel is an employee in a business close to his community and that is how he supports his home. Miguel is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the roof on his home, because it is in very poor condition. With the amount he has asked for, he will pay for labor costs for the roof repair.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and rods and to pay for the roof repair.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Deo has been working hard to manage his welding and hardware business. 

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more door frames, as well as wood for making windows, and will help Deo to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children and improve his family's standard of living. Deo hopes that in the future he will be able to open up more branches of the same business. 

Deo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Deo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more door frames, as well as wood for making windows.

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es: Juan tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 13 años, 8 años y 3 años de edad. Juan se gana la vida trabajando como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Juan es un hombre trabajador y junto a su compañera de vida mantienen la economía de su hogar. Juan solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de una habitación de su vivienda puesto que se encuentra deteriorado y desea repararlo lo antes posible. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvaniza, polines y clavos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Juan is 39 years old and lives at home with his partner and their three children aged 13, 8, and 3 years old. Juan earns his living working as an employee at a company in his city. Juan is a hard worker and he and his partner maintain their home economy. Juan is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the ceiling of a room in his home because it is damaged and he wants to repair it as soon as possible. With the amount requested, he will buy galvanized metal sheeting, wooden rafters, and nails. He hopes to have this funding and give his family better housing conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies to fix a damaged ceiling

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 29 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a la pesca artesanal y es así como ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, cuenta con una lacha y algunas redes para pescar, el es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable con su familia y es por esa razón que ha decido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar trasmayos para continuar con su pesca ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his family. For several years, he has worked in artisanal fisheries and this is how he has managed to raise his family. He works with a sense of honor and some fishing nets. He is a hard working and responsible family man. For this reason, he has decided to apply for a loan from Integral to purchase a driftnet to continue his fishing because this is his only source of employment and income so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a driftnet for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a shop/kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase ground nuts, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ground nuts, biscuits, bread, milk,  rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Bernard, a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, a rural town in Kenya. For the last 2 years, Bernard has been selling milk, eggs and maize from his farm to make a living. He also engages in other small seasonal businesses to earn extra income. 

The activity Bernard finds most enjoyable is when he collects eggs every morning from the poultry house. However, poultry diseases pose a very big challenge to Bernard and other poultry farmers. 

Bernard has two dairy cows on his farm named 'Tausi' and 'Blacky'. Bernard is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his two cows. The shelter will shield them from adverse weather conditions. It will also free the grazing land for other farming activities. Bernard stands to increase profits significantly after introducing zero-grazing. The additional income will be plowed back to grow his farming operations. Some of the produce will also be used to improve his family's diet.

loans.use: to put up a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bigger oven and to buy raw materials like flour, yeast and baking trays.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has five children who attend school which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Mwanasha has operated a cafe business preparing foods like rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality  as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of food ingredients such as onions, cooking oil, tomatoes, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of food ingredients such as onions, cooking oil, tomatoes, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a divorced woman who has been blessed with six children who are adults. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Rehema has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. He would like to invest in the bulk purchase of silver for his designs.

Dario has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"I began helping out in a jewelry workshop when I was 15, during school vacations. Little by little, this activity became a passion. I realized how much I enjoyed working with meticulous details and eventually found a great deal of satisfaction in creating jewelry that people liked. Beauty can be expressed in different forms and manners. The challenge for a country like Peru is to get ahead little by little, despite the many difficult circumstances that exist. It's important that people appreciate the art of jewelry, as many don't value the effort it requires."

"Please accept my thanks for your support through your microcredit. Sometimes we all find ourselves in need and it's a wonderful feeling knowing there's always a helping hand. Many thanks, and please receive a hug from me."

Use the link below to view Dario's handcrafted silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5621

loans.use: to invest in the bulk purchase of silver for his designs

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha is a very hardworking woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She is a widowed woman with four children who are in school.

Biasha operates a hotel (often a restaurant) business, making various food such as beans, rice, tea and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Biasha wants to use this loan to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase food items, tea leaves, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Efrain Alexis

texts.es: Efraín de 35 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, hasta ahora el negocio le ha dado muy buenos resultados ya se hizo de mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; Efraín es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y sobre todo humilde, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan superarse y llegar al éxito; quiere hacer crecer el negocio pero necesita de capital para compra de material por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. El tiene buenas referencias crediticias y está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Efraín is 35 years old and lives with his family in their own house. He has a metal workshop where he makes doors, window grates and grills. He has a lot of experience and this helps him to do better work each day. Up to now the business has been doing well. He has gained a lot of clients who use him because of his quality work, accessible prices but mostly because he does the work to the clients requirements.

Efraín is a very honest, hard-working and moreover humble man. He is always looking for new opportunities to improve and be successful. He wants to expand his business but lacks the capital to buy the material. So he has requested a loan from Integral to buy iron, metal, tools , etc. He has good credit references and he is certain that he can pay off the loan and bring financial stability to his home.

loans.use: to buy metals and tools.

loans.name: Sona

texts.en: Sona is 38 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. Sona is divorced and she lives with her retired parents. She has three children; her elder son is already a student, her younger son is serving in the army, and her daughter is school-aged. Since her divorce until now, she has had many hardships, but she never gets tired of believing and hoping the all of her hardships are temporary. Sona works at the pizzeria and at the same time she is a student at the Polytechnic Institute in the distance-learning department. She also has her small business. At her flat she bakes cakes by order for weddings, birthdays, or for any other parties. She does it with pleasure, since she says; this kind of work gives her a chance to compose and to use her imagination while decorating cakes. She asks for this loan in order to buy a computer, since she wants to learn more new ruses of cake decoration and any other innovation that is connected with her occupation.

loans.use: to buy a computer, since she wants to learn any innovation that is connected with her occupation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is married and has three children, two in school and one underage. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, Mwanamkuu has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women and curtains. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanamkuu wants to use this loan to purchase cloth and thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for her business.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en: Mariamu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase cashew nuts, rice and wheat flour for resale. Mariamu's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts, rice and wheat flour for resale

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives with one of her sons. Her elder son and husband are migrant workers in a neighboring country. They left the country last year with the hope of finding a good job and supporting their family financially. 

Karine is involved in agriculture. She cultivates land and sells the gathered harvest in local open markets. The requested loan of USD 1,500 is very important for her to invest in her farm. She plans to purchase fertilizer and four piglets, and to hire workers for land cultivation. 

She has taken loans from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Karine has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and four piglets, and to hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Eliana Patricia

texts.es: Eliana es una joven madre de una numerosa familia pues a sus 25 años tiene 5 hijos con su pareja con la que vive actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos Ammway que le sugirió una amiga, y con las que gracias a dios le ha ido muy bien, su principal dificultad es que los clientes casi no conocen este producto y realizar una venta es bastante difícil, pero confía que una vez hayan adquirido el producto este sea de gran satisfacción para ellos y que se lo sigan solicitando e incluso la recomienden con otros clientes, solicita el crédito para la compra de productos Ammway para distribuirlos a más personas acercarse a otros barrios y si es posibles a otras comunas y seguir cumpliendo su deseo y es mantener a sus 5 hijos poder brindarles comida , techo, estudio y vestimenta y que a pesar de su condición económica ella pueda siempre brindarles todo lo que necesiten y mantenerlas la sonrisa en su rostro la que es el principal motor en su vida esa sonrisa de sus 5 hijos.
texts.en: Eliana is a young mother of a large family. At 25 years old, she has five children with her partner with whom she lives. She currently sells Amway products, as suggested by a friend. With the grace of God, she has done well, however, her main difficulty is that most customers do not recognize the products and making a sale is difficult. She trusts that once they have purchased the product they will be greatly satisfied and continue to request products and recommend her to other clients. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of Amway products for distribution to more people in other neighborhoods and, if possible, other municipalities. She wants to continue to fulfill her wish of providing her five children with food, shelter, clothing, and an education. Despite her economic status, she wants to always give them everything they need. The smiles of the faces of her five children is her principal motivation in life.

loans.use: to purchase Amway products to distribute

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, salt, rice, pepper, etc., to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, body cream, hair grease, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is a farmer living in Akhlatyan village. She has been running a farm for 19 years.  Marine is a mother of two grown up children. With the help of her husband, Marine keeps livestock and cultivates wheat, barley, haricot and potatoes. This family is hardworking, and their farming business helps them to have a sustainable business during the year. The requested loan of USD 2,250 will be a great support for Marine to purchase potato and barley seeds for land cultivation.  Please help this family to enlarge their farm and gather more income.

loans.use: to pay for potato and barley seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Hilola

texts.ru:
Хилола молодая успешная девушка , занимается откормом скота с мужем . Хилоле 35 лет, она замужем имеет 3 сына, старшему 17, 12и 5 лет., живет Хилола в пригороде со своей семьей.  

Хилола просыпается в 6:00 утра каждый день, чтобы начать свой распорядок дня. Кроме того, она также продает молоко и молочные продукты, тем самым увеличивает свой ​​доход; следовательно, позволяет ей обеспечивать свою семьи.
Благодаря ее тяжелой работы и преданности, она в настоящее время получает ежемесячный доход для обеспечения своей семьи. У Хилолы 2  дойные коровы . Хилола планирует использовать доходы от крупного рогатого скота, чтобы построить новый дом, а также для улучшения уровня жизни ее семьи.
Муж Хилолы также работает, он маляр, его основная работа в городе. Хилола с мужем хотят обеспечить счастливое будущее для своих детей.

Хилола обратилась в Арванд для кредита на покупку корма для домашнего скота.
texts.en: Hilola is a young, successful woman, who, together with her husband, is involved in raising livestock.  Hilola is 35 years, married and has 3 sons, who are 17, 12 and 5 years old.  Hilola lives in a suburb with her family.  Hilola wakes up at 6:00 in the morning every day to start her day's schedule.  Besides, she also sells milk and milk products, increasing her income and, thus, can better provide for her family.  Thanks to her hard work and devotion, she currently earns a monthly income to support her family.  Hilola has 2 dairy cows. Hilola plans to use the earnings from cattle to build a new house and also improve the family's quality of life.  Hilola's husband also works.  He is a painter and his main work is in the city.  Hilola and her husband want to provide a bright future for their children.  Hilola requested a loan from Arvand to purchase feed for the domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pigs' feet and cow meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria, 36 years of age, is a popular maize farmer from Tampion, in the northern part of Ghana. He is a young, energetic and experienced hybrid maize farmer. Zakaria is married and has 2 children.

Zakaria has about 30 hectares of land which he uses to cultivate the maize. He engages in scientific ways of growing maize. Last farming season, he grew 40 tons of yellow maize from 30 acres of cultivated farmland. Zakaria sells the maize to Masara Farmers Association base in Ghana and does marketing for the maize. His farm has a good number of shea trees, and his wife and her group members gather the nuts for processing into shea butter.

Zakaria is asking for a loan of 4,200 GHS to buy 56 bags of fertilizer (NPK) to cultivate 40 acres of yellow maize. He intends to use some of his profit to give his children a quality education. He also wishes to acquire farm machines in the future to make his farming practices more effective. Above all, Zakaria wants to repay this loan on time to keep his relationship with Grameen Ghana alive always.

loans.use: To buy 56 bags of fertilizer (NPK) to cultivate 40 acres of yellow maize.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Sarah. She is single and has four children ages 17,15,12 and 9. In 2010, Sarah decided to to sell cosmetics, jewels and underwear. She began her business because she wants to take care of her children's education to university level, which requires a lot of work. 

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns a very good profit every month from this business which she has been using to take care of her children. She would like a loan in the amount of 2,000 GHS. Sarah requires the loan in order to buy more cosmetics, jewels and underwear of different kinds for resale. 

In the future, Sarah plans to educate her children to university level and to build a house. She is very hard working. She thanks kiva for their support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, jewels and underwear of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, fish, tomatoes, pepper, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her current business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to puchase new equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jeanette Fri

texts.en:
Jeannette Fri is married with four children and they live in a three-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the Northwest region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are sickness in her family, inadequate finances to properly manage her business, and the deaths of her brother and father.

She has taken and repaid her loans successfully three times, and says with the new loan requested, she will buy more feed and fowls and will also add firewood selling to her line of business. She holds a positive view of her business because she has been running the business for a long period of time, she has regular customers who buy from her, her business is situated at a good site and she also supplies in bulk to other retailers in the community.  With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of fowls for consumption and waste from the fowls will be used as manure to boost high yields.

With the profit from this loan, she will assist her husband in bringing up of their children, provide for their medication and education and will also cater to other family needs. To her, GHAPE loans are preferable because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and because members are also trained in business and marketing skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy feed, firewood and fowls

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Caroline, a mother of 3 who practises dairy farming for a living in Litein, a remote town in of Kenya. For the past 8 years, Caroline has been selling milk from her cows. She also engages in other personal businesses to make extra money.

Apart from the common challenges facing farmers in her region, such as lack of finances, Caroline finds farming to be the ideal economic activity. She mobilized local farmers to join groups in order to access financing from microfinance institutions. They formed a group called Yotik, and then joined Juhudi Kilimo, which partnered with KIVA to provide individual loans to each member of the group last year. 

This year, Caroline has bigger aspirations. She is seeking a loan to construct a greenhouse, which will bring Caroline more profits than any business she is currently involved in. Caroline will be able to produce fresh vegetables and fruits throughout the year. She will also be able to control the environment her crops grow in to achieve the best quality. Caroline is booking appointments with institutions and hotels to secure orders once she is started. 

With your loan, Caroline will realize her dream of being a very renowned entrepreneur. She wants to be an example to her children that it doesn't matter where you are from or where you are today; with vision, hard work and determination, you can be somebody in life. The increase in income Caroline will realize is prioritized to go to her children's school fees. Caroline believes education is the best investment!

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish for her business.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is from the village of Gandzaqar, where she lives with her husband and four sons (ages 24, 23, 18 and 17). Ofelya and her whole family are involved in agriculture. They have a farm which includes livestock (cows, calves, piglets and chickens) and they cultivate corn, haricots and potatoes. 

The gathered harvest, which is sold in local open markets, is the family's only source of income. The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Ofelya and her family to purchase agro machinery to organize the harvesting process. The loan will help the family to harvest more effectively and they will be able to enlarge their farm.

loans.use: to pay for agro machinery to organize the harvesting process

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken, pigs' feet, meat, and chicken feet to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, onions, salt, peanuts, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Maria Erika Vanessa

texts.es:
María una joven muy trabajadora, no pudo estudiar por la situación económica de sus padres,  pero eso no ha sido un obstáculo para salir adelante. Ella ayuda a su compañero de vida en la labores culturales que se realizan en la agricultura, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida, y sus 4 hijos de edades 9, 5, 3, y su ultimo hijo de 1 año de edad. Su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar como ayudante en ganadería, pero su mayor parte del tiempo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura.

Su experiencia la adquirió a través de sus padres, ya que la mandaban a dejar los alimentos desde que tenía 12 años de edad, al lugar de trabajo de su padre quien cultivaba granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo. Que es lo que su esposo y ella cultivan hoy en día.
Con el préstamo se le apoyará al cliente, para que pueda comprar los insumos que necesitara para la siembra de granos básicos, como fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, ya que es de la agricultura de donde obtienen sus alimentos.
Su sueño es darle a sus hijos una buena educación, para que no dejen de estudiar como ella lo hizo, por lo que ella lucha junto a su esposo, para darles primeramente la alimentación y la educación.
texts.en:
María is a very hardworking young woman. She wasn't able to go to school due to her parents' financial situation, but that hasn't been an obstacle to getting ahead. She helps her life's companion with the farm work. Right now, she lives with her life's companion and their four children, aged 9, 5, 3, and her youngest, who is 1 year old. Her life's companion works as a helper with cattle, but mostly he works at farming.

She acquired her experience through her parents. Since the time she was 12 years old, they would have her deliver food to the place where they would grow basic grains such as corn, beans and sorghum. That is what she and her husband grow today. With the loan, this client will be supported so that she can buy the materials she will need to plant basic grains, such as fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide, because farming is where they get their food.
 
Her dream is to give her children a good education so that they don't stop going to school like she did. That is why she is is fighting, with her husband, to first feed them and then educate them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide for planting.

loans.name: Zuvaida

texts.ru:
Зувайда спокойная, терпеливая и очень добрая женщина. Ей 46 лет. Несколько лет назад муж Зувайды умер,  сама одна воспитывает двоих детей, преодолевая  все жизненные трудности. Зувайда со своими детьми живут в селе. Она со всеми силами старается, чтоб её дети ни в чем не нуждались, чтоб не ощущали отсутствие отца. Зувайда работает продавщицей на в сельском рынке . Она продает солярку. Но это не основное деятельность Зувайды. Ведь работа продавщице не постоянная и не устойчивая, в любое время  руководство может освободить её от работы. Поэтому Зувайда  занимается животноводством. Она дома разводит крупно-рогатых скатов. Ей в этом помогает ее сын и свекровь. Благодаря животноводству жизнь Зувайды меняется в лучшую сторону. На проданные деньги скота она выдала дочку замуж. В очереди теперь её сын. Его тоже пора женить. 
 Зимой немножко тяжеловато откармливать скатов, так как весь корм надо покупать,  а летом можно откармливать их на пастбище. Зувайда недавно продала  скота  и она хотела бы вместо одного прикупить двоих . Но ей для покупки КРС не хватает денег.  Поэтому она подала заявку на кредит, чтобы умножить поголовье скатов.  Зувайда очень надеется на поддержку  Арванд и в дальнейшем хотела бы сотрудничать с организацией.
texts.en:
Zuvaida is a calm, patient and very kind woman.  She is 46 years old.  Zuvaida's husband passed away several years ago, and she has been raising two children alone, overcoming all of life's hardships.  Zuvaida and her children live in a village.  She tries with all her strengths to ensure that her children do not have any needs and not feel the absence of their father.  Zuvaida works as a salesperson at a village market.  She sells diesel, but this is not Zuvaida's main business.  Afterall, the salesperson work is inconsistent and unstable - at any time, she could lose her job.  This is why Zuvaida is involved in animal husbandry. She raises cattle at home.  Her son and father-in-law help her with this.  Thanks to animal husbandry, Zuvaida's life is improving.  She used the money from livestock sales to hold a wedding for her daughter.  Her son is now next.  It's time for him to get married.

It is difficult to feed livestock in the winter because all of the feed has to be bought, whereas in the summer, livestock can feed at a pasture. Zuvaida recently sold livestock and wants to buy two more, but does not have enough money to buy cattle.  This is why she put in a request for a loan to increase her livestock headcount.  Zuvaida hopes very much for the support from Arvand and would like to partner with the organization in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married with one child and they live in a three bedroom apartment house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which have been sickness in her family, death of her sister, inadequate finance to properly manage her business, and deaths of her brother and father.

She has taken and repaid her loans successfully three times, and says with the new loan now requested, she will buy more feed, seedlings for her farm,  and fowls, and she will also add firewood selling to her line of business. Gladys holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing the business for a long period. She has regular customers who buy from her, her business is situated at a good site, and she also supplies in bulk to other retailers in the community.  With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of fowls for consumption and the waste from fowls will be use as manure to boast high yields. 

With the profit from this loan, she will assist her husband in the upbringing of their children, will provide for their medication, and will also cater to other family needs, including the education of her children. To her, GHAPE loans are preferable because of low interest rates ans convenient repayment intervals, and members are also trained on business and marketing skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy firewood, fowls, feed, and seedlings

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is married with six children and they all live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which were sickness in her family and the deaths of her brother and friends, which led to loss of her business capital, and the death of her junior sister who had been of great support to her and her children.

The new loan requested will be used for the expansion of her poultry farm by buying more piglets and vegetable seeds. Part of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer. Catherine is positive the business will succeed because she has experience, and she will buy a good breed of piglets and chicks since she knows where to buy and at reduced prices, and she has regular customers who always buy from her at resale.

The profit from the loan will be used for feeding of her family, education of her children, expansion of the business by buying more piglets and chicks, and building her house. GHAPE loans are preferred by her because of low interest rates and a well-structured repayment interval.

loans.use: To buy piglets, fertilizer, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Lilian Neba

texts.en:
Lilian Neba is married and has four children. They live in a four bedroom house in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon. Lilian Neba has faced many challenges in life, including sickness in her family and the deaths of her brother and friends, which led to loss of her business capital. Her junior brother's death was hard because he was of great support to her and her children.

Lilian Neba will use her newly-requested loan to expand her tailoring workshop by buying materials. She will buy thread and a new machine and pay her rent. Lilian Neba is positive the business will succeed because she has experience in this type of work and regular customer who always buy from her.

Lilian Neba will use the profit from this loan to feed the family, educate the children, expand the business and build her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and a well-structured repayment interval.

loans.use: To buy a machine, thread and materials for sewing.

loans.name: Rosa Zenobia

texts.es: La señora Rosa   tiene 62 años, casada con hijos ya independientes mayores de edad,  ella se dedica a la actividad del tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para las mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Retamas, solicita el crédito para la  compra de lana de alpaca  al por mayor  para el tejido de mantas ya que tiene mucha demanda y tiene pedidos que entregar, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados y ferias  de la ciudad de La Paz, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio ya que esta es la única actividad que le permitió mantener a su familia y a sus hijos ya que se dedica al tejido de chompas hace bastantes tiempo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 62 years old, married with children who are now independent adults. She knits alpaca sweaters and blankets for women. She has her workshop and home in the Retamas zone.

She is asking for this loan to buy alpaca wool at wholesale for knittiing blankets as she has a great deal of demand and has orders to deliver. She also delivers orders to different markets and fairs in the city of La Paz. She is happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for giving her the opportunity to grow her business as this is the only activity that allowed her to keep her family and her children, as she has been knitting sweaters for a long time.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool at wholesale

loans.name: Rose Akwa

texts.en:
Rose Akwa is married and has one child. They live in a three bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the Northwest Region of Cameroon. Rose Akwa has faced many challenges in life, including sickness in her family, death of family members, inadequate finances to properly manage her business and the deaths of her brother and father.

Rose Akwa will use this newly-requested loan to buy more feed for her pig farm and firewood to sell.  She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing it for a long time. She has regular customers who buy from her, her business is situated in a good site and she also supplies in bulk to other retailers in the community.  With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of pigs for consumption, and the waste will be use as manure to boast high yields. 

Rose Akwa will use the profit from this loan to assist her husband in the raising of their children, to provide for their medication and education and to cater for other family needs. Rose Akwa believes that the GHAPE loans are preferable because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and the training members receive on business and marketing skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy feed, firewood and pigs

loans.name: German

texts.en:
German and his brothers are master woodcarvers, creating relief panels that reflect their deep Christian faith. They hope to stock up on wood, lacquers and other materials for their carvings.

German has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"My brothers and I were taught the secrets of woodcarving by Salesian priests of the Mato Grosso congregation. We work principally in cedar and mahogany wood, painted with oils. Every piece is an opportunity to express our profound relationship with the Catholic faith. We also choose themes based on Andean culture."

"I want to thank all of you who help us develop this beautiful art. Each piece is created with a message of love. With this microcredit, we'll be able to keep all our designs in stock.

Use the link below to view German's wood relief panels on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/3584

loans.use: to stock up on wood, lacquers and other materials for their carvings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onion, oil, tomato and peppers for her business.

loans.name: Ghrard

texts.en:
Ghrard is married with two children and they live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life, among which are sickness, death of loved ones, and inadequate capital to start up a business.

The requested new loan will be used for the expansion of his provision store as he will buy rice in bags, will buy more cartons of soap and sweets, and, with part of the loan, will invest in agriculture. Ghrard  also does bike transport part-time to support his business. He is positive the business will succeed because he has experience, knows where to buy at reduced prices, and has regular customers who always buy from him. 

The profit from the loan will be used for feeding of his family, education of his children, expansion of the business by buying more items, and building his house. GHAPE loans are preferable to him because of low interest rates and a well-structured repayment interval.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and provision items (rice, sweets, Maggi seasoing)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oil, soap, pepper, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, onion, rice, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Fe's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Fe has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Fe has taken a PHP 7,880 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Fe is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save money to expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 35 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, se caracteriza en su cantón como alguien responsable y colaborador con sus vecinos. Él vive con sus padres, trabaja para ayudarles, ya que estos están de avanzada edad y se les dificulta obtener ingresos para la sostenibilidad de la familia.

Juan trabaja la tierra, cultiva granos básicos( maíz, frijol y maicillo), se levanta muy temprano para terminar la jornada al medio día, en la tarde colabora con los quehaceres del hogar. Trabaja también como ayudante de albañil.

Necesita el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas (fertilizantes, semilla, productos fito sanitarios entre otros), con esto quiere aprovechar que ya se acerca la época lluviosa  y tiene que preparar el terreno donde cultivara.  Por el momento, no cuenta con los recursos y por ello ha decidido realizar el préstamo.

Su sueño es poder comprar un terreno donde edificar una pequeña vivienda, que es otro de sus sueños, también desea capacitarse en cultivo de hortalizas, para buscar diversificar  sus ingresos y así garantizar el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Juan is 35-years old.  He is a hard-working man who is known in his canton as someone who is responsible and helpful with his neighbors.  He lives with his parents and works to help them.  They are of an advanced age, and it is difficult for them to earn the income needed to support the family. 

Juan works the land.  He grows staple grains (corn, beans and sorghum).  He gets up very early so he can finish his work by noon.  In the afternoon, he helps with the household chores.  Juan also works as a brick-layer's assistant. 

Juan needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies (fertilizers, seeds, pesticide products and other items).  With the money, he will take advantage of the approaching rainy season and prepare his land for planting.  At the moment, Juan does not have the financial resources he needs, and so he has decided to take out the loan. 

Juan's dream is to be able to buy a plot of land where he can build a small house, which is another one of his dreams.  He also wants to learn to grow vegetables, as he is looking to diversify his income so he can guarantee himself a living.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (fertilizers, seeds, pesticide products and other items).

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old, married and has one child.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gemma has been farming vegetables for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Kobina

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Kobina specializes in handcrafted African masks. He would like to hire artisans from his community, as well as purchase such raw materials as wood, beads, paints and sandpaper for his designs.

Kobina has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My father painted, and I also have a flair for drawing and painting. This makes designing masks something that comes naturally to me. What I did to hone my skills was to visit art workshops where I could observe artisans. I was so eager to learn more, that I got a raw mask and started to make designs and paint it with acrylics. The outcome was very good, and that is how I started in this art form.

"I appreciate your microcredit so much, because you make it possible for me to expand my business and craft new products. I thank you for your support."

Use the link below to view Kobina's African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8495

loans.use: to hire artisans from his community, as well as purchase such raw materials as wood, beads, paints and sandpaper for his designs

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les quarte femmes du groupe Deme vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de zambougou. Elles font le petit commerce, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  4éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Kamissa  (2éme  de la  droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galettes dans le village de zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de mil  pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande de sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Kamissa  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  35 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women of the Deme group all live in traditional families. They are on average 33 years old with 3 children each. They all live in the Zambougou village of Ségou (the 4th administrative region of Mali.) They came to know each other through neighbors, family, marriage, and their small businesses within the Zambougou village. 

The women are in the business of selling food and grains. In order to increase their working capital, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 4th group loan cycle. 

Kamissa (the second woman pictured from right to left in the photo) is a big vendor of cakes in the Zambougou village and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large enough quantity of millet to meet the growing demands of her customer base. She makes her sales for cash and often for credit to a customer base made up primarily of women. 

Kamissa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to help her husband and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase millet to make cakes

loans.name: Scott

texts.en:
Scott worked in the construction industry for years; during this time, he worked hard to learn and master his trade – crafting and installing doors. He yearned to experience the freedom and responsibility of owning his own company, and so, Eagle Doors, Inc. was born. 

Under Scott’s ownership, Eagle Doors, Inc. is dedicated to exceptionally crafted doors with unmatched customer service. He currently has five employees on payroll, all of whom are consistently operating multiple jobs across Florida. No young business comes without its obstacles, though; Scott often has difficulty covering expenses and paying his employees on time. He is seeking a loan to assist him with payroll for his employees.

Help Scott keep his business running, creating quality doors and securing jobs in the state of Florida.

loans.use: to cover payroll for the employees of his custom door business.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin has a background in designing and building products. A sports enthusiast with an interest in supporting local youth sports, he decided to start a custom awards business. Add Inspiration LLC was created in 2012.

Alvin has already signed on a few clients in the region. However, he is hoping to expand the business in five years to a warehousing space and a few employees. In order to do so, he needs a loan to purchase inventory and supplies for his business.

Help this passionate entrepreneur get his business off the ground!

loans.use: To purchase inventory and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase specialty tools and equipment

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
"It's been said that if you love what you do, you never work a day in your life. This description fits me well," says Raymond.

Raymond always wanted a career in real estate, and after graduation from law school, he decided to merge his knowledge with his passion. He started his business over six years ago to help homeowners with foreclosures in his hometown of Miami. Today, the practice has added new areas within real estate including representing investors, homeowner associations and condominium associations. 

Raymond's greatest success came when he won an appeal before the Supreme Court of Florida. He has also co-authored books on real estate transactions that are published by the Florida Bar. Always passionate about helping other more than himself, he has had difficulty pricing services that are acceptable to the client and profitable for his business. He has adjusted by implementing fee schedules. 

In order to serve the growing number of clients seeking his service, Raymond needs to hire additional staff. This loan will provide him with the capital to do so. 

Help this passionate entrepreneur and father of two grow his business, provide jobs and have time to spend with his children!

loans.use: to hire additional staff members

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling young coconuts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional coconuts to sell.

In the future, Crisanta would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7,770 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Lea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 33 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Liezel works very hard to provide for them.

Liezel's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Liezel has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Liezel has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Liezel is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Merna

texts.en:
Merna is married and has four children. Three of her children are in school. Merna is 38 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Merna requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of spices to sell.

In the future, Merna would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spices to sell

loans.name: Maria Lolita

texts.en:
Maria Lolita is 54 years old, a widow and has four children.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Maria Lolita is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,200 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She plans to recover through her rice farming.

With your help, Maria Lolita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Mylene would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 60 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 3,910 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Zenaida would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ana Consuelo

texts.es:
Ana, es una señora que se esfuerza día con día por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ella es una madre soltera; junto a su hijo se apoyan y trabajan duro buscando mayores y mejores oportunidades.


Ella tiene un negocio, (venta de panes rellenos y venta de pasteles),  vende sus productos de lunes a domingo, cada día en distinto lugar, buscando mayor cantidad de clientes. Tiene 24 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. También le ayuda a su hijo en las actividades agrícolas.


Utilizará el préstamo en la compra de materiales de construcción (ladrillos, láminas, cemento, piedra, arena), ya que su casa está en malas condiciones y esta cerca la época lluviosa, por ello tiene temor de los problemas que le va ocasionar las lluvias a sus pertenencias, si no repara su vivienda.

Sus sueños son mejorar su vivienda, y poder tener una pequeña granja de pollos, ya que esta es su materia prima para sus productos.
texts.en:
Ana is a woman who works day after day to improve her family's living conditions. She is a single mother. Together with her son, they support themselves and work hard looking for bigger and better opportunities.

She has a business (selling filled breads and pastries). She sells her products from Monday to Sunday, everyday in a different place, in search of the greatest number of customers. She has been in this business for 24 years. She also helps her son with agricultural work.

She will use the loan to buy construction materials (bricks, metal sheets, cement, stone, sand), since her house is in bad shape, and the rainy season is approaching. She is afraid of the problems the rain will cause to her belongings, if she doesn't repair her house.

Her dreams are to improve her house, and to be able to have a small chicken farm, since this is the main ingredient for her products.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, metal sheets, cement, stone, sand), since her house is in bad shape.

loans.name: Otchere

texts.en:
Otchere is a master carver in Ghana who specializes in African masks. He would like to purchase materials in bulk for his designs.

Otchere has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"This skill of carving has been passed on for generations in my family. I was trained under the supervision of my father, who was also a master carver and very well known in our region. This art has sustained my family for most of my life. Like my father, I am a respected craftsman in my town and have taught a lot of young men over the years. I have two daughters and a son who I hope to teach someday. Even if he does not pursue carving as a career, he can still teach his son in order to pass this family legacy on, for generations to come.

"I want to express my gratitude to all of you who are helping fund this microcredit. Thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Otchere's hand-carved African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8186

loans.use: to purchase materials in bulk for his designs

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is the owner and founder of Beltway Vintage, a retailer of vintage clothing, accessories, and home décor from the 1950’s through 1980’s. She sells the vintage goods from an artist studio in the Brookland neighborhood of Washington D.C.  Lisa got her start in the vintage retail business by way of her blog, Quarter Life, which she created in 2009 and features her writings about DC’s vintage shops and thrift stores.  After spending several years covering vintage finds, she got the itch to open her own brick-and-mortar vintage space.  She started with a couple of pop-up shops, and selling at various markets and online, and then in 2013, the perfect opportunity presented itself – the Brookland neighborhood was undergoing a large renovation project and allocated several spaces for artistic and cultural purposes. Lisa seized the opportunity to open her first retail space in one of the artist studios.  

She requested a $5,000 loan to help her prepare for the busier spring and summer season. She plans to extend the studio hours on Saturdays to coincide with the neighborhood farmers market. Lisa will need to hire a part-time associate to assist with the increased store hours, and will need access to capital to cover the cost of the increased hours.  The neighborhood is steadily gaining more foot traffic and visitors to the artist studio and the loan will help Lisa be ready for this growth in the near future.

loans.use: to hire an associate and pay the cost of operating her store on Saturdays

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en: Anelyn is 43 years old and lives in Brgy. Maloro, Tangub City, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. To earn a living, Anelyn has a business preparing and selling banana que (a popular snack food in the Philippines of deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar). She earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and has requested a loan to buy a stock of bananas to prepare and sell. In the future, Anelyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja en estructuras metálicas y su hijo mayor quien también trabaja,  ambos ayudan en los gastos del hogar, Morena posee desde hace varios años en  su lugar de residencia una pequeña tienda donde vende variedad de artículos comestibles y no comestibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hijo y su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Morena esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas artículos por mayor para su tienda y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes y ella obtener mejores ganancias para que con su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Morena, 51, lives in her own house with her husband, who does metal work, and her oldest son, who also works. Both help her with household expenses. For several years now, Morena has had a small shop in her house, where she sells a variety of foods and other items. Her earnings, combined with those of her husband and son, allow her to cover their household expenses.

Morena is requesting this loan in order to buy more goods in bulk for her shop, and thus be able to provide better service to her customers, as well as increase her earnings to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en: Eliza is widowed with 5 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Brgy. Maquilao, Tangub City, Philippines. She is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 21 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. She has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Eliza hopes to own another rice field to till.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Askarali

texts.ru: Аскарали деятельный и энергичный молодой человек из района Вахш. Ему 31 год. Он в жизни достиг своих целей, главное из которых является открытие собственного бизнеса. Четыре года назад Аскарали в своем районе открыл лавку по продаже продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Ему в бизнесе помогает его младший брат. Они работают ежедневно без выходных и каждый день получают выручку от продаж. У них очень большая семья, состоящая из 12 человек, в частности: мать, отец, трое братьев, двое сестер, невестка, три племянника и сам Аскарали. Аскарали все еще холост. Он усердно работает, чтобы обеспечить себя и обзавестись семьей. Для реализации этой цели Аскарали устремлен на расширение бизнеса. Он просит кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести аппарат мороженного, холодильник и аппарат по охлаждению воды. Он нуждается в этих принадлежностях, так как приближается лето - сезон мороженного и прохладительных напитков. Аскарали очень надеется на поддержку для развития своего малого бизнеса.
texts.en: Askarali is an active and energetic young man from the Vakhsh region. He is 31 years old. He has set himself goals in life, the most important of which was starting his own business. Four years ago Askarali opened a shop where he sells food products and household goods. His younger brother helps him with the business. They work seven days a week and earn money every day from sales. He has a large family of 12 people: his mother, father, three brothers, two sisters, sister-in-law, three nephews, and himself. Askarali is still single. He works hard in order to provide for himself and to someday start a family. In order to achieve his goals, Askarali is expanding his business. He has asked for a loan in order to buy an ice cream machine, a refrigerator, and a water cooler. He needs this equipment for summer because it is the season of ice cream and soft drinks. Askarali hopes for support so that he can develop his small business.

loans.use: to purchase an ice cream machine, a refrigerator, and a water cooler

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 44 years old and lives in Brgy. Maloro, Tangub City, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a beauty salon business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy beauty products. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Catherine hopes to expand her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is from Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She has been buying and selling tobacco in the village to make a living. She also saves her husband's income from being a rice and corn mill operator. 

Recently, she joined GDMPC where she gains access to financial services that help her to improve her business. She took a new loan to buy additional tobacco to sell. She wants to have a better life in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is happily married and blessed with three children. She manages her agricultural farm. Planting and harvesting flowers is the primary source of income for Irenia. She also has a plot of land, planted as a vegetable garden, to earn additional income.

For many years, Irenia has earned better income from this and, with her generated income, she had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for her farm. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm as well as her income. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Chila

texts.en:
Chila is 41 years old and lives in Lamao, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is single.

Chila owns a fishing boat and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fishing net and maintain her fishing boat.

Chila has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Chila hopes to improve her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 56 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married, with six children.

Elizabeth works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan for additional capital. She wants to purchase more kilos/boxes of fish to sell/retail.

Elizabeth has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos/boxes of fish to sell/retail.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 32 years old, married and has two children, who are in school. 

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Liezel is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Liezel has been an NWTF borrower since 2001. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Liezel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 61 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft-drinks, canned goods and other groceries. In the future Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 30 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, etc. 

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, shampoo, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Juka

texts.en: Juka started her career by owning an African market in Los Angeles, California for three years. She realized there was a lack of authentic, pure and natural products in the United States from Africa. In 2013, she decided to launch Juka's Organic Co. Her objective is to combine a variety of innovative items (Organic Red Palm Oil, Shea butter, Herbal Medicines, African Tea and lots more) from the historic past of Africa to tailor them to fit today's contemporary life while still maintaining the authenticity of these products. Growing up in West Africa, Juka was inspired by her family members who were all involved in prominent businesses in her community. Her father was the first one to introduce Sonoco Motor Oil throughout her country and her grandfather was the first one to have owned a supermarket in his village. With the help and guidance of her mother, who has launched and owned many successful businesses in the African community, Juka was able to partner with women from small villages of West Africa to exclusively supply their hand selected, unrefined sustainable organic red palm oil.

loans.use: to Import organic red palm oil from Africa

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 60 years old, a widow, and has eight children.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Adoracion is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,910 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She plans to recover through her agriculture business.

With your help, Adoracion can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. 

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,150 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Elsa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Growing up on the East Coast, Terry generally had a good upbringing, although tough at times, due to hardships involved with the passing of both of his parents. He currently resides in Los Angeles, CA, where he has plans to open his business and eventually expand on an international basis.

Terry's entrepreneurial spirit was shaped by his first job after graduate school. This particular job required him to sell investment products to individuals and small businesses through his own resources. With the skills he gained, Terry has over 13 years of expertise as a financial advisor, obtaining his Certified Financial Planner designation in 2009. Terry is also a licensed Series 7 and 66 CFP, currently working for Kelly Services.

The Kiva loan will help Terry start his financial consulting business, Minority Capital Advisors, helping clients map out their financial plan based on their unique circumstances. With his new company, Terry will also be providing educational workshops for groups seeking advice on investments and personal finances.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and potentially hire an employee to assist with his services.

loans.name: Maria Delmi

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo y  su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Maria es muy dedicada en su trabajo para ella las batallas más importantes de la vida son las que peleamos diariamente para alcanzar nuestros sueños y ella está dispuesta a esforzarse por su objetivo es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y cal para seguir produciendo. Maria tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maria, at 45 years old, lives with her husband and son in their own house. She has a tortilla business in her home and already has spent many years in the business. She has gained a large clientele as she offers an excellent service. She is very kind with the people who visit her, she always has a smile on her face. She also has a great ability to prepare and serve her customers quickly. 

Maria is very dedicated to her work. For her the most important battles in life are those that we fight daily in order to achieve our dreams and she is disposed to exert herself for her goal. This is why she is requesting the loan from Integral that will allow her to purchase bulk corn and lime in order to continue producing. Maria has the hope that in this way she will provide economic security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bulk corn and lime.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La señora Claudia tiene 26 años y es casada con  hijo de la edad de 2 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa deportiva para niños en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona muy populosa de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Claudia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa al por mayor en deportivos y chamarras deportivas ya que se acerca la época de invierno,  la señora Claudia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas personas  que se dedican a la venta de ropa, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería por mayor,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Claudia, 26, is married and has a 2-year old son. She earns a living by selling sports clothing for children. Her clothing stall is located in the busy city of La Paz. 

This is Claudia's first loan with this lending institution. She will use the loan to buy sports clothing and jackets wholesale, as winter is approaching. Claudia faces challenges such as competition, as there are many people in the area who also sell clothing. She will use her profits to continue purchasing merchandise wholesale. She is happy and grateful for this loan and the opportunity it gives her.
