loans.use: to buy sports clothing and jackets wholesale.

loans.name: Otilio

texts.es: Otilio de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años, comercializa en agencias de compra venta de granos básicos ya tiene mucha clientela establecida que lo prefieren por la calidad y los buenos precios Otilio esta solicitando un crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. así como lo muestra la fotografía y poder continuar con sus cultivos y tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Otilio is 62 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has made a living farming corn and sorghum for several years. He sells his products in distribution centers that buy and sell basic grains.  He has established a good customer base that prefers his products because of their good quality and price. 

Otilio is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. as shown in the picture. This will allow him to continue farming his crops and to have a better quality of life with his wife without hardships.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married entrepreneur with 4 children. She operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also has income from the salary of her husband who works abroad. 

For three years in running the business, she earns enough to support the needs of her children and has been able to sustain it. Now she has borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 62 years old and married with 6 adult-age children. She has a fish stall at Calamba Public Market. She earns a living through selling fish. She has been a member in good standing with PMPC since 2006. She has taken loans and repaid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to buy additional "banyeras" (big basins) of  fish to sell.  A portion of her profit is re-invested in her business and a portion has been saved for retirement.

loans.use: to buy additional "banyeras" of  fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 54 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school. Angelita works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. 

She has taken a PHP 8,750 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Angelita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years now. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rene Anibal

texts.es:
Rene de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado. Esta acompañado desde hace 9 años su pareja se dedica  a los oficios domésticos tienen en común 2 hijos los cuales estudian educación básica. 
 

 El cliente es albañil se dedica a la actividad desde hace 23 años, el trabajo lo aprendió siendo ayudante de albañil, también tiene otra actividad económica la cual es de trabajo en electricidad trabaja para una alcaldía, su horario es de 6 horas al día. Pero su principal fuente económica es la albañilería. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar bloque,  lamina,  hierro,   pues desea remodelar una parte de su casa que está en mal estado y necesita el préstamo para terminarlo antes que llegue el invierno. El préstamo le servirá para tener en un lugar seguro a su familia. 

Los sueños del cliente son seguir trabajando para darle a su familia una vida digna,  sueña con que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para que sean personas que sirvan a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Rene is 39 years old and studied until the 9th grade. He has been with his partner for 9 years, and she works in the home. They have 2 children who are in school. Rene has been a construction worker for 23 years, and he learned the trade by being an apprentice. He also earns money by working 6 hours a day as an electrician in a town hall, but his principle source of income is construction work. 

The loan Rene is requesting is to buy cement blocks, sheet metal, and iron bars, as he would like to repair a part of his house that is in bad shape. He needs the loan in order to be able to finish the work before winter. The loan will help him provide his family with a safe place to live. 

Rene hopes to continue working and providing his family with a decent life. He hopes that his children will continue with school and become useful members of society.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, sheet metals, and iron bars, as he would like to repair a part of his house which is in bad shape.

loans.name: Dila

texts.es:
Dila de 51 años de edad, es casada tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con ella, de estudio solo tiene primer grado ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos suficientes para que estudiara mucho mas. Sus hijos le ayudan en la casa, dependen de ella directamente, ella se dedica al servicio, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida, desde hace más de diez años, decidió dedicarse a esto ya que algunos amigos pasaban por donde ella vive y le preguntaban si vendía comida y desde ahí empezó  a vender comida con pocas personas, hasta que logro ampliarlo un poco mas y es así como ella está trabajando.

 El crédito lo necesita para incrementar su negocio, comparara mas víveres y otra plancha ya que la que tiene esta deteriorada, con lo cual manejara su negocio  y tendrá mejores ingresos, con respecto a sus sueños, ella tiene una nieta la cual quiere que estudie y que se supere en el futuro.
texts.en:
Dila is 51 years old, is married, and has three children, two of whom live with her.  She was only able to complete schooling through first grade since her parents did not have sufficient resources to allow her to study more.  Her children help her at home, and depend on her directly.  She works in the service sector and has her own small business where she sells food.  More than ten years ago she decided to dedicate herself to this field since some of her friends passed by where she lived and asked if she sold food and that was how she began to sell food to other people.  Later she was able to grow the business a bit more and that is what she does now. 

She needs a loan in order to grow her business.  She will purchase food items and a grill since the one she has is deteriorated.  This will help her improve her business and will offer better income.  With respect to her dreams, she has a grandchild and she would like her granddaughter to be able to go to school and to get ahead in the future.

loans.use: to purchase food items and a grill since the one she has is deteriorated.

loans.name: Almera

texts.en:
Almera is 23 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

Almera and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Almera is taking out a housing loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Almera has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Almera can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is married and lives in Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She earns a living by operating a transport service business where she generates a monthly income for the family. 

For more than six years, she has sustained the family's needs and successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying spare parts and accessories. Recently, she took a new loan to buy motor tires to replace the old ones and to renew necessary licenses. She dreams of business expansion one day.

loans.use: to buy motor tires to replace the old ones and to renew licenses

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 10 years now.

Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 45 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios' business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Remedios has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Remedios has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is also using this loan to pay for construction labor.

Remedios is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Isabel is 39 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Ma. Isabel has a beauty salon in the Philippines. Ma. Isabel requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and beauty products for her business.

Ma. Isabel has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Ma. Isabel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and beauty products

loans.name: Angélica Isabel

texts.es:
Angélica es una señora soltera de 24 años de edad, vive junto a su hija de 3 años de edad, actualmente viven en el Departamento de Sololá.
Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropa típica como; güipiles y cortes desde hace tres años, esta labor lo aprendió de su madre cuando era pequeña. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia.
Ella  ahora se ha dado cuenta que este producto cada vez tiene una fuerte demanda y es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para la compra de ropa típica, de esta manera podrá ofrecerles una gran variedad de estilos y colores a sus clientes. 
El sueño de doña Angélica es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad, con el objetivo de dar a conocer su negocio y así incrementar sus ganancias, para que en un futuro su familia viva en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Angélica is a 24 year-old single woman. She lives together with her 3 year-old daughter. Today they live in the Department of Sololá. She has sold traditional clothing for a living like traditional blouses and shirts for three years. She learned this trade from her mother when she was little. Through the income and profits that she makes she helps to contributed to the economy of the family.
She has now realized that this product has an increasingly strong demand and that is why she is requesting a loan of $650 to buy traditional clothing. In this way she will be able to offer her customers a great variety of styles and colors.
Angélica's dream is to have a shop in her community market so she can publicize her business and increase it's earnings so that in the future her family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis de 73 años de edad, estudio segundo grado de educación. Está casado desde hace 42 años  su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tuvieron en común 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno está en casa, todos son hogares a parte en casa del cliente viven 4 personas pues con el cliente viven dos nietos los cuales estudian educación básica.

El cliente tiene 60  años de dedicarse a la agricultura,  el trabajo lo aprendió de su padre quien le enseño la actividad de siembra de maíz, frijol, entre otros productos,  él solo tiene esa actividad económica y siempre se ha dedicado a eso. El lugar de trabajo está cerca de su casa,  pues vive en el mismo terreno donde vive lo que se le dificulta es el acercar  los insumos agrícolas hasta su casa pues recorre 23 kilómetros para llevarlos cuando los compra,  el horario de trabajo es de 6 horas al día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para  comprará insumos agrícolas como abonos, semillas, herbicidas, entre otros productos necesarios para cultivar maíz, maicillo  y frijoles.
El préstamo mejorara el negocio porque tendrá los insumos para sembrar más que el año pasado y tendrá un mejor ingreso la necesidad a satisfacer será la de adquirir los insumos agrícolas a tiempo.

Los sueños del cliente siguen siendo progresar atreves de la fuente que ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia y es la agricultura desea comprar otro terreno para expender su cultivo y tener un mejor ingreso para su familia desea seguir apoyándolos cuidándolos y darle a su esposa  lo que necesita.
texts.en:
Luis is 73 years old and has a high school education.  He has been married for 42 years, and his wife is a homemaker.  They have four children together, none of which live with them since they all have their own homes.  Four people live in Luis's home, as two of his grandchildren, who are in elementary school, live with him.  Luis has 60 years of experience working in agriculture, a trade that he learned from his father who taught him how to grow corn, beans and other products.  This is his only job, and he has always been dedicated to it.  His workplace is close to his home since he lives on the same land that he works on.  What is difficult for him is getting his agricultural supplies to his home because he travels 23 kilometers to buy them.  He works about six hours a day.  

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure, seeds, herbicides and other products needed to grow corn, sorghum and beans.  The loan will improve his business because he will have the supplies to plant more than he was able to last year, and he will generate more income.  The loan will satisfy his need to obtain the agricultural supplies in time.  The client's dreams are to continue to progress through his source of work to get his family ahead.  He wishes to purchase another plot of land to expand his crops and to have a greater income for his family.  He hopes to continue supporting them, taking care of them and giving his wife everything she needs.

loans.use: purchase manure, seeds, herbicides, and other products needed to grow corn, sorghum and beans.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Serafina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de planchado y pintura para vehículos motorozados,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pinturas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member is Serafina, she is part of the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  The member continues to work in her auto body repair and paint business.  She has been in this business for a long time, which has been going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it everyday.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman, which allows her to get her family ahead.

She is seeking this loan to purchase paint among other materials.  She is grateful for the loan and she is committed to making these established payments.

loans.use: purchase paint among other things.

loans.name: Franco Kilderd

texts.es:
El socio es Franco, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
El socio Franco continua con su negocio  imprenta, principalmente lo referente a diseño de publicidad impresa, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelanté.

El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
 Franco agradece a  KIVA por permitirle adquirir una herramienta que le ayude en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Franco is a member of the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Franco continues with his printing business, mainly designing advertising for businesses.  He has worked in this business for a long time, and it has gone well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his business everyday.  He hopes to continue working so that he can get ahead.

He is seeking a loan to purchase a laptop.  Franco is grateful for Kiva for allowing him to obtain a tool that will help him with his business.

loans.use: purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Randee

texts.en: Randee operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been in this business for more than four years, and he earns a good income for his family. With his income, he was able to provide for his family and successfully repay his previous loan, which he used to buy spare parts. Recently, he took a new loan  to buy a new set of tires to replace the old ones. Randee hopes to improve and expand his business. In the future, he wants to provide a better and comfortable living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires to replace the old ones

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn has been operating her own retail store for more than five years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to sustain the household's living and has improved the business constantly. The couple has had to work hard with the determination of having better income to provide their children a better education than they had. To improve sales, Jocelyn took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase additional varieties of fruit to sell. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of fruit to sell

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es: Asunción de 37 años de edad es artesana y desde hace tres años emprendió su negocio elaborando manualidades como pulseras, tobilleras, que vende diariamente de contado, en una intensa jornada que inicia a las 9 de la mañana y termina a las 9 dela noche. Sus clientes son principalmente visitantes del centro de la ciudad quienes la tiene identificada y otros nuevos que tienen preferencias por las artesanías, Su mayor desafío  es lograr el crecimiento de sus ventas y por esto está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos al por mayor como piedras, nylon etc. Con ello planea mejorar el negocio, porque  incrementaría la producción y nuevas ganancias. Asunción tiene 2 pequeños hijos, a los que está dispuesta ayudar en su formación de calidad y justamente son el motor de su vida.
texts.en: Asunción is 37 years old.  She is an artisan and three years ago, she started her own business making handicrafts such as bracelets and anklets that she sells daily during her intense workdays that start at 9am and end at 9pm.  Her customers are primarily visitors to the city center who already know her, and other new customers who enjoy crafts.  Her greatest challenge is achieving growth in her sales, which is why she is seeking a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to purchase supplies in bulk like stones, nylon, etc.  With these she plans on improving her business because she will be able to increase her production and make new earnings.  Asunción has two small children that she is committed to raising well, and who are her motivation in life.

loans.use: purchase supplies in bulk such as stones, nylon, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

Lourdes has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,225 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

With your help, Lourdes will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Glorieta

texts.en:
Glorieta is 61 years old and married with four children. The family lives in Bañadero in Ozamiz City. For the past three years she has sold fruit. She earns about 8,000 PHP a month.

Glorieta has been a member of PMPC for seven years and has previously taken out several loans. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through PMPC to buy more fruit like apples, oranges and melons to sell. She hopes to be able to make and save more money.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase papayas, bananas, pineapples, jocotes, etc.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс экономически активный молодой житель города Исфары. Ему 22 года. Он холост и живет с родителями. Фирдавс учится заочно на четвертом курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции по специализации "Экономика и управление на предприятиях". Одновременно в течение полтора года он работает оператором базы данных в Микрокредитной депозитной организации. Фирдавс способный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он хочет успешно закончить учебу, но сейчас у него финансовые трудности. В этом году он не смог оплатить за этот учебный год и поэтому обратился за кредитом. Он надеется на финансовую поддержку и обещает выплачивать кредит в срок.
texts.en: Firdavs is an economically active young man from the city of Isfara. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is studying via correspondence in his fourth year and the Tajik State University with a specialization in economics and business management. At the same time, he has been working for half a year with databases for microcredit deposit organizations. Firdavs is a capable and hard-working young man. He wants to successfully finish his studies but is currently having financial difficulties. He was not able to pay for his tuition this year and had to take out a loan. He hopes for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Djekadi vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de zambougou. Elles font le petit commerce,  de produit cosmétique, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2éme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Awa, en châle rouge, est une grande vendeuse de produits cosmétiques dans le village de zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité suffisante de pommade et de parfums    pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande de sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Awa  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  29 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Djekadi Group all live in traditional families. On average, they are 44 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Zambougou in Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, family, marriage, and business ties in Zambougou.

These women run small businesses, [selling] cosmetics, food, and grain. With the goal of expanding their businesses, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Awa, in the red shawl [in the photo], is a major cosmetics vendor in Zambougou and environs. She plans to use her loan to purchase a quantity of cream and perfume sufficient to meet steadily growing customer demand. Her [products] are sold for cash, often to both male and female customers.

Mrs. Awa hopes to see an average monthly profit of 29,000 CFA francs with this loan, which will be used to help her husband and to expand her business. She hopes to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is a widow with five children who operates a farm to make a living. Her children help her in harvesting coconut to sell in town. She has been in this business for ten years, and she earns her income to better provide for her family. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy organic fertilizer. In the future, Cerila wants to have a greener farm in order to ensure a better income for the family. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman who is 40 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leah has three children who are in school.

Leah has a retail dry goods business in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Leah has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Leah would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 48 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Angelita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Angelita is taking out a PHP 9,460 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Angelita has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is a 31-year-old married woman with three children who are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Teresa has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional bicycle for her business.

Ma. Teresa has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional unit og bicycle for her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old, married and has one child.

Gemma and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Gemma is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,610 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Gemma has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Gemma can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 19 years old and with two children who are in school, Vicky works very hard to provide for them.

Vicky's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Vicky has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Vicky has taken a PHP 8,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vicky is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en: Leng, residing in the Moung Ruusey district of Battambang province, is 43 years old and the father of one kid. To feed his entire family, he does rice farming on two hectares of farmland as the main source of income and a paid working job as the supplementary source of his income. He has been involved in this business for ages and he can earn an income of 31,700 KHR per day. Including this cycle, he is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) while his joint-borrower is a second-time borrower. He has successfully repaid his past loans and it has enabled him to uplift his living conditions better than before. Now, he joins a group of two to get a new loan. He is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and his co-borrower is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee. He hopes to gain a better yield than before and to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Djiguitougou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djiguitougou vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village zambougou de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village de zambougou. Elles font le petit commerce, de bois, de restauration et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1ér cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata  (3éme  de la  gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de bois de chauffe dans le village de zambougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 chargements de camionnettes en bois de chauffe pour satisfaire de plus en plus la demande de sa  clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  21 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé  pour aider son mari et augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of Djiguitougou Group all live together in traditional families. On average, they are 37 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Zambougou in Ségou (4th administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, families, marriage, and business ties in Zambougou.

These women run small businesses, [selling] wood, food, and grain. With the goal of expanding their businesses, the group members have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (third in the photo, left to right) is a major vendor of firewood in Zambougou and environs. She plans to use her loan to purchase two truckloads of firewood to meet growing customer demand. Her sales are made for cash, often to both male and female customers.

Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to see an average monthly profit of 21,000 CFA francs with this loan, which will be used to help her husband and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Aurelia ella es soltero y tiene 41 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganados, negocio de venta de fruta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These partners belong to the community bank "Las emprendedoras de andahualillas." This bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco. 

One partner is Sra. Aurelia; she is single and 41 years old. She works in the business of raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens to make them grow and fatten up and later she sells them in different markets. By way of this small business her children can come out ahead. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the guinea pigs and chickens. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and food for them.  

The other partners are dedicated to the businesses of selling cattle, selling fruit, and the grocery store and restaurant businesses. 

The partner is grateful to those who form part of this dream by this means and she promises to complete the payment of her bills in the established period.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Rosa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelanté a su familia.
 La socia Rosa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar llantas para su carro.
La socia Rosa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar en su actividad económica y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuota establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the “Señor de los Temblores II” (Lord of the Tremors II) communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru. 
She continues to provide taxi services, she's worked on this activity for a while and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it, she is very responsible and hardworking, with this business she gets her family ahead.
At this time, Rosa needs the loan to buy tires for her car. 
Rosa is very grateful to KIVA for helping her to continue with her economic activity and commits to meet the repayment terms.

loans.use: to buy tires for her taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanised sheet metal to repair the roof, as well as to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is sixty years old, married and has nine children. She and her family survived Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Her business and family home, however, were destroyed.

Rosita was a NWTF client starting a year before the typhoon hit. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP housing loan to buy construction materials and pay for labor to start rebuilding her house for her family. She plans to get back on her feet through her farm and would like to see her farming efforts recover the life she and her family had.

With your help Rosita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Typhoon Haiyan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor to start rebuilding her house

loans.name: Ivonne Jasbleidy

texts.es:
Ella es Ivonne Jasbleidy una gran mujer con propósitos y sueños que desea realizar al darse cuenta día a día que la vida es solamente una que todas las oportunidades que se presenten en la vida hay que aprender aprovecharlas por difíciles obstáculos que se presenten, aprender de los errores y buscar siempre un deseo de superación para sentirse realizada como ser humano.
Así a lo largo del camino, de la vida, de las experiencias vividas, podrá sentir que a pesar de los fracasos, tristezas y decepciones logro con esfuerzo preparase demostrarse a sí misma, cuan valiosa  es  y comprobar que los sacrificios y luchas valen la pena.
Por estas razones ella desea y solicita el convenio con kiva para salir adelante, prepararse como persona, cumplir un sueño y ser el orgullo de la familia, ayudar así en el proceso de los hijos, ofreciéndoles una mejor calidad de vida, ya que por muchas razones económicas no había podido realizar el sueño de estudiar estética y cosmetología.
Ella agradecerá todo el apoyo que le puedan ofrecer para ser una excelente alumna,  comprometida y dedicada a prepárese a futuro para poner en práctica todo el conocimiento y así realizar el sueño de ser independiente y una excelente esteticista cosmetóloga, cumplidora del deber y dejando en alto el nombre de la institución que le brindo el conocimiento y el apoyo para gracias a ello tener una calidad de vida excelente
Apoyando también a muchas personas que sufren  por la baja autoestima, y por la falta de amor propio, ya que por malos hábitos y descuidos esto causa serios problemas y hace que las personas no lleven una vida feliz, por ese aspecto desea prepararse mucho, ya que le parece muy bonito trabajar con seres humanos, y con los buenos conocimientos,  ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ivonne Jasbleidy is a great woman with goals and dreams that she wants to achieve. She has learned that life is all about seizing life’s, learning from the obstacles that arise, and having a desire to continually improve to find personal fulfillment. Through her experiences she has learned along the way that  despite failures, sorrows, and disappointments, she has been able to prove to herself that the sacrifices and struggles she makes are valuable and worth it.

For these reasons she wants and requests a loan from kiva to get ahead, prepare herself, fulfill her dream and make her family proud, and in the process help her children, offering them a better quality of life. For many economic reasons she has been unable to achieve her dream of studying aesthetics and cosmetology.

She would appreciate all the support you can offer to be an excellent student, committed and dedicated to prepare for the future where she will implement all that she will learn in school, and thus achieve her goal of being independent and an excellent beautician. She will be dutiful and leave a good name for her institution.

This will also support the many people who suffer from low self-esteem and self-love, which can cause serious problems and make people unhappy. This is why she wants to study this: she thinks it would be great to work with people, and with good knowledge, improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 30 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Marife works very hard to provide for them.

Marife runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sugar, eggs, noodles, bath soap, sanitary pads and diapers to sell.

Marife has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items including those listed above and more. 

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sugar, eggs, noodles, bath soap, sanitary pads and diapers to sell

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is married with four children. She is 51 years old and lives at Embargo, Ozamiz City.

To earn a living, Catalina is a farmer and a businesswoman who owns a small sari-sari store. She has had this business for 10 years . Each month, she earns approximately PHP 7,000. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and took several loans already. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase sacks of rice, canned goods, soft drinks and other items. 

In the future, she hopes to improve and save money.

loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Hegenio

texts.en: Hegenio has been operating a transportation service-based business to earn a living. He has been doing this for more than seven years and he earns a good income to sustain his family's living. With his generated revenue, he has successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for motor repairs. Recently, he took a new loan to purchase a set of tire to replace the old one to ensure more secure service. He hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a set of tires to replace the old ones

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Elsa's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. .Elsa is taking a PHP 8,150 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Elsa has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ray's Group

texts.en:
Ray is 25 years old and the mother of two schoolchildren. She lives in the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchhey province. To support her family she farms rice and sells groceries. She has done so for six years and makes about 20,000 KHR a day.

Ray has taken out and repaid six previous loans with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. They helped her to buy needed home appliances and support the family. Now she leads a group of two in order to request a 700,000 KHR loan. She will take 500,000 KHR of it and her joint-borrower, 200,000 KHR.

Ray plans to use her entire loan portion to buy more groceries to sell. She is working to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Leidy

texts.es: Leidy de 23 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de bolsos femeninos, que provienen del taller de sus padres dedicados a la producción de estos, desde hace muchos años. Sus principales clientes son almacenes de la ciudad, amigos y referidos, a quienes ofrece  sus productos a crédito y de contado. Su día laboral inicia desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde. Leidy mas adelante planea abrir un punto comercial o almacén, para exhibir sus bolsos, con le fin de aumentar sus ventas y fidelizar a la clientela con productos de calidad y buenos precios, que es su mayor desafío. Su meta personal es tener su propia apartamento y día a día trabaja sin apartarse de ese sueño.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara bolsos en mayor volumen, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y utilidades.
texts.en:
23-year old Leidy has been selling the women's bags that her parents make in their workshop for many years. Her main customers are local stores, friends, and people who are referred to her. She offers the products both on credit and for cash. 

Leidy's day starts at 8 am and lasts until 6 at night. In the future she would like to have premises or a store where she can display the bags and thus increase sales. Her greatest challenge is finding a way to promote the quality and fair prices of the items.

Her personal goal is to have an apartment of her own and continue working without losing sight of her dream. Leidy is now applying for a loan from Kiva, her first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy more bags so she can increase sales and income.

loans.use: Buy more bags

loans.name: Bok's Group

texts.en: Bok is a villager from the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchhey province. She is a married mother and blessed with three children. The grocery and coconut businesses are the main sources for her to earn an income to feed the family. She has had the businesses for ages. This business has earned her 15,000 KHR per day. Bok has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before and she is the leader of a group consisting of two borrowers. She and her co-borrower are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to earn better income so that she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines.

Ramona requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle.

Ramona has been in this business for six years now.

Ramona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,910 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

With your help Adoracion will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Adoracion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Chun's Group

texts.en: A villager from Kampong Cham province, Chun is 38 years old. She has five children, two of whom are currently in school. Rice and cucumber farming are the main sources for her to earn income to support her family. It is the business that she has occupied for 18 years, and it returns her 38,300 KHR per day. This is the first-cycled loan for her and her group members. The group of three is requesting 1,400,000 KHR each with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, and to pay plowing fees. She hopes to expand her business to a larger scale than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay plowing fees

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Yohanis

texts.en:
Yohanis is a 51-year-old man who is married to Dina, a 46-year-old woman. They have been blessed with 4 children:  Frangky, 28, a worker; Suzan, 26; Wendy, 24, both of whom are married; and the last one is Catrin, 14, a junior high school student. 

Yohanis has a business reselling crops such as vegetables and coconuts. He has been involved in this business for four years. He buys the crops from the farmer in the village to resell them to the trader at the market in town.  He started the business by using his savings as business capital. To make more income, his wife supports him by selling some snacks in front of their house. 

Recently, he plans to buy crops in large quantity to increase his income. Due to the lack of money, he applied for a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. The loan will be used to purchase more crops to resell them at the market. He is expecting that the business will run well to enable him to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more crops to resell to the market

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en: Felisa is 64 years old, married, and has no children. She lives in Langub, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She has operated a sari-sari store (variety store) for four years, and earns a monthly income of 6,000 PHP. She joined Paglaum in 2013 because she needed additional capital for her store. Recently, she availed a loan to buy more inventory to sell. She wanted to purchase kilos of sugar, canned goods, laundry soap, and other items.

loans.use: to buy inventory, such as sugar, canned goods, and laundry soap

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca has been operating her sewing business for many years and she earns well from this. With her business, she has been able to provide and sell curtains and bedsheets to her customers.  Rebecca works hard with determination to provide better services and increase her income. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy additional textiles. In the future, Rebecca hopes to save a portion of her income for future needs.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 34-years-old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Ruby and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ruby is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,635 in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ruby has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Ruby can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Salome requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.  She has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Salome would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Greis

texts.es: Greis de 22 años de edad se dedica a la venta de materiales didácticos  desde hace 4 años. Su experiencia data desde que ayudaba a su suegra en la comercialización de estos artículos y ganaba comisiones por esta tarea, lo cual fue muy útil, pues estudiando secretariado desde sus prácticas, quedó empleada y esos ingresos le sirvieron para invertir y sus compañeras de trabajo fueron los primeros clientes. . Desde ese momento Greis empezó a hacer pedidos y su suegra le ayudaba a vender sellos didácticos, cojines, alfombras, los cuales ofrece mediante catálogos. Su meta es tener un capital superior para satisfacer la demanda de la clientela, tener su propia cas pero su mayor desafío es lograr el dinero para invertir, Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  sellos didácticos, columpios, inflables, cuerpo humano de madera, alfombras en fomy y rompecabezas.  Con esta inversión Greis potencializará la demanda de clientes, principalmente ubicados en los colegios que están a su alrededor.
texts.en:
Greis, who is 22 years old, has been working selling early childhood teaching materials for the past four years. She first started gaining experience while helping her mother-in-law to sell these items and earning a commission for her sales. This was very useful because since she studied to become a secretary and was hired after her internship, this income allowed her to invest and her coworkers became her first customers. From then on, Greis started making orders and got help from her mother-in-law to sell rubber stamps, pillows, rugs, and other items, which she offers through a catalog. 

Her goal is to have more capital in order to satisfy her customers' demand. She wants to have her own house, but the biggest challenge she faces is how to obtain enough money to be able to invest. That is the reason why she is turning to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan, which will be her first. She will use it to buy rubber stamps, swings, inflatables, a wooden human body model, foam play mats, and puzzles. This investment will allow Greis to promote demand by customers, located mainly in nearby schools.

loans.use: to buy rubber stamps, swings, inflatables, a wooden human body model, foam mats, and puzzles.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Elsa to improve her business. She is married and has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. With the loan, she will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, bread, coffee, sugar and salt. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Elsa independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, bread, coffee, sugar and salt

loans.name: Reisly

texts.en:
Reisly is a married woman with eight children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Reisly is 40 years old.

Reisly has a shell craft business in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc. for her business.

Reisly has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like shells, wire, nylon threads, etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor de 37 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos así como muestra la fotografía  para luego comercializarla en los diferentes mercados, vive en casa propia con su familia, Victor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así continuar con las siembras ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victor is 37 years old and has been working growing corn for several years. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in sacks like the ones in the picture, and then sells it in different markets. He lives in his own home with his family. 

Victor is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, weed killer, etc. so that he can keep farming, because this is his only source of work and he wants to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, weed killer, etc.

loans.name: Norma Maribel

texts.es: Norma de 38 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella es una mujer muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. Ella trabaja en su propio negocio  en la que elabora pupusas y pizza, posee mucha clientela.  Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de chicharron, maíz, quesillo, frijoles, harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su negocio es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is a very responsible woman who is always looking to improve her financial stability. She has her own business where she prepares pupusas [thick, stuffed corn tortillas] and pizza; she has many customers.

She is requesting a loan from Integral to have the help necessary to invest in the purchase of pork cracklings, corn, fresh cheese, beans, flour, yeast, butter, cans, and everything she needs to be able to produce more. This improvement project for her business is very important for her because in this way she will improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy pork cracklings, corn, fresh cheese, beans, flour, yeast, butter, cans, and other necessary items

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Marisol, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia Marisol sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva buen con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma sacar adelanté a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member's name is Marisol. She belongs to the communal bank Señor de los Temblores II, in the city of Cusco, Peru. Marisol is still working as a street food vendor. Work is going well for her thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business. She is a responsible and diligent person, and she wants to keep working in order to provide for her family.

Marisol is requesting this loan to buy ingredients like oil, rice, and other items. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like oil and rice.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 55-years-old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lourdes has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lourdes has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lourdes is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 32 years old, married and has one child.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Maricar is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Maricar has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her business.

With your help, Maricar can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en: Chan is a 52-year-old mother of eight children. She lives in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. To cover her daily cost of living, she farms rice as the main source of income and she weaves palm leaves as a supplementary source of income. It is the business that she has had for ages and it has returned her 35,600 KHR per day. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is not the original loan for her and her joint borrowers. She used her past loan with success to improve her lifestyle at a gradual pace. The total requesting loan amount of her entire group is 2,900,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she is planning to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farmland. She promptly hopes it will be sufficient her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
A USD 700 loan is offered to Ermelinda to improve her business. Ermelinda opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, like water, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, and bread. 

Ermelinda is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy water, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, and bread.

loans.name: Sok Eng's Group

texts.en: Sok Eng is a widowed mother of one kid and she is 59 years old. The main sources of income for her family are from rice farming and mango selling business to feed her family. She has been occupied in this business for 39 years and has earned decent income. Now, she leads a group of two and they are second-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loans, which she has repaid back completely, has improved of her lifestyle. Now, she is requesting a loan for 1,400,000 KHR and it is the same amount as her co-borrower. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes her business will improve so as she can better her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticide, and to pay for plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Qorilazo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Estefa ella es soltera y tiene 36 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These memberes belong to the communal bank Qorilazo, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Estefa is one of this communal bank's members. She is 36 years old, single, and has one child. She works at her business, which is a grocery store where she sells basic staples like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for one year and it is going very well. Her dream would be to expand her grocery store. She is requesting this loan to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

She is grateful to everyone who makes this dream possible by making these resources available. She promises to comply with all her repayments terms.

The other members do business selling fruit, selling food, and running grocery stores and restaurants.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Mara Del Carmen

texts.es: Mara es Lic. en Química y Farmacia, es madre soltera con un hijo a quien le brinda todo su apoyo para sus estudios, Mara está muy contenta porque su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la misma de su profesión, pues tiene una pequeña farmacia ubicada en su casa de habitación, siendo este su principal motor de ingresos para sus gastos familiares, solicita el crédito para invertir con mas medicamentos en su farmacia, ella espera en un futuro crecer económicamente con otra farmacia en un mercado local.
texts.en:
Mara has a degree in chemistry and pharmacy.  She is a single mother with a child whose studies she supports completely.  Mara is very happy because the occupation that she makes her living at is also her profession, since she has a small pharmacy in her home which is her primary source of income for her family expenses.  

She is requesting this loan to invest in more medicines for her pharmacy and she hopes to expand financially with a second pharmacy in the local market in the future.

loans.use: to buy pharmacy products (medicines)

loans.name: Ñaupasunchis Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinas y amigas formaron el banco comunal “Ñaupasunchis” en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Milagros tiene 25 años de edad y nació en la ciudad del Cusco, ella es diseñadora grafica trabaja de forma independiente, ella tiene varios clientes que le piden trabajos porque sus trabajos son de buena calidad, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Naupasunchis” de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como papel, tintas, papeles especiales y otras cosas más. Esta feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed a communal bank “Ñaupasunchis” in the beautiful city of Cusco.  The partners are grateful for the opportunity offered in general and promise to meet their different payments on the established timetable.

Milagros is 25 years old and was born in the city of Cusco.  She is an independent graphic designer and has various clients that ask for her work because it is of good quality.  She is a member of the communal bank “Ñaupasunchis” in the city of Cusco.  At this time, she requires the loan to buy work materials such as paper, ink, specialty papers and other things.  She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as paper, ink, specialty papers and other things

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie is 36 years old and married with two school-age children. She is from Bonifacio, Calamba. She has operated a sari-sari (convenience) store business for one year to provide for her family.  She joined Paglaum last year because she believes that Paglaum is an instrument for her business to grow. She applied a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, and oil. The profit she earns from her business will be saved through Paglaum for the education of her two children.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods, and oil

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en: Lucresia is married with 3 children. She is 65 years old and lives in Silucap, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Lucresia is a farmer who manages her own rubber land to earn a living. She has managed this rubber land for 10 years. She has requested a loan to pay for land preparation. Lucresia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Lucresia hopes to maintain her rubber land.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en: Carlito has been operating a gardening business venture to earn a living and he has been two years in this business. He earns good income from this while also taking the responsibility in raising pigs for sale. With his generated income, his previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. He took a loan recently to buy feeds for his pigs. In the future, Carlito wants to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for his pigs.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en: Pedrito is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children. Pedrito owns & operates a manufacturing business, making and selling Nipa (a type of palm) products in their village. He earns good income from this. Aside from this, Pedrito is engaged in a service based business providing transportation and he earns more income to sustain their living. Recently, he took a new loan to buy new tires for his motorcycle for secure and better client services. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en: Concordia has been operating a general store selling a variety of products and has had this business for more than twelve years. She earns good income from this and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Concordia wants to improve the business to ensure better income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Sher Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sher Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready to wear in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling cellular phones and herbal products. Sher Ann is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more ready to wear stock like bags, watches, accessories, etc. to sell for her business.

Sher Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear stock like bags, watches, accessories, etc. to sell

loans.name: Azeneth

texts.en:
Azeneth is 33 years old and a widow. Azeneth works very hard to provide for her family.

Azeneth's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Azeneth has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Azeneth has taken a PHP 9700 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Azeneth is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly Mae is 29 years old and has a live-in partner with three children. With one child currently in school, Shirly Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Shirly Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Shirly Mae has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cereals, sugar, cooking oil, vinegar, detergent soap, etc. 

Shirly Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is 51 years old and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jenita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jenita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jenita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jenita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 42-year old married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vilma has a general store business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Vilma has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Vilma  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 49 years old and a widow with three children, one of whom is in school. Edita works very hard to provide for them.

Edita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Edita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Edita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Edita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old, married, and has four children who are in school.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Emily is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Emily has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through farming rice.

With your help, Emily can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Erminia

texts.en: Erminia is taking a loan of $800 (USD) to improve her business. She is running a grocery kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock such as coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, and noodles. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hard-working woman and hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, and noodles

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo de 51 años de edad,  tiene una pequeña tienda al sur de la ciudad, donde vende víveres, licores, refrescos, cárnicos, lácteos y mercancías de primera necesidad, que compran las amas de casa diariamente, para el consumo doméstico. Su negocio data desde hace 3 años, aunque toda su vida conoció esta experiencia pues sus padres tuvieron tienda y lo transmitieron a su tradición. Hoy Gonzalo habita con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 5 años, y sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia proviene de su tienda. Su meta mas adelante es tener 2 puntos comerciales mas en otros sectores y una licorería, pero su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr invertir y crecer. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Marido Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  víveres, productos lácteos, y refrescos.   Con su inversión  proveniente del crédito, ampliará el inventario de mercancías y con ello poco a poco iniciará el ascenso hacia el logro de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, who is 51 years old, has a small store in the south of the city where he sells grocery items, liquor, soft drinks, meat and dairy products, and other essential goods that local housewives purchase daily for their homes. This business has been running for three years, although Gonzalo has always been in this line of work. His parents used to have a store and passed on the tradition. He currently lives with his wife and has three children, whose ages are between one and five. The income he earns to provide for his family comes from his store.

His future goal is to have two more business locations in other areas, as well as a liquor store, but his biggest challenge is how to generate enough working capital to be able to invest and expand. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to by groceries, dairy products, and soft drinks.
