He will use this loan to invest in increasing his inventory of merchandise, which will allow him to gradually work his way up toward achieving his dreams.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, dairy products, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Neth's Group

texts.en: Neth, 41, is a local villager from Kampong Cham province and the mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support her four children who remain in school. She supports her family by farming cassava and cashews as the main business to earn a decent income. She has been involved in the business for 23 years. Neth is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is forming a group of two to get a new loan. She and her co-borrower are requesting loan for 2,000,000 KHR and 1,500,000 KHR respectively. As a leader, she will spend a portion of the loan to buy insecticide, fertilizer and to pay for plowing, labor, and harvesting fees for her cassava farmland. She hopes to expand her farmland on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer and to pay for plowing, labor and harvesting fees

loans.name: Trea's Group

texts.en: Trea is a young mother of four children; two of them are in school and the remaining two are too young for schooling. To overcome her financial burden, she grows cassava as the main source of income for her family. She has engaged in this current business for 11 years and it has generated income 25,000 KHR per day. She is in the second cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader. She and her co-borrower are seeking a loan with the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for plowing, harvesting, and labor fees. She has strong hopes to collect better yield than last year and to improve her family condition of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide, and to pay for plowing, harvesting, and labor fees

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Мархабо трудолюбивая, энергичная женщина. Она Замужем и имеет троих детей.Ей 36 лет.  Мархабо выросла в селе далеко от города. С самого детства ей привили любовь к родному селу и земле. Родители Мархабо вырастили своих детей занимаясь земледелием и животноводством. Выйдя замуж Мархабо стала помогать своему мужу и также стала заниматься привычным для себя земледелием на своем участке. Сейчас у Мархабо растут прекрасные дети. Пока они учатся. Но так как сельские дети с ранних пор приучаются  к труду,  дети Мархабо тоже помогают родителям. Они тоже понемногу разбираются в земледелии , а также помогают содержать домашний скот и ухаживают за домашней птицей.
 Они также как и родители понимают, что трудом они смогут достигнуть в будущем желаемого. Для того чтобы засеять землю пшеницей Мархабо требуется дополнительная сумма, для приобретения семян. Мархабо хочет взять  кредит в "Арванде" для приобретения семян пшеницы.
texts.en: Marhabo is a hardworking, energetic woman. She is married and has three children. She is 36 years old. Marhabo grew up in the village far from the city. Since childhood, she has held a love for her native village and home. Marhabo's parents raised their children to engage in agriculture and animal husbandry. After marriage, Marhabo began to help her husband, and also began farming her own plot of land. Now, Marhabo is raising beautiful children. For now, they are in school. But because rural children learn hard work from a young age, Marhabo's children also help their parents. They also know a bit about agriculture, help raise livestock and care for poultry. Like their parents, they realize that, with hard work, they can achieve the future they desire. Marhabo needs additional money to purchase seeds in order to sow wheat. Marhabo wants to request a loan from "Arvand" to purchase wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds

loans.name: Roxana Yamileth

texts.es: Roxana tiene 19 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar y de ella depende su madre económicamente. Roxana es una joven emprendedora quien desde hace muchos años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y le ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar. Roxana desea construir un cerco perimetral para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de materiales como: cemento, tela metálica, arena, grava, etc. Espera contar con este apoyo y así dar mayor seguridad a sus pocas pertenencias y a su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana is 19 years old and lives in her own home with her family. Her mother depends on her financially. Roxana is an entrepreneurial young woman that has sold catalog beauty products for many years. She makes her livelihood by selling door-to-door, and because of this, she is able to help her family with the household expenses.

Roxana would like to build a perimeter fence which is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest into the purchase of materials such as cement, wire mesh, sand, gravel, etc. She hopes to receive this help in order to keep her few possessions and her family safe.

loans.use: to buy cement, wire mesh, sand, gravel, etc. to build a wall around her property

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es: Celia de 52 años es separada con 04 hijos independientes y pertenece al grupo “Las Palmeras” la cual está conformada por 05 socios trabajadores dedicados a distintas actividades de comercio. Celia se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su trabajo a mejorado su vivienda. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de ropa como chompas, camisas, polos y blusas. Su mayor anhelo es de contar con una carreta donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Palmeras” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar en su progreso.  Celia es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo rojo.
texts.en:
Celia is 52 years old and separated with 4 independent children. She belongs to the "Las Palmeras" group, which is made up of 5 hardworking partners who each participate in different commercial occupations. 

Celia makes a living buying and selling clothes, which she does by taking orders. She is happy because her work has improved her livelihood. The loan she requested will allow her to buy clothing articles such as sweaters, dress shirts, t-shirts, and blouses. She longs to buy a cart where she can offer her products. 

The communal bank "Las Palmeras" thanks Kiva investors for supporting their advancement. Celia is the second from the left wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as sweaters, dress shirts, t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara is married and blessed with six children. Her husband is a farmer. She established her own small business to help support her husband in generating income for the family. Genara raises pigs to sell commercially. She earns more income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her piggery business and was able to sustain it. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional piglets to raise. She hopes that in the near future, her business will be improve.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets

loans.name: Elona

texts.en: Elona is 47 years old, and married with 2 adult age children. She is from Siloy, Calamba. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store for 3 years. She joined Paglaum in 2013 to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods and oil. Elona wants to earn more profit so she can sustain her store and continually provide for the family.

loans.use: to restock her general store

loans.name: Decilyn

texts.en: Decilyn is a very dedicated daughter who wants to become successful in the future. She studies at a university to fulfill her dreams. Her father works as a carpenter while her mother runs a buy-and-sell business. Decilyn needs financial assistance to pay her tuition fees. With her GDMPC education loan, she will be able to continue her studies and hopefully in the future, she would find a good job she desires.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
This is Merlina, 56, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She, together with her children manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Merlina operates a school/office supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pens, bond paper, cartolina (cardstock), and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy school/office supplies to expand her product inventory.

Merlina hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams of having a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for school/office supplies to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 31-year-old married woman. Helen has one child, who is in school.

Helen and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Her business and family home was wiped out. 

Helen is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Helen has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her sari-sari store.

With your help, Helen can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Cisa

texts.en:
Ma. Cisa is 49 years old, married, and has five children, two in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ma. Cisa is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ma. Cisa has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through farming rice.

With your help, Ma. Cisa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 42 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Margie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Margie has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Margie is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 23 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ailene's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ailene has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ailene is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home

loans.name: Enemesia

texts.en:
Enemesia is 52 years old, married with ten children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Enemesia has a rice retail business in the Philippines. Enemesia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Enemesia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Enemesia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jerly

texts.en:
Jerly is 46 years old and has two children.

Jerly and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jerly has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her rice farming.

With your help, Jerly can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She would like to save enough money so she could expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 49 year old, married with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Salvacion has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for six years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario de 70 años de edad, , es un hombre trabajador, vive con su esposa, ya que sus hijos ya se acompañaron, el señor no estudio, no sabe leer ni escribir, ya que su familia no tenía los suficientes recursos para que él estudiara, y otro factor que contribuyó a eso fue que la escuela le quedaba demasiado lejos , solamente su esposa depende de él ya que solamente ellos dos viven en la casa, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y él a la agricultura, crianza de cerdos entre otras casas , él trabaja todo los días en los horarios de seis de la mañana  a tres de la tarde.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas,  algunos cerdos  y también para un terreno , esto le ayudara a él a obtener mejores ingresos , con lo que mejorara su estado de vida , con respecto a sus sueños quiere tener mejores ingresos para cuando ya no pueda seguir trabajando él tendrá algunos ahorros.
texts.en:
Mario is seventy years old. He is a hard worker and lives with his wife, since his children already live with their partners. He didn't go to school and cannot read or write, because his family didn't have enough resources for him to go to school. Another contributing factor was that the school was too far away. His wife is his only dependant because it's just the two of them living at home. His wife is a homemaker and he is a farmer. He also raises pigs and does other things. He works every day from 6:00 am to 3:00 pm.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, some pigs, and also a plot of land. This will help him obtain a better income, which will improve his living standards. As far as dreams are concerned, he would like to make more income so that he can have some savings left when he is no longer able to work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, some pigs, and also a plot of land.

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru:
Мунавар  50 лет. Она замужем и вырастила троих детей. Образование  у нее среднее. Исконным занятием её семьи 
является земледелие и садоводство.С детства она приучена  к этому труду. Вот и трое её детей также выросли 
помогая родителям выращивать хлопок, и ухаживая за садом. Семья Мунавар растет ведь появляются внуки и 
потребности возрастают. Мунавар с мужем и детьми каждый год с любовью засеивают свой участок хлопком. Новое 
поколение ее семьи растет и Мунавар хотелось бы , чтобы её внуки получили хорошее образование и стали 
специалистами в области агрономии.  Для  достижения этих целей в этом году семья Мунавар хочет приобрести семена высокопродуктивного хлопка и засеять участки земли между садовыми деревьями очистив её от камней. Для этих целей она хочет взять кредит в "Арванде". Она благодарна что "Арванд" предоставит  ей возможность реализовать поставленные цели.
texts.en: Munavar is 50 years old. She married and has raised three children. She has a middle school education. Her family's occupation is farming and gardening. She has been accustomed to this work since childhood. So, her three children have also grown up helping their parents grow cotton and caring for the garden. Munavar's family is growing because there are grandchildren and the family's needs are increasing. Munavar, her ​​husband and their children plant cotton every year with love. The new generation of her family is growing up, and Munavar would like to see her grandchildren receive a good education and become specialists in the field of agronomy. To achieve these goals, this year Munavar's family wants to buy high-yield seeds and sow cotton in plots of land between the orchard, which has been cleared of stones. For this purpose, she wants to request a loan from "Arvand ". She is grateful that "Arvand" will give her the opportunity to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy cotton seeds

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her home.

loans.name: Ulmasoi

texts.ru:
Улмасой очень рада что обратилась в Арванд за помощью. У нее очень добрая душа и сердце, Улмасой долгое время работала в пекарном цеху, по состоянию здоровья и пенсионного возраста ушла с работы. Но она не может сидеть, сложа руки, и надеется на помощь своих близких и детей. ЕЕ дети давно выросли и имеют свои семьи , потому Улмасой   хочет иметь  свой заработок, хоть и небольшой.
 У нее есть дома корова которое дает молоко и теленок.  Она продает молочные продукты на базаре , это приносит ей небольшой заработок. Также Улмасой  получает пенсию, но пенсия хватает только на пропитание, она также нуждается в лечении, на которые уходят большие деньги. После долгой работы в цеху у нее начали болеть ноги и спина, И каждый раз просить денег у детей она не хочет.  Она планирует жить на то что вскоре теленок подрастет и она сможет его продать. И это ей хватит на лечение и пропитание тоже. 
 Улмасой   хочет на приобретенный кредит купить корм для скота. Для этого она хочет получить кредит в Аравнде и очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Ulmasoi is very glad that she has turned to Arvand for help. She has a very good heart and soul. For a long time, Ulmasoi worked in a bakery, but left work due to her health and advanced age. However, she cannot sit idly by, and hopes to help her loved ones and children. Her children have long ago grown up and have their own families.  Therefore, Ulmasoi wants to have her own income, however small . She has a cow that gives milk and calf. She sells dairy products at the market, it brings her a small income. Ulmasoi also receives a pension, but the pension is only enough to buy food. Ulmasoi also needs medical treatment, which costs a lot of money. After a long time working hard at the bakery, she began to have aching legs and back, and she does not wan to ask her children for money every time. Soon, the calf will grow up and she will be able to sell it for money to live on. This will be enough for her treatment and food. Ulmasoi wants to a loan to purchase feed for the cattle. To do this, she wants to get a loan in Aravnd and is hoping for support.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed

loans.name: Gumercienda

texts.en:
Gumercienda works hard to support her family. Gumercienda is married and has a shell craft business in the Philippines.

Gumercienda requested a PHP 60,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Gumercienda has been in this business for 10 years now.

Gumercienda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en: Ren, 33, is a villager from Kampong Cham province and married. She has three children who still are her responsibility; two are in school and one is too young for school. To support the household, Ren raises pigs as a single source of income. She has been raising pigs for 15 years. This business earns her about 19,400 KHR per day.  This is the second loan for Ren and third loan for her joint borrower. She has repaid back her past loan completely and now her livelihood is getting better than before. In a group of two, she is a leader. She is seeking a loan of 1,5000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. For Ren, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pigs and pig feed. She hopes to raise her pigs healthily so as to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Doris Elena

texts.es:
La señora Doris es la propietaria de un hermoso cultivo de flores desde hace 5 años cuando, donde aprendió la actividad gracia a su esposo que por cosas del destino falleció pero en honor a su esposo, Doris y sus tres hijos siguen desarrollando su actividad y quieren volverla una tradición familiar, le venden a  una distribuidora, las flores como ya sabemos es una manifestación hermosa de un sentimiento y son muy delicadas y difíciles de mantener cualquier sobresalto climático puede deteriorarlas lo que ha causado pérdidas a Doris.
Solicita un crédito para mantener su hermoso cultivo de flores que podemos apreciar en las fotos y tener herramientas más apropiadas para que en todo el proceso hecho desde el inicio hasta la entrega final salga de mejor calidad por ende quiere adquirir guadañas, lámparas, alambres. Su gran sueño es hacer crecer sus cultivos y que su esposo desde algún lugar del cielo los vea crecer y que se sienta orgullo de lo hecho por su familia
texts.en:
Doris has been the owner of a beautiful flower plantation for the past five years. She learned the business from her husband who, as fate would have it, passed away. In his honor, Doris and her three children have kept the business going and want to make it a family tradition. They sell their product to a distributor. As we know, flowers are a beautiful way of expressing feelings, and they are also very delicate and difficult to maintain. Any unexpected change in weather can make them deteriorate, which has caused Doris losses in the past.

She is requesting a loan in order to maintain her beautiful flower plantation, which we can appreciate in the picture, and to buy more appropriate tools so that the entire process may yield better quality, from the very beginning to the final delivery. That is why she wants to purchase scythes, lamps, and wire. Her dream is to be able to expand her plantation and for her husband to see it grow from somewhere in heaven so that he is proud of what his family has done.

loans.use: to buy scythes, lamps and wire, in order to deliver a better final product.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La esperanza es un grupo nuevo, que está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es un grupo que tiene las esperanzas puestas en las capacitaciones que irán recibiendo, y que les será de mucha ayuda.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Irma, ella es artesana elabora artículos artesanales, se mantiene con una actitud de seguir trabajando de manera constante con la ayuda de sus hijos teniendo como propósito ganar más dinero, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, valora el esfuerzo de su trabajo que mediante eso ella está notando el progreso dentro de su hogar.
La Sra. Irma solicita este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para la elaboración de artículos artesanales como ser telas, hilos, pegamentos y demás. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
"La Esperanza" (Hope) is a new group that is in its first loan cycle. This group has faith in the training that they will be receiving and that it will be of much help to them. 

One of the group's members is Irma. She is a artisan who makes handicrafts. It is important to her to keep working steadily, with the help of her children, because her objective is to make more money. With this work, she is improving her economic situation and she recognizes the value of this hard work, as, due to this, she is noticing the progress within her home. 

Irma is asking for this loan to be able to buy more supplies, such as fabrics, thread, glue, etc., to make her craft itams, 

All of the women are very grateful for this opportunity they have been given.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, glue, etc.

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Esta es la Alcancía “Paz Y Progreso” está constituida por 10 mujeres que buscan mejorar cada día, la gran mayoría de ellas vecinas de la zona. Guadalupe de 63 años  es viuda y tiene 02 hijos independientes. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de comida como arroz con pollo. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es de contar con un local ya que hasta el momento realiza ambulatoriamente. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, carne y verduras.  El grupo “Paz Y Progreso” agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Guadalupe es la segunda del lado derecho y tiene puesto gorra blanco.
texts.en:
This is the communal bank “Paz Y Progreso” formed by ten women who seek to improve each day. Most of them are neighbors from the area. 

Guadalupe is a sixty-three year-old widow with two children who are independent. Currently she makes a living selling food, like rice with chicken. She feels happy because thanks to her efforts she can offer her kids a better life. Her biggest ambition is to count on a storefront since at the moment she sells as a street vendor. In this instance, she requested the loan to buy rice, meat and vegetables. 

The group “Paz Y Progreso” is grateful for the support provided and they are committed to continue working well. Guadalupe is the second from the right, wearing a white hat.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Hog-raising is a primary activity of Elvie, to help her husband in generating income. She is 41 years old and blessed with three children. Due to hardships of living, she and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better living. 

With this regard, Elvie wants to improve her business in order to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs. Through this loan, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs.
